recipes.title: Surf N Turf Couscous
recipes.description: After a long day of work, lectures or school, the last thing we want to be fiddling around with is dinner. So ideally... we're looking for something that can be made from start to finish in under 10 mins and still tastes the nuts.

recipes.title: Spicy Chicken Soup
recipes.description: A spicy chicken soup made for a sore throat!

recipes.title: Chocolate Orange Sponge
recipes.description: Many people are pretty scared and put off by the thought of baking. It can seem a little tricky. But after such a positive response from our cake in a mug video we wondered what other microwave versions we could suggest. This is another great one if there are a few of you wanting to be fed!

recipes.title: Butternutkale Pie
recipes.description: This is seriously one of the most tasty things that have been created in this kitchen in a while. It combines two of my most recent favorites; butternut and kale (and also cheese, can't go wrong with that). Serves 6 people (or if you are hungry like me, 3)

recipes.title: Jammie Dodgers
recipes.description: Do you love a classic nostalgic biscuit like a Jammie Dodger? How about making your own and personalising them... the best way to use up JAM!

recipes.title: Masala Chai Creme Brulee
recipes.description: When a classic french dessert takes it's influences from the subtle and well balanced spices of India you get something to behold. Served with these macaroon-style cookies made of pistachio and almond it's a sublime end to a meal.

recipes.title: Italian Veg Gorgonzola Pasta Bake
recipes.description: my shopping today ended up with some italian rare veggies, I haven`t seen here not before. Left over cooked pasta goes good with it.

recipes.title: Fruit Smoothies
recipes.description: If you're looking for a recipe that will make your skin and hair glow, then these smoothies are spot on. Raw smoothies and packed full of so many of the right vitamins and minerals they are both healthy and tasty... as requested by Bubzbeauty.

recipes.title: Epic Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Not a lot beats chocolate cake. Especially our monster SORTEDfood one. Layers of moist chocolate sponge drizzled with coffee syrup, sandwiched with cocoa buttercream topped with lashings of dark chocolate ganache and honeycomb. The best Birthday surprise.

recipes.title: Smokey Bbq Beans
recipes.description: During dark winter evenings there is nothing more comforting than a Jacket Potato with crispy golden skin, a steaming fluffy inside and lashings of topping. This is SORTED's answer to exactly that... cooked outside beside the fire.
ingredients: 4 jacket potatoes, King Edward are perfect
ingredients-original: 4 jacket potatoes, King Edward are perfect

recipes.title: Turkey And Mushroom Stroganoff
recipes.description: A whole roast turkey is perfect for that festive family meal but there's almost certainly going to be some left over. If you're looking for something more interesting to do with it than a turkey sandwich then try this.

recipes.title: Apple And Berry Strudel
recipes.description: Musician and performer Loick Essien requested an apple dessert from us. Not only does he have our apple flapjack crumble recipe to have a go at but we also cooked up an apple and berry strudel for him.

recipes.title: Banana Bread
recipes.description: The best way to use super-duper overripe bananas.

recipes.title: Meatballs And Spaghetti
recipes.description: Spaghetti and Meatballs is so iconic we wonder how come we've not done it before. A super simple but damn tasty roasted tomato sauce finishes these flavoursome meatballs off a treat. And throughout, plenty of your suggestions make these quite simply, the best!

recipes.title: Apple Parsnip  Chestnut Soup
recipes.description: A winter warmer packed with festive flavours!

recipes.title: Grilled Gammon And Apple
recipes.description: As our New Year's Resolution continues, food and diet has to be put front of mind. Eat less, eat a balanced diet, and exercise more. Easier said than done... unless the food tastes great. This quick, simple, midweek meal is carb-free but full of flavour.

recipes.title: Christmas Gingerbread Men
recipes.description: The smell of baking gingerbread has to be one of the best Christmas smells. Then the process of cutting and shaping them, followed by the decorating makes for great fun in the kitchen with friends, family or the kids.

recipes.title: Party Dips
recipes.description: At SORTED we love a good party... and it goes without saying that whenever we get together with friends we have to include food! So this is a selection of simple but tasty dips (and a few homemade straws) to put out and let people help themselves to.

recipes.title: The Breakfast Cookie
recipes.description: This is the only cookie you will ever want/need. Packed with nutrition and delicious bursts of chocolate -- you can eat it ANY time. And I promise you will want to ;)

recipes.title: Pork Ramen Bowl
recipes.description: This is Japanese fast food at its best... good, healthy, nutritious and yummy. A bowl of steaming pork broth seasoned with miso and soy sauce poured over ramen noodles, shredded pork, beansprouts and a whole bunch of other bits. Finished with soy, mirin and sake marinated eggs... a winner all round!

recipes.title: Baileys Yule Log
recipes.description: Not everyone is a fan of traditional christmas pudding, but everyone loves chocolate right? This chocolate swiss roll recipe, decorated to look like a fallen festive log is a chocoholic's heaven.

recipes.title: Belgian Yeasted Waffles
recipes.description:
This may or may not have been my dinner tonight #yolo - so yum and super easy - topped with vanilla ice cream strawberries and dusted with icing sugar
N.B. Waffle iron/maker required
Makes around 4 waffles

recipes.title: Ultimate Ham Egg And Chips
recipes.description: With the addition of hollandaise this might be the best ham egg and chips dish in the world!!

recipes.title: Mince Pies
recipes.description: We briefly borrowed a kitchen at the Sony studios and cooked some festive treats with Will Young. We had a go at warming up some mulled cider and baking our very own mince pies with a twist. Easy, cheap, homemade mince pies perfect for family and friends.
ingredients: 1 shot spiced rum per serving glass
ingredients-original: 1 shot spiced rum per serving glass

recipes.title: Steak Sandwich
recipes.description: Mr Weebl, the king of animation, sent us a video request that we couldn't ignore. To use up his cows we suggest the ultimate steak sandwich topped off with a homemade mustard mayonnaise and sticky red onions.

recipes.title: Chicken Tikka Masala Fries
recipes.description: a northern English delicacy made a million times better!!

recipes.title: Massive Meatballs In Tomato Sauce
recipes.description: This is one of those things that doesn’t look even close to as good as they taste. Because this isn’t the best looking dish, I have to admit, but they taste amazing and it is so worth giving it a try, they will disappear faster than you can blink :)

recipes.title: Sesame Prawn Toast
recipes.description:
Chinese food has become a staple takeaway meal, and why not? It's fantasically delicious! Levi Roots joins us in the kitchen to cook our sesame prawn toast recipe, which is smothered with prawns and served with a fresh, zingy beansprout salad. 

This will beat the Chinese takeaway every time!
ingredients: 1 glug sweet chilli sauce to dip
ingredients-original: 1 glug sweet chilli sauce to dip

recipes.title: Caramel And Marshmallow Sweet Potato Fries
recipes.description: Open your mind. Then open your mouth.

recipes.title: Rice Krispie Treats
recipes.description: Remember making these as a kid? We do! We've also taken on board a whole bunch of your suggestions and brought them right up to date with a little twist of s'mores about them.

recipes.title: Venison Burger And Chips
recipes.description: An epic burger with some festive flavours... venison pattie, mulled wine inspired onion chutney and a few other bits from the christmas cheese board.

recipes.title: Fish In A Bag
recipes.description: An awesomely simple way to cook fish... seal in all the flavour... in a bag! It has a fancy French name... don't worry about that... trust us it's delicious!
ingredients: 1 handful steamed green veg or salad
ingredients-original: 1 handful steamed green veg or salad

recipes.title: Chocolate And Pistachio Fondant
recipes.description:
Chocolate puddings are the easiest way to a person's heart and this fondant dessert will do just that. 

This chocolate fondant recipe is made well ahead of time and baked to perfection to make an individual chocolate pudding that oozes with molten chocolate. This will leave you speechless.

recipes.title: Cornbread Muffins
recipes.description: These cornbread muffins are a recipe my grandmother revamped from a 1950 Atlanta Journal recipe. They are the mainstay cornbread recipe in our family (can be cooked in a cast iron skillet instead of muffin tins as well!!) Full disclosure, I'm in the savory cornbread camp! ;)

recipes.title: Fusion Rice Paper Rolls
recipes.description: Warning: these are not authentic Vietnamese rice paper rolls.  I used whatever I had in the fridge so be adventurous!

recipes.title: Ribs And Wings
recipes.description: What better way to enjoy sporting events than to get your mates round with some sticky ribs and spicy chicken wings to get your your mouth watering? These slow-cooked pork ribs with a homemade sticky marinade and super spicy chicken wings are perfect munch with mates.

recipes.title: Gingerbread Granola
recipes.description: In two days it's first advent and the festive spirit have began to sneak up on me, making this gingerbread granola the perfect way to start-it all up without going all the way. This made my whole house smell like christmas but it sills gives the granola a subtile taste of gingerbread so if you like the flavor to knock your socks off, just put in double the amount of spices.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed seeds (or just more oats)
ingredients-original: 1 cup mixed seeds (or just more oats)

recipes.title: Thai Green Curry
recipes.description: A homemade curry is a fine thing, but very few are quicker and tastier than a Thai green curry. Here we use our version of a homemade Thai curry paste, cooked out with lashings of coconut milk and then finished with all the authentic Thai flavouring.
ingredients: 1 tsp brown sugar (palm sugar if you can get it)
ingredients-original: 1 tsp brown sugar (palm sugar if you can get it)

recipes.title: Tortilla Lasagne
recipes.description: Vegetarian food can often be very uninspiring. Are you stuck with the same cliched options when eating out in restaurants, pubs or with friends? How about turning a common idea on it's head and creating something new?

recipes.title: Profiteroles
recipes.description:
Profiteroles are the quintessential indulgent treat. They are dainty, delicate and divine mouthfuls of choux buns filled with cream. 

So if you want something chocolatey to impress someone special, then give these cream puffs a go.

recipes.title: Ginger Chocolate Chip Skillet Cookie
recipes.description: How come I never made a skillet cookie before? I mean seriously, it's a giant cookie!! (I feel like a child on the inside) Okay, this is the quickest recipe you will ever find, it's literally a dump everything in and stir, which is aaaalways a good thing on my book. If you never tried anything with ginger and chocolate before, then you are missing out, the flavors just go together like a dream and it is no exception in this case. The result is a cookie that is crispy and yet chewy in the middle, plus, it's just awesome to look at hehehe If you want more details about this recipe, check out this week's blog post on Café, Cacau e Canela, the link is in my bio! Enjoy it, guys :3
ingredients: 200 g (1 cup or 2 sticks) butter, unsalted
ingredients-original: 200 g (1 cup or 2 sticks) butter, unsalted

recipes.title: Baci Di Dama
recipes.description: In Italian, "lady's kisses": buttery little nut cookies sandwiched with chocolate.

recipes.title: Naan Bread Pizza
recipes.description: Fusion foods are some of the best: taking the best bits of one food culture and merging it with another. In this recipe designed for fitness guru Omar Isuf, SORTED takes a homemade naan bread recipe and then uses that as a base to make an awesome pizza.

recipes.title: Yoghurt Marinated Chicken
recipes.description: Tender chicken with a real kick, yes please! This is just one of those dishes I pull out of my sleeve when I have no idea on what to cook because it always taste good, it isn't much fuss about it and taste event better the day after. And the mushrooms is completely addictive.

recipes.title: Lemon Meringue Pie Pancakes
recipes.description:
Everybody loves pancakes, and with Shrove Tuesday just around the corner, when better to test out your tossing skills!

Best of all, pancakes are perfect for any meal, savoury or sweet!

recipes.title: Swiss Cheese Fondue
recipes.description: A big bubbling pot of molten cheese with bread, potatoes, tomatoes and eggs to dunk straight in... now that's a party right? Not just an awesome swiss cheese fondue but also a recipe for homemade fougasse bread.

recipes.title: Clementine Meringue Wreath
recipes.description: A great centrepiece dessert for the festive season. it gets a wow long before before taste it. The spiced port syrup and clementine segments, over whipped cream and a crunchy, chewy, meringue.
ingredients: a few sprigs of fresh mint
ingredients-original: a few sprigs of fresh mint

recipes.title: Mexican Chicken Pie
recipes.description: Chicken pie is a great excuse to bring people together... OR... having people together is a great excuse to cook up this chicken pie. Either way, you'll love it! With an enhanced pie crust, phenomenal filling including tangy tomato salsa and served with corn and greens... it puts a smile on everybody's face!
ingredients: 225 g salted butter, cold and cubed
ingredients-original: 225 g salted butter, cold and cubed

recipes.title: Choc Chip Chilli
recipes.description: Chilli con carne is the perfect comfort food.  It's warming, tasty and a little bit spicy! The best thing is it's individual, everyone's chilli is different!

recipes.title: Ring Doughnuts
recipes.description: The smell of fresh doughnuts is something that nobody can resist and yet they are so tricky to make at home, right? WRONG! Our doughnut recipe uses a secret ingredient – you'll have to try it to believe it – that makes sugared ring doughnuts, and yum yums, which are great when glazed.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodle Ice Cream Cone
recipes.description: Okay, we know the internet will love this one... it has chocolate lined waffle cones, snickerdoodle inspired ice cream, chocolate cookie dough AND cute dogs! Enjoy!

recipes.title: Mulled Wine And Cinnamon Mousse Cake
recipes.description: A decadent dessert packed with the flavours of Christmas - what's not to love?

recipes.title: Santas Porridge
recipes.description: One of Sweden's christmas-traditions is “santa’s porridge” or “tomtegröt” in Swedish. When americans put out cookies and milk for santa, Swedes put out porridge. A tradition that belongs from the nordic folk belief that on every farm, a magic elf lived to look after the farm and the animals.  To thank him for his work (because you didn’t want to upset this little man, the tale says that if he didn’t got butter in his porridge, he would kill one of the cows) the farmer put out a bowl of porridge. We still eat a lot of this porridge during christmas-time, and some of us still put out a bowl for our magic little helper.

recipes.title: Beans On Toast
recipes.description: Everybody can make beans on toast... it's a student staple and a homely comfort... Just what the doctor ordered! But with our little bit of Mexican inspiration and the help of Tom Ska we prove that this version goes off with a

recipes.title: Polenta Pizza
recipes.description: Polenta is such a cheap and versatile grain... [sweet](chocpolenta) or [savoury](porkandpolenta) In this recipe we transform it into the base of a pizza-style dish. Start-to-finish the dish is prepared in less than half an hour and is just as good cold th

recipes.title: Sticky Toffee Pudding
recipes.description:
Sticky Toffee Pudding, it evens sounds amazing.  It's definitely up there with the best when it comes to comfort foods!

A dark sponge made with sticky dried dates, and served warm with a glossy butterscotch sauce and a dollop of ice cream... HEAVEN!!
ingredients: 200 g dried dates and stoned dates
ingredients-original: 200 g dried dates and stoned dates

recipes.title: Cornish Pasty
recipes.description: If you've ever visited Cornwall then you'll know why we got so excited by this recipe. It's a traditional dish, perfect hand-held food for the beach, although with some very strict guidelines. Well this is our version, as tasty as the original but but made in the SORTED kitchen and to your liking.

recipes.title: Red Velvet Berry Cake In A Glass
recipes.description: Red Velvet cupcakes with a cream cheese frosting are so delicious as they are that they don’t need any vamping up with alcohol. However, because I like to be different, I decided to serve these red velvet cupcakes in glasses, topped with a whipped cream cheese and berries. If you absolutely do want to add a splash of booze to this recipe, a few spoonfuls of champagne in the cream cheese frosting will do the trick.

recipes.title: Easy Vegan Banana Oat Pancakes
recipes.description:
3 easy ingredients
Also doesn't have to be vegan and you can use dairy if you really wanted :)
Quick easy and delicious I topped mine with granola and maple syrup

recipes.title: Rhubarb Crumble Cake
recipes.description: You can't beat a good old fashioned dessert, and this recipe combines 3 of the best sweet ingredients - rhubarb, cake and crumble!
ingredients: 1 tbsp demerara sugar for the rhubarb
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp demerara sugar for the rhubarb

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon In Zatar Sauce With Pasta
recipes.description: I found the zatar seasoning at the market in Aqaba, Jordan. Since this trip I love to use this flavour in many dishes and on fresh baked flat bread. It tastes great with all kinds of smoked fish or meat, so I used it for the salmon pasta sauce.

recipes.title: Coconut Crusted Chicken
recipes.description:
Chicken nuggets were one of our favourite meals whilst we were growing up! So we decided to recreate them with some exotic, Jamaican flavours - and we're going to bake them to make them healthier! 

Top that off with a fresh, zingy and slightly spicy pa

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Gratin
recipes.description:
Potato gratin is a classic french dish and there are so many versions. Dauphinoise is perhaps the most popular and this recipe is SORTED's twist on that. 

Made with layers of sweet potato and white potato and finished with an infused cream it's baked and served with marinated and pan-roasted pork fillet and savoy cabbage. 

A surprisingly cheap family dish that oozes flavour...

recipes.title: Pumpkin  Ginger Soup
recipes.description: Desperately trying to avoid the terrifying flu thats been hovering over all school with everything gingery, garlicy and packed with vitamin C. Like this soup.

recipes.title: Choc Chip Banana Bread Waffles
recipes.description:
Saturday morning treats - not too sweet so as always I love some maple syrup to drown it in :) Waffle iron/maker required 
You could probably turn this recipe into a pancake batter as well but I haven't tried this
Inspired by minimalist baker

recipes.title: 3 Of The Easiest Pastries
recipes.description: You know those fancy things you buy in coffee shops with your hot drink? Well we're going to show you how to make 3 impressive looking ones without actually 'making' anything. All using shop bought stuff.
ingredients: 2 rolls of ready rolled puff pastry
2 tbsp icing sugar, for glace icing
ingredients-original: 2 rolls of ready rolled puff pastry
2 tbsp icing sugar, for glace icing

recipes.title: Chourico Croquettes
recipes.description:
The first of three recipes we cooked at the [Real Food Festival](http://realfoodfestival.co.uk) on London's Southbank... 

This is a great way of using up leftover mashed potato, and introduces the great flavour of ChouriÃ§o. 

A perfect starter that
ingredients: 2 l vegetable oil for the fryer
ingredients-original: 2 l vegetable oil for the fryer

recipes.title: Savoury Galettes
recipes.description: The second of our recipes from the Southbank at the Real Food Festival. Pancakes are often associated as sweet dishes and yet these wholemeal galettes act as an ideal casing for a savoury snack.

recipes.title: Passionfruit Pudding
recipes.description: Our third recipe from the [Real Food Festival](http://realfoodfestival.co.uk) on the London's Southbank. An impressive looking dessert using a British made passionfruit curd. It's so simple that you can barely call it a recipe... but it never fails to del

recipes.title: Chewy Chocolate Meringues
recipes.description: These meringues are crispy on the outside and have an inside that's almost like a chocolate mousse.  I took a batch to Thanksgiving dinner and they disappeared so fast...I'm glad I left a few at home!

recipes.title: Chicken Poutine
recipes.description: How has it taken us so long to make this... so many requests for the Canadian favourite of Poutine. We don't just do it though, we go all out and make our own awesome gravy and even include some slow-cooked confit chicken and maple roasted carrots.

recipes.title: Sweet And Sour Prawns With Eggfried Rice
recipes.description: Our version of the takeaway classic... a homemade sweet 'n' sour sauce made using a few authentic ingredients, crispy battered prawns and egg-fried rice.
ingredients: 140 g tin of water chestnuts, drained
ingredients-original: 140 g tin of water chestnuts, drained

recipes.title: Peach Melba Galette
recipes.description: A beautiful golden round of pastry with crispy, sugared free-form edges crammed with the iconic flavours of the classic peach melba dessert.

recipes.title: Tuna Katsu Curry
recipes.description: A fancy twist on the popular chicken katsu curry that has become such a favourite in the UK. Served with a homemade Japanese curry sauce, crispy panko breaded tuna steaks, pickled veg and some fluffy dashi rice.

recipes.title: Hot Cross Bun And Butter Pudding
recipes.description: Bread and butter pudding is a classic British dessert. We've given it a SORTED twist using leftover hot cross buns and added some banana. No more throwing away dried or stale buns. Great with old pastries as well!

recipes.title: Bangers And Mash
recipes.description: Have you ever seen a version of bangers and mash that looks so colourful, inviting and tempting? This version is with roasted root veg, red onion gravy and garlic tarragon mangetout.

recipes.title: Sticky Toffee Bundt Cake
recipes.description: This NEVER fails to get a "wow" at the table... a huge sticky toffee cake in a ring doused in rich, glossy, sticky toffee sauce and served with a sweet vanilla creme anglaise.

recipes.title: Lemon Drizzle Cake
recipes.description: Lemon drizzle cake is the way to go... a seriously sticky moist sponge (ours has extra blueberry explosions too!) topped with a oozing icing and some candied peel. The hint of tarragon in this version is a really nice touch too.

recipes.title: Smoothie Bowl
recipes.description: Smoothie bowls are a huge food trend and we've given 'em a SORTED spin. We've got three great ideas that'll help you suss how to make them. They taste amazing and are healthy.  Avocado for days.

recipes.title: Carbonara Ravioli
recipes.description: This is very clever... although we can't take much credit for it. An old Italian favourite with a slight twist based on all your suggestions. Homemade pasta crafted into large raviolo (singular for ravioli) and filled with a Parmesan pork ring, smoky pancetta and a whole egg yolk. It's self-saucing from the inside!

recipes.title: Vietnamese Spring Rolls
recipes.description: These rice paper rolled spring rolls are super fresh, pretty healthy and seriously moreish. With so much crispy pork, peanut, sesame, soy and pickled veg they are an absolute winner and remind us of Vietnam!

recipes.title: Hot Buffalo Chicken Wings
recipes.description: Perfect food for a big game or a movie night... hot hot hot chicken wings with fresh crunchy celery and a creamy blue cheese dip.
ingredients: 60 ml Frank's Hot sauce (Instead of Tabasco)
ingredients-original: 60 ml Frank's Hot sauce (Instead of Tabasco)

recipes.title: Red Velvet Cupcakes
recipes.description:
Red velvet cakes and cupcakes are probably our most requested recipes... so here they are!

This recipe creates awesome homemade cupcakes that will really impress your friends. We've used leftover sponge instead of sprinkles for that professional finish

recipes.title: Brandy Chocolate Truffles
recipes.description: The secret to my scrumptious Brandy Chocolate Truffles is easy- using just the right amount of chocolate and double cream, and cooling the chocolate mixture in the fridge, NOT room temperature, so that it reaches that deliciously thick, fudgey consistency. The splash of brandy adds just the right amount of heat, and rolling the truffles in chopped nuts or desiccated coconut adds a satisfying crunch. These Brandy Chocolate Truffles go down particularly well at Christmas time, but of course, can be enjoyed any time of the year!

recipes.title: Thyme Polenta With Stem Broccoli
recipes.description: Served with some marinated pork steaks as quick dinner

recipes.title: Xmas Cake In A Mug
recipes.description: IT'S CHRISTMAS!!! This Christmas FridgeCam takes a festive look at one of our favourite and easiest recipes - Cake in a Mug! A very merry Christmas from all of us at SORTED! Hope you eat yourselves silly :-D Upload your cake in a mugs to Instagram using the hashtag #SORTEDcakeinmug

recipes.title: Skewered Minty Spring Lamb
recipes.description: Fed up with wasting your money on a greasy kebab with no flavour? This healthier alternative with a mint pesto and haloumi cheese and is super quick to make. Served with a zingy chickpea salad and is great to make ahead of time and cook when needed. A per
ingredients: 500 g spring lamb fillet, loin or leg cut into chunks
ingredients-original: 500 g spring lamb fillet, loin or leg cut into chunks

recipes.title: Toblerone Cheesecake
recipes.description: This recipe for Toblerone cheesecake takes the biscuit and the crown for being the coolest out there. Why? The novelty of making them in a pyramid shape! It's a dessert you can't resist so get cooking...

recipes.title: Last Minute Christmas Cake
recipes.description: A traditional Christmas cake can take months to perfect... you need to start in about September to leave enough time to dowse in booze. Not this one though. Ours you can do in less than a day!

recipes.title: Tapenade Chicken With Ratatouille
recipes.description:
Olives, parmesan, basil, tomato and Mediteranean vegetables... classic flavours that work so well together. Add that to some chicken with an olive tapenade, and you're on to a winner!

This colourful dish will excite your tastebuds and is surprisingly e

recipes.title: Espresso Martini Cupcakes
recipes.description: Perfect for coffee, vodka and/or chocolate lovers! The prep does take a bit of time but trust me, it is truly worth it.

recipes.title: Cheesy Nachos With Dips
recipes.description:
Sharing platters are a great way to feed people at a get together with friends or family and are perfect for a night in. 

These nachos do just that, a mixture of corn chips, melting cheese and Jalapenos, plus our own homemade dips make them really more-ish!
ingredients: 1 wedge Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese, grated
1 small jar jalapeno peppers, drained and sliced
ingredients-original: 1 wedge Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese, grated
1 small jar jalapeno peppers, drained and sliced

recipes.title: Thai Beef Massaman Curry
recipes.description:
This homemade curry is so simple and easy to make. It's packed with potatoes so you don't fork out on too much beef. The slow cooked meat melts in your mouth and is a dish that will really impress. 

Go on, beat the takeaway and make this for yourself!
ingredients: 2 tbsp peanut oil, or veg oil
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp peanut oil, or veg oil

recipes.title: Panettone Bread Pudding
recipes.description: If you are not familiar with Panettone, it’s basically a sweet, enriched bread, with crystallized fruit throughout. It has its own distinct flavour, due to the panettone essence, and the texture varies from country to country, I believe. The italian – and original – version tends to be drier and less sweet than the brazilian one, which is quite soft and buttery, both delicious, nonetheless. We also have the habit to switch the crystallized fruit for chocolate chips, dearly called Chocottone (I know, creative), or even make a blend of dried fruit and chocolate. Perfect for the holidays, I used Chocottone because I absolutely despise those mini crystallized fruits, and because.. well, chocolate. Enough said. You could, of course, use traditional Panettone, if you are so inclined, but that’s solely on you ;)
ingredients: 400 g (14 oz) panettone or chocottone (best if it’s a few days old)
130 g (3/4 cup) demerara sugar (demerara sugar is less sweet, so if you are using regular granulated sugar, I suggest using only 90g, or 1/2 cup)
1 tbsp instant coffee, or the zest of 1/2 an orange (or use both!)
ingredients-original: 400 g (14 oz) panettone or chocottone (best if it’s a few days old)
130 g (3/4 cup) demerara sugar (demerara sugar is less sweet, so if you are using regular granulated sugar, I suggest using only 90g, or 1/2 cup)
1 tbsp instant coffee, or the zest of 1/2 an orange (or use both!)

recipes.title: Smoky Chicken Enchiladas
recipes.description: Fancy a change from fajitas? This baked enchilada recipe is great to make in advance.  The wraps are packed full of beans and vegetables, making it healthy and filling too!

recipes.title: Peanut Brittle
recipes.description: The perfect Southern confectionary treat. Peanut brittle is a treat that I've grown up munching on and love to make myself, or a batch makes the perfect gift! :)

recipes.title: Smoked Haddock And Pasta Frittata
recipes.description:
Smoked fish and fennel...what a winning combination. This frittata recipe is perfect for making the day before and tastes great hot or cold. 

Perfect for lunchboxes, buffets or to take on picnics. This is an ideal recipe for using leftover pasta.

recipes.title: Nankhatai Snowballs
recipes.description: Indian shortbread made with icing sugar and sugar.

recipes.title: Bolinas
recipes.description: Goan semolina, coconut and cardamom cookies.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Ramen Noodles
recipes.description:
This is a fresh stir fry using awesome teriyaki flavours. This recipe is so quick and easy that you will be wondering why you haven't made it before. 

We guarantee it will be a hell of a lot tastier than ready made noodles!

recipes.title: Ice Chocolate

recipes.title: Porridge 2 Ways

recipes.title: Baileys And Double Chocolate Cheesecakes
recipes.description: I adore the taste of Baileys Irish Cream in a cheesecake. I prefer the taste of the Baileys to be strong, but often find that too much Baileys can make the cheesecake filling rather sloppy. So this is my new and improved recipe for perfectly neat- and still ultra delicious- Baileys and Double Chocolate Mini Cheesecakes. This time, I used a crunchy Oreo base, with less cream and more icing sugar in the filling, topped with a crispy Oreo topping. You can leave out the Baileys if you prefer, or substitute the Irish Cream with 2 tablespoons of Crema di Limoncello, to put a spin on a classic lemon cheesecake. This recipe makes 4 mini cheesecakes.
ingredients: 150 g Oreo biscuits, filling taken out, crushed into crumbs
ingredients-original: 150 g Oreo biscuits, filling taken out, crushed into crumbs

recipes.title: Italian Chicken Burger

Chicken burgers are fantastic by themselves... We take it to the next level by adding pesto and mozzarella.

Easy to make and perfect for a mid week balanced meal, this burger is much better than any takeaway!

recipes.title: Lavender Latte

recipes.title: Broccoli  Bean Soup

recipes.title: Salted Caramel And Chocolate Tart

But they were not cheap, so mothers and grandmothers started making their own versions at home. I guess every family has it's own version. Homemade version is cheap, really easy and quick to make.

Parsnip... in a cake? Hear us out...

Carrot cake is one of the most popular cakes around, and this takes it to a whole new level! The parsnips add a natural sweetness to the cake, meaning it ends up moist, fruity and delicious!

recipes.title: Soy Chicken Singapore Noodles

recipes.title: Orange And Cardamom Creme Brulee

Crème brûlée always looks fantastic in a restaurant, but can be scary to make at home, right?

Wrong!  This easy recipe for the classic french dessert is flavoured with orange and cardomom. And just wait until your guests find the secret orange segments at the bottom of the dish!

recipes.title: Mint Chocolate Souffl

Do you enjoy rich and indulgent desserts on restaurant menus but don't think you can recreate them at home? 

This soufflé is stupidly easy and only uses 5 different ingredients. The winning combination of chocolate and mint gives this recipe an a

recipes.title: Crispy Lamb Moussaka

This Greek style dish is packed full of flavour but is much easier to make than a traditional moussaka. 

We've removed the white sauce and replaced it with a feta, mint and breadcrumb topping to create that fantastic crispy texture!

Do you throw stale bread and over-ripe tomtaoes in the bin? Not anymore! 

This classic Panzanella salad combines those ingredients with Italian flavours to make up a fresh dish full of the joys of summer!

A roast dinner is the perfect Sunday meal - but it can be too heavy in the Summer.

So we've come up with this Lemon and Thyme Roast, which is much lighter and a hell of a lot easier than a traditional roast.  The fruity mash and roasted root vegetables will ensure all the family will love it!

recipes.title: Turmeric Apricot And Ginger Cake
recipes.description: Four. Four recipes with turmeric here. I'm starting to think I have a disease... Oh well, on to the recipe. Since I’ve cut out milk from my diet I have been making my own nut milks (Brazil nuts + walnuts became a favorite), but the problem is to always find new things to make with the leftover pulp, which leads me to this cake. I call this a pudding cake because it’s quite dense and moist, due to the fact that it’s gluten-free (oh did I mention that?) and bathed in a ginger-honey syrup, which just complements the turmeric flavour beautifully and takes things to a whole other level. For more details and a few more photos, check out this week's post on my blog. Enjoy, you lovely people ;)
ingredients: (For the nut milk) 212 g (7.5 oz) nuts of choice, I went for 122 g (4.3 oz) of walnuts and 90 g (3.2 oz) of almonds, but use whatever you like
(For the nut milk) 660 ml (2 3/4 cups) water
(For the cake) 165 g (1 cup packed, 5.8 oz) nut milk pulp
(For the cake) 55 g (2/3 cup, 2 oz) rolled oats, use gluten-free if needed
(For the cake) 55 g (1/3 cup + 2 tablespoons, 2 oz) buckwheat flour, or any other flour
(For the cake) 1/2 tsp bicarbonate of soda
(For the cake) 1/4 tsp ground black pepper
(For the cake) 160 ml (2/3 cup) nut milk
(For the cake) 80 ml (1/3 cup) vegetable oil
(For the cake) 90 g (3.2 oz) dried apricots
(For the cake) 95 g (1/3 cup, 3.35 oz) honey, or any other liquid sweetener
(For the cake) 3 eggs (to keep it vegan, mix 3 tablespoons of ground flax/chia seeds + 9 tablespoons of water and leave it for a few minutes to thicken)
(For the syrup) 35 g (1 1/2 tablespoons, 1.2 oz) honey, or any other liquid sweetener
(For the syrup) 10 g (0.35 oz or about a 2 cm knob) fresh ginger, grated or roughly chopped

recipes.title: Famine Soup
recipes.description:
First off, I didn't make this to look or taste nice. Today I would like to share a recipe I have found, which belongs to Alexis Soyer. After I started writing my dissertation about Food Media, I came across the history of Soyer. He was a Frenchman who moved to England with the best intentions, from educating the malnourished Englishmen to inventing tools to help feed the British Army. I believe Soyer is an unsung hero of British Culinary History, especially when it comes to famine soup. During the Great Irish Famine in April 1847, he invented a soup kitchen and was asked by the Government to go to Ireland to implement his idea. This was opened in Dublin and his "famine soup" was served to thousands of the poor for free.

This is that soup;
ingredients: 200 g butter (was meant to be dripping)
ingredients-original: 200 g butter (was meant to be dripping)

recipes.description: As you know, I love discovering and experimenting with delicious vegan alternatives to my favourite foods. The vegan alternatives can taste so much better than the dairy-packed originals, and this recipe is no different! recipes.title: Salted Caramel And Bacon Popcorn
recipes.description: I made Salted Caramel and Bacon Popcorn for my guy as an early Valentines present. He can’t have dairy, so rustling up a pudding he can eat is always a bit of a challenge. It was also how I got into making dairy-free baked goods! This time, however, I wanted to stay away from a vegan-inspired dessert and have a go at making my own popcorn with a twist. Behold: my recipe for sweet, crunchy and utterly delicious Salted Caramel and Bacon Popcorn recipe was born… The salted caramel-ness was made using maple syrup and a sprinkling of kosher salt. For loads of crunch, I crisped the bacon until most of the fat had gone, saving a little leftover to mix in with the popcorn at the end. I also chopped up pecan nuts and walnuts- the nutty flavours taste delicious with some cinnamon and cayenne pepper. If you’re making these as a DIY food gift for Valentines, pop into a jar (Tiger have loads of cute jars to choose from) and tie some red and white bakers twine around the lid, with a fancy bow attached. Voila! Your Valentines Salted Caramel and Bacon Popcorn present is good to go.

To jazz it up, try my recipe for Red Velvet Hot Chocolate. The rich chocolate is still there, but with sweet tangs of vanilla and cream cheese, as well as Red Velvet’s trademark vivid red. recipes.title: Oatcrusted Chicken  Roasted Chickpea Salad
recipes.description: Healthy baked chicken and a tasty chickpea salad. Protein and veg.
ingredients: 100 g rolled oats, whole or ground
ingredients-original: 100 g rolled oats, whole or ground

recipes.title: Dark Chocolate Coffee  Cinnamon Babka
recipes.description: Enriched bread swirled with a dark chocolate, coffee and cinnamon filling. Topped with a pecan streusel.
ingredients: 4 medium egg yolks, reserve 1 egg white for egg wash
ingredients-original: 4 medium egg yolks, reserve 1 egg white for egg wash

recipes.title: Black Forest Chocolate Fondant
recipes.description: Rich, hot, dark chocolate cake with an oozy chocolate centre, drizzled with a brandy-spiked cherry coulis. Perfect for wooing that special someone on Valentine's Day!
ingredients: 75 g butter, chopped, plus extra for greasing
200 g fresh dark cherries, pitted and halves (coulis)
ingredients-original: 75 g butter, chopped, plus extra for greasing
200 g fresh dark cherries, pitted and halves (coulis)

recipes.title: Braised Rabbit In Red Wine
recipes.description: Served with green beans and Baguette. Use a whole rabbit and with the pieces you do not eat, make a tasty broth. More about how to prepare a whole rabbit and use up the leftovers you can find on my blog.

recipes.title: Lemon Polenta Plaice
recipes.description: Do you tend to eat your fish in breadcrumbs or batter? Well how about trying polenta instead! This recipe is a great way to enjoy white fish. It is light, refreshing and the polenta goes really crispy when cooked. Served on top of two simple salads it mak

recipes.title: Champagne Rose Cupcakes
recipes.description: My ultimate valentines gift.. Beautiful, elegant, tasty and CHEAP!!!

recipes.title: Greek Salmon Parcels
recipes.description: Fed up of having salmon the same way? This version sandwiches a unique homemade pesto of spinach, feta, pine nuts and honey within a crisp buttery filo pastry parcel. Hmmm...delicious.
ingredients: 2 salmon fillets, skinned (approx 120g in weight each)
2 small potatoes to cut and roast
ingredients-original: 2 salmon fillets, skinned (approx 120g in weight each)
2 small potatoes to cut and roast

recipes.title: Mint Oreo Brownies
recipes.description: Fudgy brownies with a layer of Oreo cookies!

recipes.title: Jumbo Chicken Spring Rolls
recipes.description: We all love the popular chinese spring roll but not many of you would make it at home. Unless of course you use the SORTED method. An easier, healthier version which is just as crispy and tasty.

recipes.title: Summer Garden Risotto
recipes.description: A vegetarian risotto that uses some of the best garden veg. Crammed full of sweet peas, broad beans and asparagus it's spot on for the summer. Or... why not cheat the system and make things easier by using frozen peas and beans... we did! :D
ingredients: 1 vegetable or chicken stock cube (with approx 1 litre hot water)
ingredients-original: 1 vegetable or chicken stock cube (with approx 1 litre hot water)

recipes.title: Salted Caramel Brioche Twist
recipes.description: A sweetened and enriched dough and a very simple but effective rolling and twisting technique creates this beautiful salted caramel brioche twist.

recipes.title: Hunters Stew
recipes.description: This slow-cooked hearty hunter's stew, otherwise known as bigos, is one of Poland's national dishes. Combining pork, sausage, cabbage and sauerkraut with a bunch of woodland flavours it's sure to sort you right out after a busy day!

recipes.title: Spiral Filo Pie
recipes.description: This looks great when served up to friends or family... a crispy golden spiral pie made from filo pastry and crammed full of all the delicious things. Spinach, feta, pine nuts, lentils, rice and fresh herbs... a true vegetarian feast!

recipes.title: Crunchy Honeycomb With Chocolate
recipes.description: Did you know honeycomb only uses 4 ingredients and takes less than 5 minutes to make? That is how easy it is! This recipe is great for digging out those unused fondue sets or to knock up a sharing dessert platter for friends. Just make the honeycomb, leav

recipes.title: Carrot And Potato Mash And Merguez
recipes.description: served with lamb/beef Merguez sausages and Bourbon Balsamico onions

recipes.title: Mint Chocolate Brownies
recipes.description: This traybake brownie is spectacular because it's crispy on the bottom, gooey in the middle and has a velvety smooth ganache to finish... embellished with raspberries, white chocolate and after dinner mints.

recipes.title: Granita Dessert Shots
recipes.description: This refreshing dessert is surprisingly easy and perfect on a warm day. SORTED have created 3 flavours that will excite your tastebuds...Strawberry and basil, lemon and mint and strong coffee. Amaze friends with what looks like a sophisticated dessert... only you need to know how simple they actually are.

recipes.title: Kale Pesto
recipes.description: Say hi to my newest obsession – kale pesto. Made this the other night and actually ended up eating about half of it straight out the jar, and since then I’ve been putting it on everything – crisp bread, salads, instead of tomato sauce on pizza, you name it.

recipes.title: Arroz Con Pollo
recipes.description: As one of the national dishes in Costa Rica, Ben discovered it's awesomeness when visiting on holiday. This is SORTED's version... a flavoursome and colourful rice dish that uses up leftover rice or chicken and is perfect for a speedy mid week meal. It is

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Pie
recipes.description: Here's the recipe for Peanut Butter Pie.  (also posted on my other blog, check profile for links if interested)
ingredients: 1.5 cup gluten free cookie crumbs (or not gluten free if you aren't GF)
ingredients-original: 1.5 cup gluten free cookie crumbs (or not gluten free if you aren't GF)

recipes.title: Sri Lankan Prawn Curry
recipes.description: I checked a dozen recipes and took suggestions from all of them to make my style of Prawn Curry - so decee. Cook the prawns in their shell, it gives a great flavour to the dish, it is only a bit messy to eat it. Get more information about that recipe on my blog.

recipes.title: Bacon And Mushroom Cannelloni
recipes.description: Bacon, mushroom, leek and blue cheese are flavours that work so well together and that is why we have put them in our Cannelloni recipe. This Italian inspired recipe can be made beforehand and put in the oven when needed. Yep.. it's a bit messy stuffing t

recipes.title: Anyone Can Make It  Healthy Curry
recipes.description: ATTENTION: Before reading this recipe here, it would be amazing if you could check out my blog post with the recipe for my dissertation over here: http://katherinecooks.com/2016/02/20/anyone-can-make-it-healthy-curry/ Please leave a comment, or even try cooking the dish yourself! My dissertation is all about how social media effects our eating habits, so any response you leave will help improve my grade. Thank you in advance! Now as promised, my simple curry. You can change up the ingredients for what meat you prefer, even add in a few extra cheeky veggies...
ingredients: 450 g your chosen meat (I used lamb)
1 butternut squash (you can use sweet potato, or any veggie you want)
ingredients-original: 450 g your chosen meat (I used lamb)
1 butternut squash (you can use sweet potato, or any veggie you want)

recipes.title: Easy Chicken And Mango Curry
recipes.description: This curry is mild, creamy and sweet. A fragrant, fruity and chicken delight that uses up leftover chicken and is so simple to make because the only chopping needed to hack up the meat. It's really rich and filling so you won't need to eat nearly as much
ingredients: 3 cooked chicken breasts or other cuts your choice
ingredients-original: 3 cooked chicken breasts or other cuts your choice

recipes.title: Baconjacket Potato Roast
recipes.description: Inspired by a recipe in the anime "Food Wars", this fake pork roast is actually mashed potato wrapped in bacon - a hearty side dish for the dinner table presented in a spectacular way!

recipes.title: Pork Loin In Boursin Cheese
recipes.description: This is an oven dish that does not take a long time to prepare and is great in larger quantities when you have guests to feed. I haven´t done this in ages and wont wait that long to prepare it again. It is such a creamy goodness.

recipes.title: Baked Lamb Samosas
recipes.description: This popular Indian snack tastes amazing but can traditionally be quite greasy and unhealthy. So SORTED have created a recipe for a baked Samosa instead of fried, with a delicately spiced lamb and pea filling. Tasty both hot or cold these make a great starter or are spot on for a sharing platter.

recipes.title: British Crumpets And Jam
recipes.description: These traditional British crumpets are pretty simple but seriously satisfying when you get them cooking... watching the bubbles form means you've nailed it!

recipes.title: Mon Cheri And Raffaello Muffins
recipes.description: A sin, the alcohol ones were gone so fast, they smelled so good. If you can´t find buttermilk, use regular milk and 2 tbsp of lemon and let it sit 5 minutes. It makes 18 muffins. More about the muffins you can find on the blog.

recipes.title: Garlic Soup
recipes.description: Here is my recipe for delish garlic soup.

recipes.title: Smoked Mackerel And Scrambled Eggs
recipes.description: Breakfast in bed is one of the nicest ways to show that you care. When it comes to Mother's Day... it's always a reliable way to get the day off to a great start. Actually, it's the thought that counts so this could even be a present in itself!

recipes.title: Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description: Want a healthier alternative to a muffin for breakfast? By making your own muffins at home you know exactly what is going into them. These muffins contain apple, carrot, orange, yoghurt, porridge oats and wholemeal flour so they will release energy slowly throughout the morning, keeping you fuller for longer.

recipes.title: Chicken Bacon And Leek Pie
recipes.description: So easy and perfect for those days that you preferably spend in the sofa rather than in the kitchen (yes, those days exist at least in my home)

recipes.title: Pork And Shrimp Dumplings
recipes.description: Juicy dumplings served with noodles and a dipping sauce.

recipes.title: Peach And Pistachio Crumble
recipes.description: Peach, pistachio and elderflower is such a refreshing combination of flavours and works really well in this crumble recipe. Accompanied by our cheeky shortcut of a crumble this is divine. Not only that... but the leftover poaching liquid from the peaches is great if you reduce it by half, chill it and then served with lemonade.

recipes.title: Feta Rocket And Onion Boats
recipes.description: Filled puff pastry with a rocket and tomato salad

recipes.title: Baked Banana Cinnamon Oatmeal
recipes.description: Weekend treat that just makes waking up worth it.

recipes.title: Green Curry
recipes.description:
During my time writing my dissertation, my tutor told me about Rirkrit Tiravanija. Tiravanija’s installations often take the form of stages or rooms for sharing meals, cooking, reading or playing music; architecture or structures for living and socialising are a core element in his work.

I thought this would be a wonderful addition to my historical cooking, as he really pushes the idea that cooking and eating is a social situation. I really want to push the concept of Britain eating around a table again, but individually in front of screens.

I quickly purchased his cook book and began!

Rirkrit’s recipe is all about interpretation, as there are many specialist ingredients. This is my version of what I could find:

recipes.title: Red Cabbage And Lentil Strudel
recipes.description: Served with an orange tarragon sauce. A vegetarian dish with a wonderful taste.

recipes.title: Boozy Berry Trifle
recipes.description: A trifle is such a classic dessert that puts a smile on everybody's face. For ours we've taken the jelly out so you don't have to wait around for it to set... and we've swapped the traditional sherry for an orange liquor to compliment our fresh berries. A winner all round.
ingredients: 1 handful mixed fresh berries, hulled and sliced
ingredients-original: 1 handful mixed fresh berries, hulled and sliced

recipes.title: Chocolate Lamingtons
recipes.description: We've been asked to make these so many times that we felt like we couldn't ignore it anymore. A square of delicious vanilla sponge dipped in a rich chocolate icing and then coated in desiccated coconut.

recipes.title: Hazelnut Orange Cake
recipes.description: Doesn't get any simpler than this. And it's really nice, I promise.

recipes.title: Thai Chicken Burger
recipes.description: Thailand isn't usually associated with burgers... and yet the flavours that crop up in so many Thai dishes lend themselves perfectly to a gourmet burger. So we've merged the two and come up with something that tastes pretty damn awesome... an explosion of fragrant Thai flavours between two baps.
ingredients: 3 large chicken breasts or chicken mince
ingredients-original: 3 large chicken breasts or chicken mince

recipes.title: Vegan Chocolate Pudding
recipes.description: Quick, easy, decadent and dairy free with less guilt - a great alternative to your standard heavy chocolate mousse!

recipes.title: Korean Kimchi German Style
recipes.description: I could not find a deece kind of kimchi, the canned ones were just Yuck. Since I want to make Kimchi fries soon, I had to make my own version of Kimchi. A lot of research later I came up with this

recipes.title: Vegetarian Bean Burger
recipes.description: Whether you are vegetarian, health conscious or just fancy a meal without meat, this tasty bean burger is simple and quick to make and is much better than the dry veggie burgers from the shops. It's packed full of butter beans which are full of fibre and helps burn energy slowly... and tastes soooooooooo good with a bit of blue cheese.

recipes.title: Banana Pancakes
recipes.description: Really really soft banana pancakes! I don't know the exact measurements because I made the batter through my gut feelings but honestly, you can't go wrong with pancakes.

recipes.title: Lemonade Calamari
recipes.description: Fried calamari crops up on loads of pub menus but did you know how easy and cheap it is to make at home? SORTED have given this restaurant classic a twist by using lemonade in the tempura batter.

recipes.title: Crispy Chilli Lamb And Butterbean Hummus
recipes.description: A 'hummus-like' dip made from tinned butter beans, olive oil, garlic, lemon and oregano forming the perfect bed for some gorgeous crispy, chilli lamb mince and garnished with parsley to be mopped up with charred Italian bread.

recipes.title: Poppy Seed Orange Waffles
recipes.description: a thick and not to sweet kind of waffle. Great for a good cup of tea.

recipes.title: Spiced Lamb And Paneer Wrap
recipes.description: A blend of fragrant Indian inspired spices rubbed onto lamb neck fillet chunks, then skewered with paneer cheese and chargrilled. Served in a warm Indian flatbread bread with minty yoghurt and a tomato, onion and coriander salad.

recipes.title: Basil Garlic And Butter Chicken
recipes.description: My recipe for you today is one of my go-to’s for easy but healthy everyday-dishes. Tomato, basil and chicken is really a great combination and together with zoodles they make a perfect dish. Off course it works just perfectly fine with regular spagetti or pasta.

recipes.title: Smoked Mackerel Pat
recipes.description: Mackerel is one of the best fish you can eat as it is high in omega 3, which keeps your heart healthy. This mouth-watering smoked mackerel pate is so easy to do you can barely call it a recipe... ideal as a fancy starter, a packed lunch or on a picnic.
ingredients: 300 g smoked mackerel fillets, skinned and boned
ingredients-original: 300 g smoked mackerel fillets, skinned and boned

recipes.title: Sushi Burrito
recipes.description: Sushi are gorgeous dainty morsels and burritos are crammed full of filling making them dense and heavy. Both fantastically satisfying in their own right... but now we combine the two!

recipes.title: Churros With Chocolate Coffee Sauce
recipes.description: Have you been abroad and tried this sweet delight? Well return to those holiday memories and make churros at home. These sugary fried dough treats are perfect for a dessert or snack. They are really cheap to make with only 2 main ingredients. To top it all off we've drizzled over an easy chocolate coffee sauce.
ingredients: 1 mug caster sugar for coating churros
ingredients-original: 1 mug caster sugar for coating churros

recipes.title: Lost Eggs Sweet And Sour And Bacon
recipes.description: This is a self saucing dish served with mash. It is a fast meal and you can get rid of eggs, when you bought too many.

recipes.title: Blood Orange Tiramisu
recipes.description: A fresh twist on the classic dish tiramisu with blood oranges and cointreau. And a top tip - if you manage to not eat it all right away, it taste even better after a night in the fridge!

recipes.title: Lentil And Quinoa Vegan Waffles
recipes.description: served with a vegan cream. A nice way to get rid of things riding around in your fridge

recipes.title: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
recipes.description: Pineapple upside down cake brings back childhood memories for us at SORTED... real comfort school canteen puds. We have given it a modern tropical twist by adding coconut to the recipe... and not just that, but the milk makes the sponge so light and moist that it's almost impossible to overcook.

recipes.title: Oreo Cream Cheese Icing
recipes.description: I baked a batch of cakey brownies, sliced in half, filled with this delicious Oreo cream cheese icing and drizzles with Nutella sauce - should probably go for a fun after eating this :') but well worth every bite

recipes.title: Minty Lamb Flatbread
recipes.description: This lamb burger tastes delicious and when crammed into a cool flatbread it really mixes up the burger. We've lobbed in a secret ingredient that will really excite your tastebuds... mint sauce, a condiment often left hanging around in the fridge after a roast.
ingredients: 4 round flat breads or pitta breads
ingredients-original: 4 round flat breads or pitta breads

recipes.title: Brown Butter And Apple Risotto
recipes.description: Creamy risotto with a fruity twist and bacon goodness, again inspired by the anime "Food Wars".  Thanks to @lumpyrice for suggesting that I make it!

recipes.title: Brioche Patissire Aux Fruit Confits
recipes.description: Brioche filled with creme pat and candied fruits. It is a wonderful recipe, but have a second pair of hands to help. It makes the preparation a lot easier

recipes.title: Vietnamese Beef Pho
recipes.description: We have had loads of requests for beef pho so we have come up with an easy and delicious recipe that anyone can make at home. This Vietnamese noodle soup is packed full of flavour and takes less than 10 minutes to make... so quick, tasty and healthy... what's not to like?

recipes.title: Dark Beer Bread
recipes.description: This recipe makes 2 breads, or use one half to cover some duck breasts with it

recipes.title: Mango Strawberry And Chicken Salad
recipes.description: Mango and strawberries in a chicken salad with goats cheese??? No we haven't gone crazy, this salad really does work. A lot of salads can be quite boring and lack flavour but not this one. It takes hardly any time to prepare and is great for using up leftover cooked chicken.

recipes.title: Greekstyle Chicken Skewers
recipes.description: Another one of my favorite weeknight-dishes. Its easy, fresh and pretty good for you. And the fact it taste great also helps :)

recipes.title: Halva Croissant Brioche
recipes.description: It was International Women's Day so I made my mum a little experiment and she absolutely loved it! It's not too sweet and is perfect with a glass of milk or a cup of coffee.

recipes.title: Sweetcorn Chilli Fritters
recipes.description: These sweet and spicy savoury pancakes are bursting with flavour and are perfect as a starter, lunch or light dinner. The combination of chilli, lime and coriander works really well with the sweetness of the sweetcorn.

recipes.title: Japanese Grilled Avocado
recipes.description: Avocado is all too often just used in salads or smashed up into guacamole... but this grilled version with Japanese inspired flavours is phenomenal.

recipes.title: Chocolate And Avocado Mousse
recipes.description: Avocados have a smooth and creamy texture anyway, but combine them with dark chocolate and coconut cream and you have something incredible.

recipes.title: Edible Chocolate Easter Nest
recipes.description: This recipe is fantastic to make with little ones over Easter. Using chocolate, fruit, nuts, shredded wheat and pretzels you can create a nest which is extremely realistic yet delicious to eat!  Fill it to the brim with mini eggs. Yum.

recipes.title: Homemade Bounty Bars
recipes.description: Ladies and gents you can now make bounty bars in your kitchen! This is our closest candy bar recreation yet and it's SO easy. To get started on these coconut chocolate bars of bliss, all you need is four ingredients. Just FOUR. They're a great idea if you're looking to wow mates. Don't share the recipe... keep it all to yourself.

recipes.title: Sardine Escabeche
recipes.description:
Escabeche comes from the Mediteranean where fish is flash fried then pickled. We have taken the fried part out for a much healthier dish! 

The sweet and sharp flavours of this dish, inspired by flavours from north Africa, is perfectly balanced and is so simple to prepare in less than 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Baked Chocolate And Blackberry Cheesecake
recipes.description: My housemate picked some blackberries for me a while ago and they've been stuck in the freezer since, add to the fact i had a packet of cocoa powder left in the cupboard and I love cheesecake I decided to combine it all to make the beauty.

recipes.title: Pizza Waffle
recipes.description: Cheesy, crunchy, meaty goooodnesss!!!

recipes.title: Full English Breakfast Pizza
recipes.description: Everyone knows that pizza makes the most incredible breakfast food... So why not create a pizza specifically for breakfast? This pizza includes all the best bits of a full English breakfast - sausage, bacon, eggs, hashbrowns... IT. IS. IMMENSE!

recipes.title: Ultimate Stuffed Crust Pizza
recipes.description: This is banging, delicious and edible.

recipes.title: Traditional Treacle Tart
recipes.description:
The treacle tart brings back childhood memories of our favourite desserts at school! 

Make this delicious tart, cut slices as big as your sweet tooth can handle, then share it with your friends and family. Everyone will love you for it!

recipes.title: Salmonsalad W Poached Egg
recipes.description: Iv'e been craving all those greens and healthy-isa dishes lately. Probably due to being one week from my two exams and all the studying that comes from that fact. So this dish is perfect - it contains loads of greens, healthy fats and some pretty awesome egg-porn.

recipes.title: Juniper Berry Risotto With Mussels
recipes.description: Served with St.Jacques and Vongole on a bed of Radiccio. First part of the Friday evening challenge, sorted! Serves two.

recipes.title: Fluffy Strawberry Mousse
recipes.description: This creamy and light strawberry mousse is easy and our most popular fruit pudding recipe. It's a hassle free dessert with no gelatin that you can make the day before and bung in the fridge until needed...

recipes.title: Matcha Green Tea Pasta With Peppers
recipes.description: The second part of the Friday eve challenge done. Cooking with Matcha Tea makes a super tasty dish. Read more on the blog.

recipes.title: Moroccan Chicken Tagine
recipes.description: This Moroccan chicken tagine could not be easier as you just put all the ingredients in the pot and let the oven do the work. For a dish with so much flavour you will be suprised how little time it takes to prepare.

recipes.title: Scotch Creme Egg
recipes.description: We had to get on this internet craze because that's kinda what we do. Thing is... You can't not deep fry a Scotch Egg, so we did and got crispy flakes, warm cake and gooey creme egg. More delicious than any Scotch Creme Egg recipe out there. Also, don't use a readymade cake.. Use this recipe: https://sortedfood.com/recipe/7134

recipes.title: Easter Egg Hack
recipes.description: Wish you could personalise your easter egg this year? We're here for you. Grab a super cheap egg and decorate it yourself using our easy hack. Just melt the two halves back together and surprise a loved one! (or our favourite option - devour the whole thing yourself)

recipes.title: Limoncello Cake
recipes.description: I am drowning in Limoncello! I found this on Pinterest. The cake is so moist and tastes great of lemons. It is just one tiny cake left for tomorrow.

recipes.title: Mushroom Risotto
recipes.description: Do you spend ages stirring your risotto watching it cook? Not anymore!!! We have come up with an amazing recipe that allows you to put the risotto in the oven whilst you sit down and relax. Not only that but by adding the raw mushroom paste at the last moment it doesn't over cook and you get an intense mushroomy flavour.

recipes.title: Blt Tart
recipes.description: All the flavours of a BLT sandwich (plus a few extras) on a puff pastry tart base. Perfect for light lunch or a packed lunch.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff Bake
recipes.description: This is a hearty and incredibly moreish dish inspired by the flavours of a stroganoff. It breaks a lot of rules, and isn't the most obvious creation... but it tastes great. One to share with the family.

recipes.title: Bibimbap
recipes.description: Bibimbap is another dish that we're seeing more and more of in London... plus you guys have been asking for it for a while... so here we go! Marinated beef, sesame spinach, hot rice that's crispy on the bottom and topped off with an egg and some gochujang! Yum!

recipes.title: Supercake
recipes.description: Jamie and Dean throw together a lacto-free sponge cake in the shape of the Superman logo, kryptonite in colour on the inside and decorated as best as they know how! Is it Ultimate enough to win a battle?

recipes.title: Classic Spinach Soup
recipes.description: Spinach soup is a oldie but a goldie for me, something they served me in pre-school on Thursdays and that I have continued to love.

recipes.title: Sea Bream With Coconut Relish
recipes.description:
Baking fish whole tastes so good and stops it from drying out. Lots of people are put off by the bones and head, but it really improves the flavour. 

This recipe is a must with this tangy, spicy coconut relish that will excite your tastebuds and take minutes to make.
ingredients: 1 handful fresh salad leaves to serve
ingredients-original: 1 handful fresh salad leaves to serve

recipes.title: Bat Belt
recipes.description: Jack and Barry attempt to recreate the utility belt that makes Batman so awesome. Using a vanilla and buttery biscuit recipe they cut out cooking then slap on the fondant icing.
ingredients: 500 g ready to roll fondant icing
ingredients-original: 500 g ready to roll fondant icing

recipes.title: Summer Pudding
recipes.description:
Do you always have leftover stale bread? This is a great way of using leftover bread in this gorgeous mixed berry summer pudding. 

We have garnished it with flaming berries, inspired by an awesome cocktail, which gives the dessert a delicious orangey kick. Make it the day ahead and serve as the centre piece at a family event.

recipes.title: Limoncello Tiramisu
recipes.description: Happy St. Patrick´s Day!  A tasty lemony tiramisu with a great colour.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Arctic Roll
recipes.description:
Fancy making a frozen dessert that you can keep for ages and take out the freezer when needed? Then look no further! 

We've come up with this fabulous Arctic roll recipe using peanut butter, chocolate peanuts and ice cream wrapped in an easy sponge recipe. The perfect BBQ dessert to share with family and friends.

recipes.title: Animal Style Fries
recipes.description: Possibly the greatest fast food invention in recent memory. Animal style fries are on the secret menu of In 'n' Out Burger, but now we can all enjoy them at home. Hooray!

recipes.title: Ultimate Pork Belly Nachos
recipes.description: Forget every plate of nachos you've eaten up to this point. These are a game changer. Pork belly takes this to the next level. Remember to layer your nachos, even one plain nacho on a plate of nachos is unforgivable.

recipes.title: Swedish Sandwich Cake
recipes.description: It looks like a stunning cake from a distant... but it's quite deceptive. Instead it's a stunning sandwich! a layer of salmon and horseradish mousse and a layer of prawn mayonnaise, all topped off with a cream cheese frosting and fresh salad and eggs.

recipes.title: Secret Veggie Pasta Bake
recipes.description: This cheesy, hidden vegetable pasta bake is perfect for someone wanting to increase their veggie intake. It's so tasty and simple to make if you have a big family and lots of hungry mouths to feed. Get your 5 a day in secretly.

recipes.title: Fish Fingers  Mushy Peas
recipes.description:
Fancy a healthier breaded fish dish? We have used a pepper purée under our breadcrumbs to add another vegetable to the dish, not to mention great colour and a natural sweetness. To top it all off, we have baked it too to make it super healthy.

Also, did you know that tinned mushy peas lose a lot of nutrients during the canning process? We have a quick mushy pea recipe that tastes delicious without losing those precious nutrients. A perfect recipe for all the family.
ingredients: 2 slices stale bread, blitzed to crumbs
2 fillets River Cobbler, bones and skin removed
ingredients-original: 2 slices stale bread, blitzed to crumbs
2 fillets River Cobbler, bones and skin removed

recipes.title: Savarin Meatloaf
recipes.description: A ring of meatloaf is a great centerpiece on a Sunday lunch table.
ingredients: 1 dry dinner roll soaked in milk
ingredients-original: 1 dry dinner roll soaked in milk

recipes.title: Sausage  Mushroom Pasta
recipes.description:
Want a easy and balanced pasta dish that won't take ages to prepare? 

This recipe is great for a speedy mid week meal and is packed full of healthy spinach and mushrooms. So stop buying ready made sauces and try this recipe at home.

recipes.title: Salted Olive Oil Brownies
recipes.description: Helloooo there! It's been a while, I know, but hey, I got the most amazing recipe for ya. If you never tasted chocolate with olive oil before, and I'm aware I say that a lot, trust me on this one. It's such a good pairing, the strong and bold chocolate with the very subtle fruitness of the olive oil, which is enhanced by the addition of some lime zest... words cannot describe how delicious it is. And, of course, me being me, I added some fleur de sal on top, to balance out all the fudgyness (is that even a word?) and richness. For more details, check out this week's cheeky post on my blog, the link is in my bio! Hope you guys like it ;)
ingredients: 120 ml (1/2 cup) extra virgin olive oil
90 g (1/2 cup or 3.17 ounces) granulated sugar
80 g (around 1/2 cup, loose or 2.8 ounces) brown sugar
80 g (2/3 cup or 2.8 ounces) plain flour
Fleur de sal or flaky sea salt, to sprinkle on top
ingredients-original: 120 ml (1/2 cup) extra virgin olive oil
90 g (1/2 cup or 3.17 ounces) granulated sugar
80 g (around 1/2 cup, loose or 2.8 ounces) brown sugar
80 g (2/3 cup or 2.8 ounces) plain flour
Fleur de sal or flaky sea salt, to sprinkle on top

recipes.title: Linden Blossom Ice Cream
recipes.description: With a dash of Calvados. I drink lots of linden blossom tea with honey when I have a cough and cold and this ice cream is the tasty equivalent to it.

recipes.title: Creamy Mushroom Polenta
recipes.description: Polenta is one of the easiest things to make at home and is so versatile. This set parmesan polenta takes 5 minutes to prepare and once it is set it is topped with scrumptious creamy mushrooms.

recipes.title: Savoury Scones
recipes.description:
Scones are so easy to make and this savoury version with apricot and brie is a great alternative to a sandwich. Just fill the warm scones with butter and ham and enjoy with your friends and family. 

Perfect for picnics or to take to work for your lunch!

recipes.title: Vodka Pasta
recipes.description: the Vodka makes a simple pasta dish something special
ingredients: 1 pinch salt and pepper and basil
ingredients-original: 1 pinch salt and pepper and basil

recipes.title: Ultimate Twix Cookies
recipes.description: If you're looking for the best cookie in the world, far better than any cookie your friends could hope to make, then you've come to the right place! These Twix cookies will remind you of everything that was great about your childhood... Yep, including that one time when, you know...

recipes.title: Plum Frangipane
recipes.description:
Do you love making tarts but hate making the pastry. This frangipane tart has no pastry so takes hardly any time to prepare. We have used plums in this recipe but you can use any fruit you like. 

Once you have made it send us a picture of your version!

recipes.title: Cookie Pie
recipes.description: Chocolate chip cookie pie with a nutty goooooey middle ;)

recipes.title: Peanut Butter And Jelly White Choc Cookies
recipes.description: So delicious

recipes.title: Carrot Pesto
recipes.description: On Cottage Cheese Crostinis. A starter from German chef Tim Mälzer. Great finger food. More on the blog.

recipes.title: Biscuit Base Lemon Meringue Pie
recipes.description: Lemon meringue pie is a popular dessert and we've got an amazing, no pastry recipe for you that will beat any from a shop. We've used a buttery biscuit base to save you making the pastry and the balance of zesty lemon curd and sweet soft meringue is just right.

recipes.title: Limoncello Rosemary Cream And Strawberry
recipes.description: I finished one bottle of Limoncello today - yee ha! This is a wonderful dessert with the couli from strawberries

recipes.title: Crispy Duck Pancakes
recipes.description:
Crispy duck and pancakes is one of our favourite dishes in chinese restaurants in the UK but not many of us would dare to make it at home. We have come up with a recipe that we think is just as good, if not better than the takeaway! 

Don't believe us? Then try this recipe for yourself and let us know how you get on!
ingredients: 1 bunch spring onions, cut into strips
ingredients-original: 1 bunch spring onions, cut into strips

recipes.title: Quinoa Salad With Baked Fish
recipes.description:
Quinoa is a great alternative to couscous or rice and makes a really healthy summer salad. It's light and packed full of herbs and lemon goes perfectly with fish. 

The fish in this recipe is so simple to prepare... and once you've eaten it there isn't any washing up as you simply throw the tin-foil away.
ingredients: 1 handful yellow and red cherry tomatoes
ingredients-original: 1 handful yellow and red cherry tomatoes

recipes.title: Halloumibake W Baconchorizo Crumble
recipes.description: Right now I´m craving fresh, fast and simple food more than ever and this dish is a perfect example of whats going on in my kitchen right now. It’s packed full with veggies, the tomato sauce is fresh and taste like herbs but it’s still a bit naughty with the bacon and chorizo on top. Perfect balance. It can´t be too good for you.
ingredients: 1 can pasta sauce with herb flavor
ingredients-original: 1 can pasta sauce with herb flavor

recipes.title: Poached Salmon And Watercress
recipes.description:
Using a court bouillon we poach a side of salmon... one of life's simplest pleasures. Serving it with boiled new potatoes and vibrant watercress sauce it makes for a quick and easy midweek meal. 

By poaching a larger portion of salmon and saving the rest for another day you can get ahead and it keeps cost per portion down.

recipes.title: Stuffed Onions
recipes.description: Want something impressive to kick off a meal? These are AMAZING and they're easy to make look really professional.

recipes.title: Coconut Shrimp
recipes.description:
Get ready for the perfect mix of sweet, savoury and spicy that will absolutely create a taste sensation that your mouth will have never experienced before.

And we all know what you're thinking... deep frying in COCONUT OIL?! Well yes, it tastes awesome but it's a big luxury. Feel free to replace it with vegetable oil or something similar!

recipes.title: Bruschetta
recipes.description:
If you're having an Italian meal it's hard to beat bruschetta as the best way to start it! We're not going to pretend this recipe is 100% traditional as we're using garlic bread as the base (the butter is delicious). 

Feel free to switch that out with ciabatta bread. Just rub it with garlic, drizzle with olive oil and grill in the same way.

recipes.title: Hasselback Potatoes
recipes.description: We'll be honest... this is potatoes simply being used as a vehicle for butter and cheese and bacon to enter your body. And it tastes so good. Just don't have one every day. Or every month. Maybe make this recipe once a year...

recipes.title: Indian Salmon Hash
recipes.description: This is a whacky combination of corned beef hash and bombay aloo... yet makes use of leftover poached salmon. It's thrown together in no time at all and when served straight to the table in the pan it makes for a rustic looking, but damn tasty midweek dinner.

recipes.title: Bechamel Chicken
recipes.description: A slow cook method for juicy chicken breast, takes a long time to prepare because it cooks at very low heat. Served with Orange Buchteln.

recipes.title: Triple Chocolate Crepe Cake
recipes.description: Crepe cakes are a bit of a showstopper and we're just gonna say it... adding chocolate in three forms just makes it better. Start with chocolate pancakes, add nutella cream cheese and finish with a chocolate ganache. Boom.

recipes.title: Cookie Dough Sandwich
recipes.description:
Question: Why wouldn't you want a sandwich filled with cookie dough? Answer: I do. I do want a sandwich filled with cookie dough. 

And if that cookie dough was actually sandwiched between... two cookies? Bonus.

And if it took about 2 minutes to make? Bonus.

And if the cookie dough was eggless? Total winner.

recipes.title: Victoria Sponge Cake
recipes.description: What's the most important part of baking a good cake? Obviously the ratio of sponge to filling. Our take on a classic victoria sponge cake has the perfect ratio. Trust us. Fresh strawberries are also a must! Go try it if you don't believe us!

recipes.title: Apple Pie Freakshake
recipes.description: So freakshakes are a thing huh? Here's our first take at one. It's apple pie flavoured. Literally... there is basically an apple pie in this shake. Our advice is: 1. Share it 2. One is enough for about 6 months. Don't say we didn't warn you ok?

recipes.title: Forest Poached Pear With Caramel Sauce
recipes.description: My, slightly unusal, take on poached pears.

recipes.title: Salmon And Courgette Linguine
recipes.description: The real beauty of this one is that it literally takes 10 minutes to cook... no longer than it takes to boil the pasta. Making use of leftover poached salmon and the most of a stupidly simple pasta sauce it is both light and fresh.

recipes.title: Spanish Omelette
recipes.description: To onion or not to onion? That is the question. We're going with onions, because you know... they're delicious. So that's it... 4 ingredients plus plenty of seasoning. Go try it out!
ingredients: 100 ml olive oil + extra if needed
ingredients-original: 100 ml olive oil + extra if needed

recipes.title: Pulled Jerk Chicken Wraps
recipes.description: Don't mind us, just creating more fusion magic over here. Take a delicious jerk chicken recipe (pulled so it's even better) and add cooling yoghurt before throwing it all in a wrap. Just call us geniuses, it's ok... we know.

recipes.title: Vanilla Whoopie Pies
recipes.description: Whoopie pies... remember them? These were the hottest thing around a few years ago and now where are they? Relegated to some past trend and never talked about again. Well they're still here and they still taste just as delicious, so let's bring this treat back!

recipes.title: Turkish Pizza
recipes.description: This is pizza like we've never had it before! It tastes really different to what you'd usually get. Don't let the lack of cheese put you off, create a stack of these and dive in!

recipes.title: Adult Banana Split
