recipes.description: Let's just get it out there... banana splits are not exactly trendy. But they are delicious. And this isn't exactly your average banana split. Not a bit of squirty cream in sight. Wait... did we just say that?

recipes.title: Kale Pesto And Seeded Crackers
recipes.description: Not the most sexy sounding recipe but we promise you this might be one of the most delicious snacks in the whole world. Next time you're thinking of making pesto try this one.

recipes.title: Caramel Apple Dutch Baby Pancake
recipes.description: Welcome to another round of food with weird and misleading names. No babies were harmed in the making of this, and apparently it comes from America (although it originally comes from a German dish). Delicious though

recipes.title: Filipino Chicken Adobo
recipes.description: Chicken adobo is probably one of our most requested dishes of all time. If you're not familiar with it, it's a peppercorn based chicken recipe originating from The Philippines. Leave time to marinate the chicken overnight for best results. You can expect an explosion of flavours when you take your first bite.

recipes.title: Crusted Chicken And Tabbouleh
recipes.description: Looking for something new and different to add to your regular midweek meals? THIS IS IT! Look no further, call off the search. You have arrived. Herby bulgar wheat with tasty coated chicken is your next meal. Well done.

recipes.title: Irish Potato Cakes
recipes.description:
The potato farl is a staple in Ireland. It's so simple and comforting that no breakfast or brunch should be served without one. 

This Irish potato farl stack is crammed full of streaky bacon, black pudding and grilled tomato, making it the perfect hangover cure too.

recipes.title: Mississippi Mud Pie
recipes.description: Holy chocolate cake how have we never made this before? A Mississippi mud pie is probably the ultimate chocolate recipe. Everyone in the SORTEDfood crew agreed that everyone should try this at least once in their life.

recipes.title: Orange Buchteln
recipes.description: This is a specialty from the former Bohemian part of Europe. Eat it with butter and jam or use it to dip some creamy sauce.

recipes.title: Potato Waffles
recipes.description: Potato waffles are even better than regular waffles. Because potatoes. And bacon. And cheese. Great, now we want potato waffles. Better still, this is inspired by a traditional kugel recipe.

recipes.title: Egg Drop Soup
recipes.description: One of those recipes that looks *not quite* as good as it tastes. Don't be shallow when it comes to how food looks though, otherwise you'll miss out on tasty beauties like this soup.

recipes.title: Flaming Floater Cocktail
recipes.description: Trust me, this tastes better than it sounds!

recipes.title: Royal Leprechaun
recipes.description: It's a velvet snake bite in a flute.

recipes.title: Marshmallow Whoopie Pie
recipes.description:
Whoopie Pies are all the craze... They might even be catching up with the cupcake phenomena! 

So here is our version of the american favourites! Our version is both chocolatey and crammed full of mini marshmallows for that extra gooey chewy centre. Sandwiched with a smear of nutella you'll have to be careful that you aren't tempted to eat the lot.
ingredients: 1 handful dark and white chocolate chips
ingredients-original: 1 handful dark and white chocolate chips

recipes.title: Gintonic Popsicles
recipes.description: Yesterday I had to show my ID at the bus just to convince the bus-driver that I wasn't 16 and actually needed a adult-ticket. So, just to compensate - here is my favorite drink transformed into ice-cream! Super simple and such a people-pleaser.

recipes.title: The Classic Old Fashioned Cocktail
recipes.description: Sometimes you just can't mess with a classic. This is one of those times. The world's first ever cocktail, presented here in all it's perfection.

recipes.title: Mango Swiss Roll
recipes.description: Swiss rolls are old fashioned you say? NO! Well yes... but they're also fantastic, so there. Mango curd makes this one extra fantastic because mango makes everything better.
ingredients: 60 g salted butter, cold and diced
ingredients-original: 60 g salted butter, cold and diced

recipes.title: American Blueberry Muffins
recipes.description: Never mess with an American classic. Everyone has their own recipe for muffins but we're keeping it simple and all about the blueberries- just the best. Oh and brown sugar over the top just before baking is a must to get that satisfying crunch. Enjoy with a nice cup of coffee.

recipes.title: Romesco Salmon
recipes.description: Ah Spanish food is some of the best in the world isn't it? And Romesco is one of the classics. It absolute perfection with a couple of perfectly cooked salmon fillets so go cook it RIGHT NOW!

recipes.title: Chocolate Chips And Mms Cookies
recipes.description: Follow my accounts for information!

recipes.title: Cosmo Fool
recipes.description: This is one of those showy and impressive looking desserts that takes it's inspiration from the popular 'Cosmopolitan' cocktail. The addition of some frozen vodka grapes creates a talking point... little will your guests know that the dessert took less than 5 minutes to make!

recipes.title: Dead Aunt Or Lumumba
recipes.description: Tote Tante as in Dead Aunt is the laced hot chocolate. It is called that way in the north of Germany along the coast. More on the blog

recipes.title: Celeriac Morbire Cheeseburger
recipes.description: A vegetarian burger that lets you forget you don´t have meat. Splurge for some great tasting cheese. More on the blog.

recipes.title: Homemade Herby Gnocchi
recipes.description:
Italians are most associated with pasta and pizza when it comes to food, and yet these little potato dumplings couldn't be more traditional. 

Homemade gnocchi flavoured with a variety of fresh herbs and served with a classic tomato sauce makes for a bowl of real Italian comfort food.
ingredients: 1 handful parsley, chives & basil, chopped finely
ingredients-original: 1 handful parsley, chives & basil, chopped finely

recipes.title: Ponzu Noodles
recipes.description: I haven't uploaded a new recipe in literally ages, so I thought I'd shake things up a bit and show y'all something new. This isn't the most groundbreaking recipe, but it's simple and pretty tasty. I came up with it while watching one of my favourite chefs, Hiroyuki Tarada, on YouTube, so go check him out! I also have a new LUMIX G7 camera now so hopefully gonna get some better photos out (even though I mainly bought it for film)
ingredients: 20 ml Yuzu Sauce/Lemon Juice with 2 teaspoons of sugar
ingredients-original: 20 ml Yuzu Sauce/Lemon Juice with 2 teaspoons of sugar

recipes.title: Cumin  Lime Haddock Parcel
recipes.description:
BBQs are events where you spend ages cooking up a whole host of meat, fish and vegetables outside and everybody is free to take what they like. 

These individual fish tin-foil parcels are perfect for just that. Made ahead of time, cooked in just 10 minutes on the BBQ and self-contained so that nothing else ends up tasting of fish and the delicate fish isn't masked by charred steak and sausages... they suit everybody.

recipes.title: Strawberry Sorbet
recipes.description: I tested my new compressor ice cream maker- perfect, just needs 35 minutes to get the tasty treat.

recipes.title: Homemade Almond Butter
recipes.description: So crazy expensive to buy but so easy to make at home - you just need a food processor and some patience and then you can indulge in some nutty, creamy deliciousness.

recipes.title: Bbq Cola Beef
recipes.description:
Marinades for steaks don't come much better than this recipe. Using a can of coke this beef steak marinade is sweet, sticky, smoky and just plain awesome. The sugar and fizz from the cola tenderises the beef and creates something that is screaming out to be thrown on a searingly hot BBQ grill. Served with a cool looking baked potato and cob of sweetcorn it will become a BBQ favourite of yours... just the same as it has for us.

Served with a cool looking baked potato and cob of sweetcorn it will become a BBQ favourite of yours... just the same as it has for us.

recipes.title: Peppercorn Sauce
recipes.description:
Perfect for steak night. Simple to make too.

Measurements can be altered slightly for the milk and stock, just as long as you have the correct consistency the results will be the same. I like to use a mixture of peppercorns but this is down to preference. Will work the same just using black peppercorns.

recipes.title: Ultimate Steak And Chips
recipes.description: Served with peas and a peppercorn sauce

recipes.title: Bbq Chinese Pork
recipes.description:
This marinade for some BBQ pork has a Chinese influence and is made up using a number of bottled ingredients and spices that most of us have kicking around in the cupboard anyway. 

Whether you char it over a BBQ outside or under a grill inside it's a cheap cut of pork that carves really well when cooked.

recipes.title: Spicy Chorizo Nachos
recipes.description: Is it Mexican? Is it American? Is it Spanish? IT'S ALL 3!!! It's Mexi-Sp-Am-Ish! Whatever you think the origins might be, this honestly has WINNER written all over it!

recipes.title: Fiery Prawn Noodle Soup
recipes.description: This will actually blow your pants off and if that's not enough to win this battle then I don't know what is.

recipes.title: Fruity French Toast
recipes.description:
This sweetened eggy bread is fried in a knob of butter to go crispy and golden on the outside and remain sweet and gooey inside. 

Serving this with some fresh berries, orange segments and a dollop of natural yogurt makes it a favourite breakfast or brunch recipe for the whole family.

recipes.title: Asian Flavored Empanadas
recipes.description: Let´s take two fantastic countries and mash them together in one dish thats both easy and packed full of flavor!

recipes.title: 15 Minute Thai Red Curry
recipes.description: Take your time with it though. You'll lose a finger otherwise.

recipes.title: Key Lime Jelly Pots
recipes.description: This is a combination of a cheesecake, a jelly and a key lime pie. Amazing sweet flavours balanced with zingy lime. It looks great, tastes amazing and when you see how easy it is to make each layer you'll be making this one we promise!

recipes.title: Grilled Peach Salad
recipes.description: This salad is great for the summer months. It's a light lunch or great salad to accompany a BBQ. The combination of sweet grilled peaches, toasted pecans, soft salty blue cheese with honey and thyme balsamic dressing looks impressive enough to appear on any restaurant menu... yet takes just moments to make.

recipes.title: Strawberry Millefeuille
recipes.description: This traditional French pastry literally translates to 'a million layers'. We're not going to say that ours has quite that many but the tower of light crisp puff pastry, homemade vanilla creme patisserie, fresh strawberries and a chocolate icing turns this into a real treat... albeit a little messy to eat!

recipes.title: Chicken On Courgette Rosti
recipes.description:
Potato rosti is awesome... but can be a little tricky to cook well. You need to make sure it's crispy on the outside when fried... but also avoid raw potato on the inside. 

This simplified version, with added courgette and goats cheese, is baked so cuts out a difficult corner and is served with pan-fried chicken breast and a simple tomato sauce.

recipes.title: Banana Pancakes
recipes.description: Dessert for breakfast...?)

recipes.title: Blueberry Ketchup And Duck
recipes.description: This ketchup is going to BLOW YOUR MIND because we've gone absolutely crazy and replaced tomatoes with blueberry. It's perfect with duck and mash but feel free to go wild with it at breakfast, lunch or dinner.

recipes.title: Wood Garlic Pasta And Asparagus
recipes.description: springtime is wonderful, the white asparagus and the leafy garlic are back. More on the blog.

recipes.title: Mojito Chicken With Wild Rice
recipes.description:
Like the mojito drink? Well this uses all the flavours from the popular cocktail in a healthy, balanced chicken dish. 

Served with a fruity salad and wild rice, this colourful recipe will excite your tastebuds.

recipes.title: Swedish Chocolateraspberry Biskvi
recipes.description: You just have to make these Swedish classics. Biskvier not only contain your daily fix with chocolate, it´s also one of your five a day (if you eat like five of them, just saying) they look pretty darn cute. If you can’t buy the almond paste in store that I have used here you can either make it yourself (recipe at the last step) or substitute it with marzipan but then it will be a lot sweeter.

recipes.title: Unbelievable Sweet Mac N Cheese
recipes.description: I know, I know... I'm messing with a classic... But Mac 'n' Cheese works so well as a dessert, I even struggle to believe it myself. If you don't believe me, try it... It'll change your life. Promise.

recipes.title: Rice Paper And Panko Fish
recipes.description: a tasty way to eat fish on a friday. It is a bit fiddely but worth a try. More on the blog.

recipes.title: Daim Bars
recipes.description: These are crazy good... and as with most confectionary pretty few ingredients so fairly easy to make. Even if it's left up to Jamie and Barry!

recipes.title: Kim Chi Mac N Cheese Balls
recipes.description: VOTE FOR MY BALLS!!

recipes.title: Mac N Cheese Cupcakes
recipes.description: Bacony heaven! (Makes 6)

recipes.title: Orange Glazed Ham
recipes.description:
Have you ever tried to boil a ham at home? 

This recipe takes little effort to prepare and tastes delicious. It is so easy to make and you can use leftovers for ham sandwiches and other recipes in the week.

recipes.title: Wood Garlic Bread
recipes.description: Wood Garlic is in season now so it makes sense to put it into a bread. So tasty! If you can get hold of some of the green stuff, give if a try.

recipes.title: Strawberry Buckwheat Cake
recipes.description: Simple, one bowl cake. Warm cake embraces sunken baked strawberries, and if you sprinkle the whole thing with enough demerara sugar you'll get nice a crispy top.

recipes.title: Jerk Beef Pattie
recipes.description: This is our spicy and sweet take on the classic beef burger made with Caribbean jerk seasoning and complete with pineapple ring!

recipes.title: Cereal Milk Jelly
recipes.description: Oh so you want to eat cereal and milk in the back of a car eh? You crazy cat! Well now you can with our brand new cereal milk jelly cubes.

recipes.title: Lobster Rolls
recipes.description: Sandwiches are the ultimate car food right? Well... kind of. You've still got to deal with all the packaging, plus we all know that if a sandwich is properly filled then it's definitely going to go everywhere. Well fear not, because we've adapted the classic sandwich to fit neatly into a rice paper roll. It's an EDIBLE WRAPPER! This is going to take off people, so get on board.

recipes.title: Bbq Rib Balls
recipes.description: You've never experienced BBQ ribs like this. We've taken ribs, fries and charred corn and blended them into a single crispy ball that you can just pop into your mouth. That means ribs with ZERO mess! Winner.

recipes.title: Spelt Flour Bread
recipes.description: with dried onion, anise seed and honey

recipes.title: Grilled Ham And Pineapple Salsa
recipes.description:
Do you like a Hawaiian pizza? We have taken the flavours of ham and pineapple and created a quick and simple mid week meal that is low carb and tastes amazing. 

Why spend ages in the kitchen when you can create a delicious dish that take less time that heating up a ready meal in the oven?

recipes.title: Saffronvanilla Braised Fennel
recipes.description: Meatless-monday at its best. I just love when the veggies get to be the hero of a dish. This warms your heart and your belly.

recipes.title: Salmon Bagel Burger
recipes.description:
You may have never tried salmon and horseradish but trust us, it's a classic combination!

This burger is perfect in a chewy bagel and is a delicious alternative to the usual meaty offerings.

recipes.title: Ham And Cheese Tartiflette
recipes.description:
This french classic uses leftover ham and is perfect when cooking for a group of friends or family, as it can be prepared beforehand and baked when needed. 

Similar to dauphinoise potatoes but without the hassle of thinly slicing the potatoes, its awesome comfort food.

recipes.title: Asian Pulled Pork Bun
recipes.description:
We've teamed up with the guys at lovepork.co.uk to bring you an incredible pulled pork recipe... one that was shaped by all your suggestions!

It's got the sweetness of apple, the heat of chilli and the fragrant of ginger, Chinese 5-spice and garlic. Served in a crusty roll with a fresh zesty slaw and shards of crackling... you'll be hoping there's some leftover for tomorrow too!

recipes.title: Oreo  Vanilla Mousse Cheesecake
recipes.description: Another baked classic inspired by my love of Dairy Milk Oreo

recipes.title: Tandoori Chicken Burger
recipes.description:
If you want a quick, healthy alternative to your regular curry fix then this is the recipe for you. 

It's all the familiar flavours of your favourite curry thrown into a burger and wrapped in naan bread. Plus, to get the usual red colour, we're using the natural ingredient of beetroot.

recipes.title: Raw Vegan Mint Slice
recipes.description: Sorry I haven't been uploading! I've been busy with my final year of high school very stressful - but here is a very adapted recipe of the hippie lane recipe as I was missing a lot of the ingredients but was seriously craving :')
ingredients: 12 dried dates soaked in boiling water for 10 mins
ingredients-original: 12 dried dates soaked in boiling water for 10 mins

recipes.title: Macaroni Grilled Cheese
recipes.description: If you think that this is us going a little bit overboard then maybe you're right, but we can guarantee the tastiness of this recipe. You've got to use a really fresh loaf so that the bread gets really crisp and compressed. That means you get a surprisingly light sandwich (although we don't recommend eating this too regularly!)

recipes.title: Spaghetti With Garlic Feta And Bacon
recipes.description: This is one of my absolute loved dishes. I had it first near the Swiss boarder in a restaurant and since then I do it often. It is a bit like carbonara, but a very dry version

recipes.title: Focaccia Bread
recipes.description:
You really can't beat the smell of fresh bread at home. This flat oven-baked Italian bread is perfect served as a starter with flavoured oil, as a sandwhich or to dip into your favourite soup. 

As it is fresh with no preservatives, it goes stale alot quicker! So make sure you freeze some after baking if you're not going to get through it all, it tastes just as good after it has defrosted.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil (+ extra for drizzling)
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp olive oil (+ extra for drizzling)

recipes.title: Guinness Braised Pork Belly Tacos
recipes.description: Can´t stand to drink it - but here Guinness makes some Friday-appropriate amazing tacos (I've cooked this four times for three different people in three weeks, that how good it is!).

recipes.title: Pork Swede And Chutney Sandwich
recipes.description: An open faced sandwich with yellow tomato,apple and onion chutney, blue cheese and sauteed veggies and a nice pepper steak on top. The bread is the rest from my monday spelt flour bread
ingredients: 1/2 jar of tomato apple onion chutney
ingredients-original: 1/2 jar of tomato apple onion chutney

recipes.title: Classic Waldorf Salad
recipes.description:
This super simple salad was created in the Waldorf Hotel, New York City. The combination of ingredients is just as delicious now as it was back in the 1800's and takes just minutes to make!

We've added a little dijon mustard to the dressing for that extra kick and served the dish with some easy garlic prawns.

recipes.title: Asparagus Pakoras  Vegan
recipes.description: Made with red lentil flour and served with wild herbs and edible flowers as a salad and yellow tomato apple onion chutney. Read more on the blog.

recipes.title: Pimpd Tropical Salad
recipes.description: Fruit salad doesn't have to be the same old combinations thrown into a bowl. All of these exotic fruits can be found in your average supermarket, and with a little work put into the presentation you can turn fruit salad into something that's medal winning!

recipes.title: Lemon Dessert
recipes.description: A Popes favourite dessert, in German called "Päpstliche Zitronencreme". More about it on the blog.

recipes.title: Spinach  Coconut Cupcakes
recipes.description: Yes, the colour is all natural. Topped with coconut cream cheese frosting.

recipes.title: Salmon Beetroot Gravadlax
recipes.description:
This typical Swedish salmon dish has been flavoured with the fantastic combination of orange and beetroot.

Go on and really impress your friends with this elegant and beautiful looking dish that could not be simpler to make.
ingredients: 1 cooked beetroot, skin removed (not in vinegar)
ingredients-original: 1 cooked beetroot, skin removed (not in vinegar)

recipes.title: Almonddate Chai Smootie
recipes.description: Creamy, sweet and spicy. Pretty much the best breakfast or snack ever!

recipes.title: Eton Mess Ice Cream
recipes.description:
Eton mess is one of the most popular British summer desserts and one of the SORTED crews' favourites.

We have given it our twist by turning it into a ice cream which is perfect for the summer. 

The best thing about this dessert is you can keep it in the freezer for months, not that it will last that long!

recipes.title: Kiflice Poor Mans Croissants
recipes.description: Kiflica (pronounced something like keef-lee-tza) is essential part of everyone's childhood around here. Everyone's mom or grandma makes the best ones in the world. They're easy to make, quick to bake, filled with cheese, jam or nutella, they fit perfectly in child's hand (one in each, off course). This version is a bit fancier one, because of all the layers, but it's still quick and easy to make.

recipes.title: Wild Garlic Oil On Veg Soup
recipes.description: a super tasty oil to pimp a soup with all the veggies I could find in my veggie drawer

recipes.title: Chorizo And Goats Cheese Frittata
recipes.description:
This frittata can be eaten hot or cold and makes a fantastic lunch or light bite.

Using eggs to carry the delicious flavours of the goats cheese and chorizo keeps costs down but doesn't compromise on taste. Impress your friends without breaking the bank using this easy recipe.

recipes.title: 5 Ingredient Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Stuck for time or ingredients but want seriously good cake... then this is the recipe for you. A jar of nutella is the secret, but with the roasted pears it's fab.

recipes.title: Thaistyle Rice Pudding
recipes.description:
Why get rice pudding out of a tin when it is so easy to make at home?

This sweet fragrant rice pudding is a taste of Thailand with coconut, lemongrass and mango.

Take the stress out of cooking for your friends as this is best made in advance and stored in the fridge until needed.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Poppy Seed Bread
recipes.description: To go with May Wine flavoured with Woodruff and some Liptauer Cheese. A great tasting bread
ingredients: 150 g peeled cooked mashed sweet potatoes
ingredients-original: 150 g peeled cooked mashed sweet potatoes

recipes.title: Orange Cake
recipes.description: This delicious dessert is made using a few twists along the way. We add a whole, un-peeled orange into the mix as well as splashing in plenty of olive oil rather than butter to bake a perfectly moist cake.

recipes.title: Italian Beef Wellington
recipes.description:
This dish is the perfect meal to impress friends or loved ones. The key is to keep the meat perfectly pink whilst getting a crispy golden puff pastry crust.

We've used the Italian flavours of basil and parma ham with the classic beef and mushrooms to give our dish a fresh twist that your nearest and dearest will love!

recipes.title: Stuffed Chicken Ballotine
recipes.description: Chicken ballotine is the 'restaurant style' dish that's crazy simple to make. This recipe is different to your usual stuffed chicken- when sliced, the perfect cross section will really make an impact on your eyeballs and tastebuds as you eat. Whack it out next time you need to cook a fancy dinner.

recipes.title: Maritozzi
recipes.description: A raisin, lemon and pine nut sweet bun. A speciality from Rome. Usually eaten with a cup of Espresso.

recipes.title: Parmesan Filled Butternut Squash
recipes.description: So, I may or may not had just the tiniest bit too much amazing food last week in Stockholm and may or may not need to compensate with something a bit healthier. However, this taste better than most naughty food. It sweet, creamy and salty - what more to ask?

recipes.title: Sticky Maple Duck
recipes.description: Beautiful pink duck never fails to impress and this dish will be no exception! We take the mystery out of getting perfectly crisp skin and pair our duck with sweet maple syrup and buttery fondant potato.

recipes.title: Raspberry Milkshake
recipes.description:
This is a one of our favourite classic recipes from our archive... enjoy! Milkshakes are a super-quick refreshing drink for a warm summer day and the fresh raspberries in our shake lift it to new heights. 

This recipe takes 2 minutes to whip up in a blender; just chuck everything in, blitz and make a simple garnish to add a bit of wow factor!

recipes.title: Carrot Almond Ginger Bread
recipes.description: A bake for Ascension of Christ and Father´s Day

recipes.title: Kladdkaka W Brown Butter And Lemon
recipes.description: This recipe is almost like the classic Klasskaka's little sister. Still rich from the browned butter and crazy gooey, but fresher and more summery. Y-U-M

recipes.title: Avocado Rose
recipes.description: Simple yet delicious

recipes.title: Bloody Mary Soup
recipes.description: The Bloody Mary is a classic cocktail. Everyone has their own preferences when it comes to what goes into it. We've taken what we think are the very best of the various popular ingredients and twisted them into a delicious hot soup with quite a kick.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Jelly Cookies
recipes.description: Peanut butter and jelly has been an American favourite for decades. We've taken it out of the sandwich and bunged it into a cookie, resulting in a fantastic sweet treat for seasoned pb&j eaters and newcomers alike.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Tarte Tartin Pistacchio Ice Crea
recipes.description: The seasonal rhubarb gives a counter point to the caramel. The ice cream is smooth.

recipes.title: Cafe Latte Creme Caramel
recipes.description:
Sugar has a reputation of being tough to work with but we make caramel fool proof using this easy recipe. The outcome is runny caramel and a perfectly smooth set coffee cream.

Crème caramel is a great 'day ahead' recipe that needs nothing more than turning out before serving, meaning it's ideal for dinner parties or a romantic meal in.

recipes.title: Coconut Biscuits With Strawberry Jam
recipes.description: These biscuits are a variation of traditional serbian vanilice. I had some leftover strawberry jam in my fridge, and I thought it would go nicely with something coconut-y. It's a no brainer and uses store cupboard ingredients, but it's really nice.

recipes.title: Seabass With Braised Lettuce
recipes.description:
Lettuce means salads, right? Well yes... but did you know it's also great when cooked? 

We've braised it with peas for a light, fresh accompaniment to go with delicate crisp skinned seabass.

recipes.title: Gumbolaya
recipes.description: It’s minimal effort with loads of flavor and super quick. Also it’s a perfect dish to use up those leftover veggies laying around, just trow them in there and let them create heaven, haha.

recipes.title: Harissa Prawns With Bulgar Wheat
recipes.description: Tabbouleh is a refreshing Middle Eastern salad packed with herbs. It's made with bulgar wheat, which is similar to couscous and goes perfectly with our spicy harissa prawns.

recipes.title: Focaccia Bread
recipes.description: A wonderful Italian bread, best to eat fresh.

recipes.title: Ricotta And Honey Bake
recipes.description: Miele fritto e Ricotta. A dessert from the Italian region of Basilicata. Read more about it on the blog.

recipes.title: Chicken Pad Thai
recipes.description: Since when was pad thai so easy? With this recipe you'll get yourself an authentic Thai street food experience in no time at all. So put down that takeaway menu and get cooking for your noodle & chicken fix.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Haloumi And Vegetables
recipes.description: These vegetables really don't need much done to them. The natural flavours are brought out by cooking them until slightly charred. Haloumi is a firm cheese that is fantastic when grilled and is the ideal addition to all this veg.

recipes.title: Fruit In The Hole
recipes.description: We reinvent a well known dish by whipping up a sweet yorkshire pudding and chucking in some fruit to make an indulgent dessert served with cream or custard.
ingredients: 2 tbsp brown sugar for the top
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp brown sugar for the top

recipes.title: Turkish Chicken And Pilaw
recipes.description: A very tasty way to eat chicken and not to much work. I found this on YT from a Turkish chef. More about the story on the blog.

recipes.title: Scandinavian Mashed Potatoes Pulled Chic
recipes.description: The left over chicken breast from yesterdays Turkish chicken made a trip to join potatoes in the far north. A herby fresh and spiced mash.

recipes.title: Tea Poached Fruit Dessert
recipes.description:
This dessert looks and sounds impressive, but it's really simple. To go with the selection of british poached fruit we make a simple sabayon, which is similar to a custard but much easier to make! 

Any leftover fruit is awesome with natural yoghurt for breakfast.

recipes.title: Monkfish Rendang Curry
recipes.description: Although an authentic South East Asian Rendang is quite a dry meaty dish, we've switched our Rendang up a little by using the same flavours but with monkfish and keeping the sauce super creamy. Enjoy :)

recipes.title: Basil Cream With Strawberries
recipes.description: A sweet goat cheese cream with basil, fresh and dried strawberries. A recipe from the Ligurian coast of Italy, the area of Genoa. Well known for the Pesto Genovese.

recipes.title: Roast Beef Doorstep Sandwich
recipes.description: If you love your roast beef dinner, you'll adore this sandwich packed out with juicy rare beef, roast veg and horseradish.

recipes.title: Saffron Asparagus On Courgette Salad
recipes.description: This is a combination that sounds crazy in the beginning, but trust me, it tastes great.

recipes.title: Strawberry And Lime Frangipane
recipes.description: Perfect tart for spring.

recipes.title: Beef In Black Bean Stirfry
recipes.description: This is probably one of the first dishes that crosses your mind when thinking of Chinese takeaway. We show you how to use your leftover roast beef to create an easy homemade stir-fry version complete with egg fried rice.

recipes.title: Polenta Strudel With Mascarpone Filling
recipes.description: A nice side dish to serve with braised meat and sauce.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.description: Loads of different variations of this Russian dish have become popular all over the world. Here's our easy version of this quick, tasty meal using gherkins, paprika, brandy and sour cream.

recipes.title: Halloumi Wraps
recipes.description: It's National Vegetarian Week, woohoo. Celebrate with some tasty halloumi wraps,  halloumi, caramelized onion and mushrooms all mashed together to create absolute heaven!

recipes.title: Fig And Parma Ham Tart
recipes.description: You will not believe how easy this recipe is when you try it. All of these Mediterranean flavours are a match made in heaven that we're sure you'll love.

recipes.title: Flatbread Club Sandwich
recipes.description: We stick with a fairly traditional mix of grilled chicken, bacon and tomato for our club sandwich but throw in a few twists along the way, including avocado mayo and homemade fennel seed flatbread.

recipes.title: Vegan Avocado Linguine
recipes.description: served with griddled yellow courgettes

recipes.title: Milky Ice Lollies
recipes.description: These are delicious and healthy alternatives to store bought lollies that take no time at all to make. The milk flavoured with real fruit means these are a guilt free treat for both the kids and adults.
ingredients: 1 tsp honey (optional depending on sweetness berry)
ingredients-original: 1 tsp honey (optional depending on sweetness berry)

recipes.title: Boulgour With Asparagus And Peas
recipes.description: When you use olive oil and veg stock you have a complete vegan dish. I planned non vegan, but then exchanged the butter and the chicken stock. It is a wonderful dish that way too-

recipes.title: Chocolate Mousse Dome
recipes.description: This elegant dessert with a tinge of orange takes your standard chocolate mousse to the next level!

recipes.title: Raspberry In Cider Jelly
recipes.description: This party sized dessert looks really impressive and can be made ahead of time for a no-stress end to a meal. It might take a little patience, but it's incredibly easy to make.

recipes.title: Caramelized Asparagus Strawberry Icec
recipes.description: Please, do not say YUK!  It is a dessert that is a combination made in spring. And the different tastes work wonderful together. Homemade vanilla ice cream goes great with the warm asparagus. The recipe for the ice cream is o

recipes.title: Sausage And Mushroom Crumble
recipes.description:
A crumble topping is best known for old favourite desserts with apples or rhubarb but take out the sugar and it becomes the perfect savoury addition to a bake.

Enjoying this with friends is great for spreading the cost (and showing off a bit), but if you need to it'll keep in the fridge for a couple of days with no problems.
ingredients: 8 pork sausages, spicy ones are good
ingredients-original: 8 pork sausages, spicy ones are good

recipes.title: Masala Chai Tea
recipes.description: This has been claimed the SORTED Masala Chai... a clever blend of spices and black tea creates this sweetened hot milky drink.

recipes.title: Iced Pear And Ginger Tea
recipes.description: In the summer months an iced tea can be more refreshing and thirst quenching than water itself... this is just such an example.

recipes.title: Blue Mallow Tea
recipes.description: This is not just a smoothing herbal tea... but it's also fantastically magical!

recipes.title: Clafoutis Paleo Gf
recipes.description: This French classic in a paleo version with coconut. I made it that way the first time. I made the original recipe often but I will do the Paleo Clafoutis from now on. It is more flavourful.

recipes.title: Meatball Pasta Bake
recipes.description: Need ideas for a great family dish? We've made meatballs and pasta even easier to serve to a crowd by sticking it all in a dish and simply baking in the oven before serving. This is homely comfort grub at its best. You can make it ahead of time and even keep it in the fridge overnight ready to go.

recipes.title: Strawberry Smoothie Bowl
recipes.description: Just another delicious and healthy dessert to satisfy your sweet tooth! :)

recipes.title: Healthy Chocolate Almond Granola
recipes.description: This granola is my new obsession. Loads of granola, raspberries, banana and a generous splash of almond milk. Oh yes. It just changes the whole breakfast game massively. It’s naturally sweetened, full of fiber, healthy fats but most important it taste amazing and it leave the milk in the bottom of the bowl all chocolaty and delicious.
ingredients: 2 cup oats (use fiber if you can)
Handful of freeze dried pomegranate or raspberries
ingredients-original: 2 cup oats (use fiber if you can)
Handful of freeze dried pomegranate or raspberries

recipes.title: Crispy Bacon And Cabbage Spaghetti
recipes.description: This is a ridiculously simple dish using a tried and tested combination of flavours. There are so few ingredients that it is perfect for those times when you're counting the pennies.

recipes.title: South Tyrolian Bread
recipes.description: Served with a Cheese Salad. The Vinschgau is the area where the bread with lots of spices comes from, a region in the north of Italy. A cheese salad with a stronger taste goes wonderfully with it and is regional too.

recipes.title: One Pot Lamb With Orzo
recipes.description: This is a pasta dish with a difference. Orzo is a cross between risotto rice and pasta, meaning that it's really filling. We've used lamb mince with plenty of fresh flavours to keep it tasting nice and light.

recipes.title: Onion Bhaji
recipes.description: Bhajis are one of the most popular Indian starters or side dishes. We put a SORTED twist on ours by using red and white onions as well as shallots to give an extra bit of sweetness. We also whip up an easy mango yoghurt which makes a fantastic dip.

recipes.title: Chocolate Dirt Pot
recipes.description: If you love chocolate you will LOVE our chocolate dirt pots and it's also a great one to get the kids involved with! The chocolate pudding is really easy to make and you can layer these the day before, ready to be decorated with plenty of mint and gummy worms!

recipes.title: Blackberry Webbed Cheesecake
recipes.description:
We've switched up the traditional biscuit base with super light sponge to make this a cheesecake with a difference. 

We also show you a cool technique that's easy to do at home and makes your cake look pretty special - great for showing off in front of your mates.

recipes.title: Cheats 3 Ingredient Ice Cream
recipes.description:
We'll have this ice cream made before you can say 'don't you still have to freeze it for a few hours?'. 

Trust us though... 3 ingredients, zero churning, stirring or otherwise still results  in soft, scoopable ice cream that tastes great.

recipes.title: Korean Fried Chicken
recipes.description: Take a moment after your first bite of this delectable morsel and just enjoy it, because you'll never get it again, and no-one can ever take it away from you. Korean fried chicken is one of the best things in this world. If you haven't found that out yet then drop everything and cook this.

recipes.title: Cheeseburger
recipes.description: This is a big claim, but we think this might be the perfect cheeseburger recipe. We know it hasn't got bacon, onion rings or confetti, but it has everything that a burger should have and it's all put together perfectly. Oh and the ribeye steak in the burger is SO WORTH IT.

recipes.title: Chocolate Mousse
recipes.description:
This is a childhood favourite that's so good us adults love it too. A rich dark chocolate mousse, with a hint of orange, is the perfect end to a meal. Simple to make from just 5 ingredients and can be made to look extra fancy too.

Unfortunately, this c

recipes.title: French Rabbit Stew
recipes.description: I bought a wild rabbit from the butchers and needed an idea of how to use it. Together (in a live tweet-a-long and on snapchat) we came up with this!

recipes.title: Beetroot And Dill Houmous
recipes.description: This houmous with beetroot and dill is a recent favorite, the earthiness of the beetroot work so nicely with the smoothness and gives it a bit more body. And dill because yeah – I´m Swedish, we love our dill and to most of us dill represent summer (and it´s pretty darn tasty together with beetroot)
ingredients: 1 bunch fresh dill (save some for decorating)
5 tbsp olive oil (to top it up)
ingredients-original: 1 bunch fresh dill (save some for decorating)
5 tbsp olive oil (to top it up)

recipes.title: Simple Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: If you're looking for an enormous showstopper, you might be better checking out our epic chocolate cake recipe on SORTEDfood. This recipe here, however, is great if you're looking for something a little more simple. Chocolate sponge enriched with coffee. It's ideal for beginners!

recipes.title: Mixed Salad With Wild Salmon
recipes.description: salmon smoked to perfection. I was serching for local food here, more on the blog

recipes.title: Overnight Raspberry French Toast
recipes.description: Such a easy treat since you prepare everything the night before – then in the morning you just throw it in a cold oven (no need for preheating here) and wait for the kitchen to be filled with the amazing smell of freshly baked french toast.

recipes.title: Baked Apple Puff
recipes.description: This is our twist on an apple pie, but instead of making a mess by cooking things in pots and pans we keep our apples whole and wrap everything up in a neat little puff pastry parcel.

recipes.title: Apple And Ham Eggs Benedict
recipes.description: It's always nice to treat yourself to brunch after a good lie in. This recipe is great for your mid-morning meal, adding grilled apple and spinach to the classic perfectly poached eggs on a toasted english muffin, all topped with creamy hollandaise sauce.

recipes.title: Seafood Spaghetti Marinara
recipes.description: Sometimes you just can't beat the classics. This recipe makes the simplest tomato sauce to go with our seafood and spaghetti for a super quick evening meal. Don't forget to save some of the sauce to use later in the week!

recipes.title: Grilled Nutella And Marshmallow Sandwich
recipes.description: This is just filth. There's nothing more to say. Eat at your own risk.

recipes.title: Torn Chicken Patatas Bravas
recipes.description: Patatas Bravas is a tapas favourite consisting of potatoes in spicy tomato sauce. We make it into more of a standalone main meal today by adding chorizo and torn chicken meat.

recipes.title: Instant Ramen Pots
recipes.description: These are most definitely not traditional, but we reckon we did a good job of packing flavour into these in a seriously short space of time to make a delicious pot that can be enjoyed straight from the fridge. Just add boiling water!

recipes.title: Caramel Oaty Wedges
recipes.description: Oats held together by caramel, chocolate, and all things nice. These are not that healthy snack you're looking for; they're the biggest, baddest sweet treat ready to help you into a sugar high at any moment.

recipes.title: Yakitori Chicken And Welsh Onions
recipes.description: If you want to get into Japanese food but you're not sure where to start, or perhaps want something familiar then this is an awesome place to start. Yakitori is skewered and grilled chicken. We've done it with welsh onions (otherwise know as leeks), which are massively popular in Japan!

recipes.title: Posh Beans On Toast
recipes.description: These aren't your average beans on toast. While opening a tin of baked beans is the easiest lunch ever, when you have a bit of left over tomato sauce we think it's worth putting in a little extra effort to make your own extra special baked beans on toast complete with juicy sausages.

recipes.title: Gnocchi With Pear Cranberry Gorgonzola S
recipes.description: My kitchen is under renovation so I had to make a light lunch. The Gorgonzola gets mellow in combination with fruits and cream, that even people who hate that cheese (like MIKE) can enjoy it.

recipes.title: Miso Beef And Pickled Vegetables
recipes.description: One of the awesome things about Japanese food is that it's super simple but still packed with flavour. This recipe is a great example of that and it's perfect for quick meal.
ingredients: 100 g shabu-shabu beef (or Wagu or Hida)
ingredients-original: 100 g shabu-shabu beef (or Wagu or Hida)

recipes.title: Rainbow Trout With Citrus Rice
recipes.description:
Sometimes all fish needs is a bit of lemon to taste fantastic. We flour a whole trout stuffed with lemon slices and gently grill it until lovely and crispy. 

Serve with some citrus rice and that's it... it needs nothing more!

recipes.title: Pulled Tandoori Salmon Sandwich
recipes.description: I decided to bang on everything I love on one single sandwich. Dark rye bread, avocado, salmon, apple and fennel together make the perfect summer lunch. It’s creamy and fatty but still darn healthy as well as rich and fresh all in one. Just perfect. (Serves 4)

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Saffron Lamb Shank
recipes.description: There is nothing better than lamb that falls off the bone at the slightest touch. Slow cooking is a foolproof way of getting perfectly tender meat that melts in your mouth. We add some North African flavours for something a bit different to your usual lam

recipes.title: Slow Cooked Butter Chicken
recipes.description: This is a smooth, mild curry that can be chucked in the slowcooker and forgotten about for hours before boiling a bit of rice and pouring in some cream when you need it. As the name suggests, we don't hold back on the fat in this indulgent dish, so save i
ingredients: a handful fresh coriander, leaves torn
ingredients-original: a handful fresh coriander, leaves torn

recipes.title: Udon Noodle Broth With Tempura Veg
recipes.description: This little beauty will warm your heart. It's mild flavoured but is like being wrapped in a noodley, mushroomy hug. You're going to love it, and it's well worth going to the effort of getting kombu and soaking it!

recipes.title: Okonomiyaki
recipes.description: You can put whatever you want into this Japanese pancake (no really, it's even in the name). We've gone for bacon and oysters. If you're not sure about that combination then be brave and give it a go... you might discover a new fave!
ingredients: 2 servings japanese BBQ sauce to serve
ingredients-original: 2 servings japanese BBQ sauce to serve

recipes.title: Asparagus Filled Pasta In Mint Butter
recipes.description: A wonderful dish I found a couple of years ago in Wales and now found the time to recreate it in my style

recipes.title: Beef Bourguignon
recipes.description: There are some recipes that just shouldn't be messed with and classic beef Bourguignon is one of them. The only difference here is that we've stuck it all in a slow cooker, making it perfect for throwing together before work and coming back home to a deli

recipes.title: Duck Strip Salad
recipes.description: Duck isn't the meat you'd usually think of breading and deep frying but trust us, it's perfect in this sweet, salty, citrusy salad. If you fancy a light meal, these Asian flavours are sure to satisfy!

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs
recipes.description: There a loads of meatball recipes from all over the world but the smaller Swedish version made of beef and pork have always been particularly popular. Here is our version of this great dish... without the need for flat-pack furniture!

recipes.title: Spiced Apple And Cinnamon Cupcakes
recipes.description: Cupcakes come in all sorts of flavours but there are a few surprises in our spiced apple cupcakes. For something a bit different we add nutmeg and allspice as well as the apple's perfect partner, cinnamon.For the apple part, we make a compote to spoon i

recipes.title: Green Pea Fritters
recipes.description: Perfect as they are or in a burger bun, its #meatlessMonday! (Ingredients for the dressing in the last step)

recipes.title: Japanese Cheesecake
recipes.description: This is the lightest, fluffiest, awesomest cheesecake you'll try in your whole life. Japanese cheesecake is where it's at. This recipe was developed after Ben's trip to Japan and is topped with a plum liqueur syrup which takes it to the next level.

recipes.title: Red Bean Filled Mochi Balls
recipes.description: Sweet dessert made from rice and beans?! Yep, and it's really tasty. These are really fun sweet treats to make at home, especially if you've never tried them before

recipes.title: Crinkle Cookies
recipes.description: These cookies are just simple and delicious but one easy step makes them into something that looks really impressive. We like to underbake them by a minute to get an amazing gooey centre.

recipes.title: Froyo Bars
recipes.description: This is that snack you need when you're craving something sweet but you really really really want to stick to the health kick and they're so easy to make. Yoghurt + whatever you want + freezer = deliciousness!

recipes.title: Ice Cream Sandwich
recipes.description: This refreshing treat has just the right balance of crumbly chocolatey biscuit and sharp creamy lemon curd ice cream. The ice cream will keep for ages if you can stop yourself from eating it!

recipes.title: Homemade Crunchie Bar
recipes.description: Making honeycomb at home and watching the bicarb of soda going crazy in the pan is probably once of the most satisfying things in the whole world. Add chocolate. You're welcome.

recipes.title: Raspberry And Blueberry Cheesecake
recipes.description:
Again I've been making cheesecake, I just can't get enough.

I made this for my friends birthday, which now seems to becoming tradition.

To save a few pennies opt for frozen fruit if you wish (I never seem to take my own advice). If you like a thicker biscuit base use more biscuits, you can easily play about with the quantities of fruit here.

recipes.title: Carne Asada
recipes.description: Cast your mind back to the best steak you ever had, then try this absolute monster of a recipe. A slab of beef marinated overnight, grilled and blackened, then finished in the oven and served how you like it. We're liking it medium rare....

recipes.title: Basque Chicken
recipes.description: This dish is the ultimate one pot meal and Spanish food is always really flavourful. It's one of those dishes that takes a bit of time, but all you have to do is chuck everything in and let it do it's thing.

recipes.title: Pineapple Buns
recipes.description: Pineapple buns are a Chinese treat that are popular in Hong Kong. Soft, pillowy dough with a crispy, crunchy topping. This really is a sweet bread recipe that you need up your sleeve. Oh and an interesting fact: There's no actual pineapple in pineapple buns!
ingredients: 1 egg yolk ( plus 1 extra for brushing)
ingredients-original: 1 egg yolk ( plus 1 extra for brushing)

recipes.title: Spanish Chorizo Tortilla
recipes.description: This is Spanish food at it's best. It makes a super quick, cheap lunch or dinner. You could even have it as a hearty breakfast! There's not much more to say... eggs, potatoes and onion with a few SORTED twists in the form of chorizo, peppers, sun dried tomatoes and olives. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Spicy Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
recipes.description: It is just ridiculously lazy – and just a perfect weeknighter.

recipes.title: Tapas Platter
recipes.description: All of these delicious Spanish tapas dishes can be plonked in the middle of a table for people to help themselves, which makes todays recipe(s) perfect for having your mates over or feeding the whole family.

recipes.title: Banana Pudding
recipes.description: We went all out to make sure that this was an authentic banana pudding experience by getting our hands on some proper American nilla wafers. Did we get it right?

recipes.title: Singapore Noodles
recipes.description: This was one of those dishes that we couldn't believe we hadn't done already. It's the perfect blend of Indian and Chinese flavours that makes Singaporean cuisine soooo delicious!

recipes.title: Steamed Chinese Sea Bream
recipes.description: Steaming is the best way of keeping the natural fresh flavour in fish when cooking it. We add Chinese flavours but make sure that the Sea Bream is the star of the dish.

recipes.title: Blackberry Onion Pizza
recipes.description: A recipe I found in a cooking magazine issue I brought back from Iceland. I made that pizza to eat at the football match between Iceland and Hungary. Awesome combo.

recipes.title: Miso Steak Salad
recipes.description: We're always saying that salads don't have to be boring or only eaten on a diet and we prove it once again here. Steak is awesome in any salad and it's even better when combined with our mix of Asian flavours.

recipes.title: Overnight Chocolate Oats
recipes.description: Scrap that healthy muesli stuff and join us in treating yourself every so often with these delicious chocolatey, fruit oats. Just mix everything together, fridge it overnight and bam... you've got breakfast ready to go in the morning.

recipes.title: Tilted Pannacotta
recipes.description: This is the best, most time consuming way to eat pannacotta! Seriously though, if you have guests round that you absolutely need to impress then this is going to do the job. It's worth every hour spent waiting nervously for it to set

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Chocolate Spoons
recipes.description: Best thing about these is the work to reward ratio. They take about 2 minutes hands on and you can forget about them for an hour and they're ready for you to show off to your friends. Plus chocolate spoons are probably the most instagram friendly things out there. Plus peanut butter.

recipes.title: Chocolate And Apricot Brioche
recipes.description: Brioche is a luxurious way to start the day, or just a great treat for any time. It's really easy to make if you follow our recipe and you're sure to be popular if you share it around!

recipes.title: Apple And Mango Crumble
recipes.description: There are loads of crumble variations out there. We even have a savoury one! We hate wasting food, and this crumble is great for using up old fruit that won't be eaten otherwise. We add desiccated coconut to the crumble topping to match the tropical mango

recipes.title: Curried Cottage Pie With Spiced Parsnip Mash
recipes.description: Cottage pie is a real family favourite but if you're looking for something familiar with a tasty twist, try our curried version with a lightly spiced parsnip mash.

recipes.title: Tomato Hulled Oats W Chicken
recipes.description: I’m a tomato-sauce kind of girl all days of the week and this recipe is what you can usually find on my table a weeknight.

recipes.title: Burfi
recipes.description:
Wow. We've made over 1000 burfi so we think that we can now officially call ourselves experts.

We made 3 flavours that all use the same basic recipe. Here they are: 

Dark chocolate, pistachio, almond and ground cardamom. 

White chocolate and mango with almond and pistachio as the nut base.

Coconut, ginger and lime with desiccated coconut and almond as the base and using white chocolate. 

Now go forth and make burfi!

recipes.title: Honey And Lemon Grilled Chicken
recipes.description: You don't need to do much to chicken to make it taste amazing. Honey and lemon is a great combination that compliments the meat perfectly and although this dish is simple, it looks and taste amazing. We also show you something a bit different to do with polenta!

recipes.title: White Chocolate And Raspberry Cheesecake
recipes.description: I tried to be a little different with this one opting for stevia sweetener granules to make a sugar free alternative cheesecake. If you want a more sugartastic taste just use 175g of caster sugar instead. I'm assuming any other granulated sweetener will work just as well but find out the ratio based on the above to use. Everything else is pretty much the same! If you want to maintain a sugar-free cheesecake then use sugar free biscuits, any will do and play about with the quantity. As a side note, I'm no expert on sugar free baking so any pointers are appreciated.

recipes.title: Lobster Soup
recipes.description: Or Humarsúpa, a classic soup from Iceland. Tasty and rich and on the expensive side. More on the blog.
ingredients: 5 cup prawn stock half ready made half fresh
ingredients-original: 5 cup prawn stock half ready made half fresh

recipes.title: Crispy Shrimp With Chow Mein Noodles
recipes.description:
There is nothing better than prawns coated with something crispy. Usually its breadcrumbs, but we're using prawn crackers... a double wham of prawn! We also crisp them up in the oven...much healthier than deep frying :)

Our prawns are served with wok fried noodles and crunchy veg!

recipes.title: Watermelon Pizza
recipes.description: A very tasty breakfast. I found it on Pinterest.

recipes.title: Ferrero Rocher Cake
recipes.description: This community is awesome. Last July I had 18 Followers and was so proud and Thanks to you, today I reached 15000 ! This is so exciting!

recipes.title: Red Velvet Cupcakes
recipes.description: With cream cheese inside and outside!

recipes.title: Creamy Venison And Mushroom With Cauliflower Rice
recipes.description:
This dish is great for when the days are getting a little cooler. The cream gives it a little luxury while the cauliflower 'rice' is an awesome little recipe that is healthier than regular white rice and keeps it low on carbs.

You could use a meat that you're more familiar with for this meal, like beef, but we love to try new things...especially when they're in season.

recipes.title: Sausage And Courgette Barley Risotto
recipes.description: This dish is SO cheap but is still something a bit different to show your family or friends. Risotto is usually made with rice, but we show you how to give it a twist using pearl barley instead.

recipes.title: Pasta With Serano Ham
recipes.description: A wonderful real 15 minute meal, the ham stays raw and is added last before serving.

recipes.title: Black Currant Mug Cake
recipes.description: My favorite recipe of cake in a mug for summer :)

recipes.title: Lemon And Rose Battenberg
recipes.description: This battenberg cake looks just like the traditional one, but we mixed it up a bit by using lemon and rose for an amazing unexpected flavour! It's a lot easier than you think so give it a go!
ingredients: 1 drizzle yellow and pink food colouring
500 g ready to roll white fondant icing
ingredients-original: 1 drizzle yellow and pink food colouring
500 g ready to roll white fondant icing

recipes.title: Stinging Nettle Pesto
recipes.description: Transform those stinging, nasty plants you spent your whole childhood avoiding to an incredible pesto!

recipes.title: Prawn And Caper Pasta Lunch
recipes.description: A recipe I cooked in realtime on Facebook! Although I cooked it, I didn't have much say in the matter... You guys chose every step!

recipes.title: Watermelon Ice Cream
recipes.description: Mixed with Buttermilk- super refreshing!

recipes.title: Vegetarian Stuffed Peppers
recipes.description: Today we prove that you don't have to be vegetarian to enjoy veggie dishes! These peppers have loads of flavour stuffed in (literally!) and we're sure you're going to love them.

recipes.title: Kinder Chocolate Liqueur
recipes.description: Indulgent and girly! Tastes even warm amazing.

recipes.title: Breakfast Burrito
recipes.description:
We're taking our favourite Tex-mex treat, a burrito, and then stuffing it with all some fantastic breakfast ingredients!

Sausage, egg, avocado all wrapped up in a burrito... Breakfast will never be the same again!

recipes.title: Epic Pizza Grilled Cheese
recipes.description: The fusion of two of Barry's favourite foods... a grilled cheese and a pizza. We know you'll live this!

recipes.title: Kroppkakor  Swedish Potato Dumplings
recipes.description: Directly translated this would be 'body-cookies' -and as all cookies it its freaking amazing!
ingredients: 150 g streaky bacon or salted pork belly
ingredients-original: 150 g streaky bacon or salted pork belly

recipes.title: Carrot Cake Loaf
recipes.description: We've had so many requests for a carrot cake recipe that we just had to go for it and create our SORTED version. Here's our perfectly moist carrot cake with sultanas and walnuts.

recipes.title: Feuillet  La Vanille
recipes.description: au fruit de la passion. Puff pastry filled with vanilla cream and fresh passion fruit. Summery and a show off dessert, but a mess to eat.

recipes.title: Wagon Wheels
recipes.description: Here's a bit of a childhood favourite... we recreate wagon wheels by simply sandwiching marshmallows between homemade biscuits and covering with melted chocolate. Easy!

recipes.title: Belgian Blueberry Waffles  300 Recipe
recipes.description: A yeasty batter with fresh blueberries baked in. Read more about the background of today´s baking on my blog.

recipes.title: Korean Hot Wings
recipes.description: What can I say? These are probably the best thing you'll taste on the day you make them. Maybe even the best thing all week. Perhaps the best thing you put in your mouth for a month. It could be that a year goes by without you tasting anything so good.

recipes.title: Steak And Mushroom Pudding
recipes.description: Here's our version of a very traditional British savoury pudding. This takes a little time to prepare, but once it's cooking you can pretty much leave it alone for 4 hours and come back to a dinner that's ready to go!

recipes.title: Surf And Turf Kebabs
recipes.description: If you EVER get served a BBQ kebab without a drizzle of something (such as the amazing spicy herby marinade used in this recipe) then politely and calmly refuse it before making a swift exit from the offending establishment. Make your way home and cook these instead.

recipes.title: Migas Texmex Style
recipes.description: It is a breakfast dish, but for lunch or dinner not bad too. Leftover corn tortillas and all other things sitting around are fit to go in and baked with eggs

recipes.title: Chocolate And Pear Pavlovas
recipes.description: This sweet dessert is not for the faint hearted. We pipe out crispy and chewy individual meringues before filling them with a chocolate cream cheese. Then to cut through all the sugar, we add some fresh juicy pears.

recipes.title: Simple Scallops
recipes.description: Simple scallops are the best scallops. Frying these in a super hot pan is one of the best ways to eat them, and it's not as hard as you think. We keep accompaniments to a minimum, with the perfect match of crispy bacon and fennel. A starter to impress...

recipes.title: Spicy Minimeatballs
recipes.description: Another meatball recipe. It's been a few uploads from my side but I really adore this one! Spicy, salty and in miniature form. Perfect.

recipes.title: Avo Chicken Wraps
recipes.description: So um... can we agree that this might be the best lunch idea in the world? We think so, and if you don't then you're probably wrong.

recipes.title: Pumpkin And Pecan Pie
recipes.description: This is our take on a fantastic American dessert, often seen around Thanksgiving. Pumpkin is a vegetable that lends itself really well to sweet dishes. We top it with candied pecans to add a bit of extra crunch to the beautifully smooth pumpkin mixture.

recipes.title: Show Stopper Squiche
recipes.description: We invented a new thing just for Ben's birthday. It's called a squiche (sweet quiche) and it's definitely not just a custard tart because that's what a sweet quiche actually is. It's totally unique and you have to try it.

recipes.title: Chicken Katsu Curry
recipes.description: This chicken katsu dish was made famous by Wagamamas and now we're sharing a nifty homemade recipe of it! An easy, simple Japanese curry consisting of crispy breaded chicken, a mound of rice and a glossy curry sauce.

recipes.title: Spelt Bread Souls
recipes.description: or Schwäbische Dinkelseelen. A specialty from Swabia in southwest Germany. It is told that in the Middle Ages on All Souls Day the pour people were given bread - but since the Swabia were known for their penny pinching and still are :-) the bread was rather small. The name seelen (souls) stuck. It is a breakfast item and not available where I live.

recipes.title: Christmas Panettone Pudding
recipes.description: We've substituted summer berries for winter fruits and Christmassy spices to make a seasonal version of our awesome summer pudding. We also switched bread out for sweet panettone for an extra special Italian treat!
ingredients: 8 slices panettone or other sweet bread
ingredients-original: 8 slices panettone or other sweet bread

recipes.title: Thai Pork Meatballs With Noodle Soup
recipes.description: My favourite dish of late so simple but very satisfying. Served with stir fried mushrooms and broccoli, veggies can easily be swapped for anything to your liking. Dish can be made gluten free with gf alternative ingredients. Tamari is a gf alternative to soy sauce.

recipes.title: Bbq Chicken Flower Pie
recipes.description: Please note, this pie will still taste delicious whether or not it's in the shape of a flower, but we needed to get your attention somehow right? :)

recipes.title: Shrimp Blt
recipes.description: We're ready for the hate... bring it on. Yes we added shrimp to a BLT. Yes we smothered the bacon in maple syrup. Yes, we even flavoured the mayo (gasp). Enjoy! :D

recipes.title: Festive Sausage Rolls
recipes.description: This is the perfect way to use up leftovers from christmas dinner as finger food for the family on boxing day! You don't have to wait until after Christmas though...you can grab these ingredients all year round for a cheeky snack any time ;)

recipes.title: Mango And Coconut Popsicles
recipes.description: These are perfect for putting in your mouth during the summer months! Check other flavours on our profile too!
ingredients: 150 g mango, peeled, destoned and roughly chopped
ingredients-original: 150 g mango, peeled, destoned and roughly chopped

recipes.title: Nutella Popsicles
recipes.description: You clicked on this for the Nutella and who are we to disappoint you? This is basically frozen Nutella so what is there not to like? (No seriously, give this recipe a like...)

recipes.title: Bourbon Butter Mussels
recipes.description: These are one of those omg match ups. Bourbon + smoky paprika and mussels, all brought together with butter. It's. so. good.

recipes.title: Rockafella Mussels
recipes.description: There's a reason that this flavour combination became a classic. If you've never tried it for yourself then go grab the ingredients below and get into the kitchen!

recipes.title: Potato Salad
recipes.description: There's nothing better to have on it's own or as part of a big BBQ table spread than a really good potato salad. Make sure it's really really good with this recipe.

recipes.title: Steak And Monkfish Kebabs
recipes.description: Surf and turf!!! Yeah we get excited about surf and turf. All the best things on one plate and you are never ever going to have kebabs without an awesome dressing ever again after this.

recipes.title: Goatcheese Avocado Cream
recipes.description: Tasty and great as a dip or eat on warm toasted sweet potatoes

recipes.title: Melted Cheese Sticks
recipes.description: This recipe is a twist on the old Christmas favourite, breaded camembert. Instead of cubes or wedges we make posh cheese sticks with an awesome, sticky, spiced orange relish.

recipes.title: Cheesy Bread Pao De Queijo
recipes.description: When we did a series on Brazilian food and didn't do pao de queijo there was worldwide outrage. This was requested so much that we just had to try them. You were right... they're really, really good.

recipes.title: Strawberry Chia Jam
recipes.description: Seriously the easiest recipe ever, swap out the ingredients as you like but keep the fruit to chia seed ratio and it should be fine.

recipes.title: German Apple Cinnamon Pancake
recipes.description: Eating this pancake brought back memories. My mom made them when I was a kid.

recipes.title: Mulled Wine Duck
recipes.description: Duck isn't the first meat you'd associate with Christmas but it's a worthy alternative to turkey or goose and it goes perfectly with sweet, spiced mulled wine. We serve our duck with brussels but instead of cooking them whole we've shredded them, which is a great way of introducing them to people who aren't convinced about how good they can taste!

recipes.title: Eggnog Shake
recipes.description: Eggnog must be the first drink that you think of at Christmas. We serve ours cold as a milkshake but it's still laced with cherry brandy... perfect with a few brandy snaps for the added crunch!

recipes.title: Christmas Risotto
recipes.description: Not a fan of cold turkey sandwiches? Maybe you should try our turkey risotto to use up those Christmas leftovers. Our version also uses up your leftover cheeses and even the last of the stuffing in this awesome meal... or just make it all year round!

recipes.title: Cheeky Chocolate Cheesecake
recipes.description: This is such an indulgent cheesecake that we're making it in individual portions to regulate you chocoholics! It's also got a really cheeky kick of baileys to make this the ultimate after dinner treat.

recipes.title: Cheats Lamb Stew
recipes.description: This lamb stew is a good winter warmer and although lamb is a little bit of luxury, the chickpeas and cous cous make this meal a low cost way to fill up your family or mates. best of all... you get all the same great spices as a tagine... but this version is seriously speedy.

recipes.title: Choc Cakes W Blackberry And Mascarpone
recipes.description: Light chocolate sponge, blackberry jam and mascarpone filling. With some chocolate on top, of course.
ingredients: couple of tbsp blackberry jam (or more if you prefer)
ingredients-original: couple of tbsp blackberry jam (or more if you prefer)

recipes.title: Pannacotta With Gentian
recipes.description: and Mountain herbs. The alcohol and the herbs are giving this dish a nice touch

recipes.title: Gruyre And Oregano Biscuits
recipes.description: I actually ended up with some leftover cheese the other week and I wanted to use it up somehow. This is the recipe I ended up with and to be honest, these biscuits is such a killer! They are cheesy, crumbly and herby all in once.

recipes.title: Maccaroni And Peas
recipes.description: A vegetarian pasta dish for people who love peas.

recipes.title: Pineapple Fritters
recipes.description: These pineapple fritters are amazingly crispy because we coat them in light tempura batter, which is ridiculously easy to make! We've marinated the pineapple in rum and coconut for an extra tropical twist.

recipes.title: Italian Onion Rings
recipes.description: These are our onion rings with a difference! The batter is mixed with the Italian flavours of basil, sun dried tomatoes and black olives. Not only is the flavour amazing, but the rings come out in 3 different colours... a talking point on any plate!

recipes.title: Tempura Prawns With Edamame Salad
recipes.description: Tempura is a huge favourite when it comes to Japanese food. To counteract the deep fried prawns, we create a quick, light edamame and avocado salad with a spicy soy dressing.

recipes.title: Butter Poached Pork With Cider Chicory
recipes.description: This method of butter poaching the pork fillet in a pan of hot water cooks it right through without any risk of over cooking or drying out. To serve this with awesome chunky chips and the bitter chicory braised briefly in a sweet cider makes for the ultimate combo!

recipes.title: Chinese Pork Belly And Sesame Potatoes
recipes.description: Pork belly is being used more and more often. It's cheap and tastes amazing...what's not to like? You might think it's difficult to cook perfectly but we make it foolproof with this recipe. You don't often see potatoes in Chinese cooking, but flavoured with sesame and soy they fit perfectly in this dish!

recipes.title: Swedish Sunshine Buns
recipes.description: The sunshine bun have so many different names here in Sweden – vanilla buns, sugar buns, sailor buns or Paris buns. All exactly the same and just utterly delicious. Soft and pillowy dough with cardamom accompanied by a smooth and silky custard makes the perfect partner to a cup of coffee or strawberry fruit drink.
ingredients: 50 g fresh yeast (or one package dried)
ingredients-original: 50 g fresh yeast (or one package dried)

recipes.title: Winter Veggie Bake
recipes.description: Today we've created a tasty veggie bake that could be the perfect centrepiece when you're cooking for friends and family. The eggs are the secret ingredient in this dish... They make the rice perfectly silky and keep the whole thing really juicy!

recipes.title: Lemon And Lime Sesame Muffin
recipes.description: A tangy and less sweet muffin without refinded sugar. Moist and stays fresh for a while.

recipes.title: Hazelnut Peach Cookies
recipes.description: Soft nutty cookies with refreshing bits of peach.

recipes.title: Hazelnut Chicken
recipes.description: When you're looking to treat yourself on a cold night, chicken with a creamy white wine sauce is always a favourite. We mix it up a bit by simply adding hazelnuts, which go brilliantly with this tried and tested classic.

recipes.title: Courgette Parsnip Potato Fritters
recipes.description: served with Avo and dill  dip. Vegetarian at its best.

recipes.title: Jaffa Cakes
recipes.description: Jaffa cakes are surprisingly easy to make and taste great! Are they a cake or biscuit? Who knows! All we know is that chocolate, orange and sponge make for a heavenly combination. Bake up a batch and see what you think of this SORTEDfood version.

recipes.title: Butter Cookie
recipes.description: This recipe is taken from a popular Chinese home-baking tutor and it really makes super super crumbly butter cookies!

recipes.title: Matcha Cake
recipes.description: Get the recipe for this delightful matcha cake.... It's the perfect summer birthday cake for anyone obsessed with matcha! The sponge is infused with the green tea and sandwiched together with lashings of butter cream. You'll be able to show off your baking skills as the 4 layers are mega impressive as you cut into the cake.

recipes.title: Moroccan Lamb Burgers
recipes.description: We love the sweet Moroccan flavours, we love burgers... so why not put the two together? For Jamie Oliver on his Food Tube we make our juicy lamb mince burgers, packed out with falafel inspired chickpeas, dried figs and plenty of all the spices you'd associate with the perfect Moroccan dish!

recipes.title: Spinach Pasta And Bacon
recipes.description: When you use frozen spinach the meal is ready to eat very fast

recipes.title: Parmesan Crusted Quiche W Caper Berries
recipes.description: This quiche have all the flavors of summer for me – the slightly tangy caper berries together the sweet sun dried tomatoes and the red onion just reminds me of all those summer nights in the garden. Socializing over some grilled meat, a cheesy quiche and a salad.

recipes.title: Chunky Chilli Con Carne And Smashed Roots
recipes.description: We get rid of the usual mince and replace it with amazing chunks of stewing beef steak to put a twist on something we cook all the time. It's simmered for ages so that the flavours really develop and the beef just falls apart the minute you touch it, then we stick it in the middle of some tasty smashed root vegetables and tuck in! A twist that even Jamie himself is impressed with!

recipes.title: Breakfast Doughnuts
recipes.description: Who said you can't have doughnuts for breakfast? Eh? A stack of these will sort you right out for the day. (Disclaimer: do not eat a stack of these for breakfast)

recipes.title: Dirty Doughnut Fries
recipes.description: Feast your eyes and your mouth on these naughty bad boys. You have never had doughnuts like them. (Pssst like to vote for me.)

recipes.title: Oreo Doughnut Holes
recipes.description: These are absolutely spectacular! I'm so proud so make sure you give me a like if you like these!

recipes.title: 4Ingredient Nomachine Matcha Oreo Ice Cream
recipes.description: The earthy undertones of matcha (green tea) and the sweetness of the ubiquitous Oreo cookies pair extremely well together in this no-churn ice cream!
ingredients: ¼ cup matcha green tea powder
ingredients-original: ¼ cup matcha green tea powder

recipes.title: Pea And Ham Orzo
recipes.description: Jamie Oliver is known for his risottos. So we try to mix things up... this recipe is a great alternative to having the stand over a risotto and continuously stirring and it's ready in half the time. Orzo is rice shaped pasta that gives a really creamy risotto-like dish at the end. It's cooked just the same except all the stock is bunged in at once and you just let it do its thing. Simple!

recipes.title: Prawn Biryani
recipes.description: In Jamie Oliver's kitchen we cook up the slightly tricky dish of Biryani, but share a foolproof method with you. It's a real restaurant favourite and rewarding to make yourself! It looks amazing when you combine a selection of fragrant whole spices and you can stick in any meat or veg you fancy. We've chosen to cook prawns, and rather than vegetables we have opted for the Goan influence of cashew nuts and sultanas.

recipes.title: Mocca Ice Cream
recipes.description: rich and indulgend!
ingredients: 40 ml Camp chicoree and coffee essence
ingredients-original: 40 ml Camp chicoree and coffee essence

recipes.title: Cheesecake Doughnuts
recipes.description: You might think that doughnuts are really difficult to make at home, but with our help and a little patience you'll breeze through! We've added our twist by syringing strawberry cheesecake filling into the middle and coating them in a glacé icing and digestive biscuits just like a cheesecake base...yummy... even Jamie Oliver says so!

recipes.title: Peanut And Crisp Cookies
recipes.description: OK this might sound crazy...ready salted crisps in a cookie! But for Jamie Oliver's Food Tube we're willing to push to the limits. Honestly, it all works so well together! Sweet peanut cookies, salty crisps and dark chocolate. Once you try these you'll wonder why you've never had them before. Get cooking!

recipes.title: Black Pepper Blackberry Chia Pudding
recipes.description: The combination of the blackberries and the black pepper sounds strange at first, but the more you think about it the more sense it makes. The peppery fire complements the sweet berries in the most delicious way and together they give a banging kick to the mild vanilla flavor of the chia pudding.

recipes.title: Turkey Meatball  Veg Tray Bake
recipes.description: This meal takes very little effort for loads of flavour. All you need to do is peel some veg, make gorgeous homemade turkey meatballs and while that's all cooking whip up a fantastic ranch dressing. Less than an hour start to finish!

recipes.title: Chicken Maryland
recipes.description: We love to have this dish as a bit of a treat; with the fried chicken and creamy succotash it's real comfort food. Instead of adding a twist, we stick with the traditional fried bananas - that's already pretty interesting!

recipes.title: Jerk Sweet Potatoes
recipes.description: Baked potatoes are probably a staple lunch for loads of people, but the same old toppings can get boring. Instead of normal potatoes we use healthy sweet potatoes that go really well with our piquant jerk tomatoes. Spice up your next baked potato with this awesome recipe!

recipes.title: Berry Barry Tarts
recipes.description: I like berries because they sound like my name and that's so fun. Lol.

recipes.title: Lovely Lemon Eclairs
recipes.description: These are just lovely. Put them in your mouth and enjoy a creamy lemony explosion.

recipes.title: Espresso Cannoli
recipes.description: Chocolate. Coffee. Deep fried pastry. I win the battle.
