recipes.title: Kiwi And Quinoa Salad
recipes.description: I started with kiwi and parsly and then added other things I love – my favorite quinoa mix for texture, juicy tomatoes and red onion, some feta cheese for some smoothness and saltiness and then I dressed the salad in the simplest way possible. The result? A cool and soothing salad, sweet and savory all at the same time and just perfect for hot summer days!

recipes.title: Pearfect Aperol Spritz
recipes.description: The classic 1:2:3 ratio of pimped with an extra "1"... and couldn't be easier! Make a jug and share it around.
ingredients: 1 tin of pear halves in juice (not syrup!)
ingredients-original: 1 tin of pear halves in juice (not syrup!)

recipes.title: Ginger Whiskers
recipes.description: This is refreshing and fiery at the same time. The spicy nutty flavours of the whiskey paired with hot ginger, fruity and sweet orange liqueur over ice is a winner!

recipes.title: Surf And Turf Trout With Lemon And Chive Crushed Potatoes
recipes.description: When you think of fish and potato you probably think of cod and chips but we have an amazing (and healthier) alternative for you. We use amazing rainbow trout wrapped in salty parma ham and serve it with light, zesty crushed new potatoes.

recipes.title: Blackberry Gin Fizz
recipes.description: This is a favourite if you're a fan of a fruity cocktail... the blackberry and elderflower combo makes it super summery.
ingredients: 1 tbsp sugar syrup (1:1 hot water & caster)
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp sugar syrup (1:1 hot water & caster)

recipes.title: Vegetarian Feijoada
recipes.description:
Woah woah woah. We know. Feijoada is one of the meatiest things out there and you just can't mess with an absolute classic. BUT we reckon we've done alright here. 

To pack this full of flavour like the original we've used stacks of mushrooms. They're everywhere and trust us, it's worth it.

recipes.title: Moqueca De Camaro Coconut Shrimp Stew
recipes.description:
This is probably one of the tastiest stews ever... SO much flavour packed in yet it's really really simple! 

If you're into seafood and a bit of spice then this needs to be your next meal.

recipes.title: Acaraje
recipes.description: These are pretty unusual little snacks. Black eyed beans are blitzed to a paste and fried as fritters. They are really good.
ingredients: 1 l vegetable oil for deep frying
ingredients-original: 1 l vegetable oil for deep frying

recipes.title: Chimichurri Salad
recipes.description: Get your mouth around this fresh, totally inauthentic Brasil inspired salad. It’s tasty, even if you might not find it anywhere in Brasil. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Baked Plum Pudding
recipes.description: These baked plums are a ridiculously easy one tray wonder. Mix the pastry dough, mix the plum filling, chuck everything onto a tray, stick it in the oven and you're Sorted ;)

recipes.title: Sushi Donuts
recipes.description: I found a vegan version of it in a newspaper this morning. I wanted to make some sushi for dinner anyway, so I made these.

recipes.title: Salt Beef Bagel
recipes.description: You've got to get organised if you want to serve this when your friends are round next...it will take you at least 2 days to get the perfect salt beef! Don't worry though, you'll actually only need about 20 minutes work, then let the ingredients do all the work to make the most incredible beef!

recipes.title: White Chocolate Rocky Road
recipes.description: Our rocky road is packed with twists on the original. They look great and taste even better!

recipes.title: Breakfast Muffins
recipes.description:
This might just be the BEST breakfast ever!

We take the best bits of a Full English breakfast and blend them up into the most awesome burger you've ever tasted. We then top our sausage, mushroom and black pudding burger with the perfect fried egg, courtesy of Happy Eggs!

recipes.title: Lamb Koftes
recipes.description:
Such a simple, keep and easy dish to make, minimal effort is required.

Serve with tabbouleh or fattoush (a middle eastern salad). Both recipes can be found on here

recipes.title: Nectarine And Fig Cobbler
recipes.description: Fresh picked figs from my own tree and lovely ripe nectarines make a great dessert. Eaten warm with some creme fraiche.

recipes.title: Berry Mojito Crepes
recipes.description:
Thin, soft crepes are one of the most simple but satisfying things to eat. You can have them with all sorts of fillings for any meal but today we're making awesome boozy mojito berries, although the alcohol is optional! This one comes with a fire warning too... flambé is optional too!

Thanks to Happy Eggs for providing our eggs for this one! :)

recipes.title: Peach Blueberry Tart
recipes.description: I wanted to see what's all that fuss about coconut sugar. I see Gerrit's been using it recently. So here it is, a nice summer treat, but you can also make it with canned peaches and frozen blueberries. Coconut sugar gives it a real nice caramel flavor, and with the hazelnuts in the crust, well what can I say.

recipes.title: Laksa
recipes.description:
Laksa is an incredible seafood soup with flavours inspired from Malaysia and Singapore, and this is our Westernised version!

If Malaysian food is new to you, the flavours are amazing, with influences of Indian, Chinese and Thai cuisines.

Big thanks to Happy Eggs for supplying the eggs for the video.

recipes.title: Blueberrysea Buckthorn Coconut Crumble
recipes.description: I’ve always loved the crumble – it’s such a simple and humble dessert that evokes those childhood memories of eating apple crumble with such a massive amount of creme anglaise that you basically needed a rowing boat to get to the actual crumble. I also love that you can whip a crumble up so easily if you get unexpected visitors using cupboard ingredients and frozen berries. Today I paired my blueberries with sea buckthorn for a tangy kick to the otherwise sweet topping and the shredded coconut in the crumble brings a chewy and nutty flavor that works so nicely with the blueberries.

recipes.title: Fros
recipes.description: THE drink of the summer. Created during the heatwave of the New York, we thought we'd be give it a go. Using a slush machine makes this super easy but without one it's achievable too! Simply fork it up in the freezer every now and then.

recipes.title: Breaded Mushrooms With Lemon And Tarragon Mayo
recipes.description:
Deep fried mushrooms are one of our favourite pub foods, but they're also ridiculously easy to make at home as well!

They're especially good with our homemade lemon and tarragon mayo, which is just as easy if you follow our lead. You really can't get better than fresh mayo...it's the perfect use for the eggs that Happy Eggs have given us!

recipes.title: Pain De Mie
recipes.description: Pain de Mie is a great beginners loaf. It's a slightly enriched bread, containing milk & butter, but is soft and delicious! Mie means crumb French :)

recipes.title: White Rolls
recipes.description: A great basic white roll to start baking homemade bread on your own! This recipe yields twelve 35g rolls.

recipes.title: Dark Chocolate And Ginger Eclairs
recipes.description:
Choux pastry and pastry cream are two fundamental recipes that will serve you well if you ever need to whip up a dessert. Both might seem tricky, but once you get the hang of it they are awesome to have stored away for when you have guests!

You'll notice there's a lot of eggs in this one...thanks Happy Eggs!
ingredients: 1 piece of stem ginger in syrup
ingredients-original: 1 piece of stem ginger in syrup

recipes.title: Fettuccine Alfredo
recipes.description: Best not to worry about the amount of butter and cheese in this... 'Cos it's incredible. Love it.

recipes.title: Bloke Pasta
recipes.description: An epic dish that is designed FOR blokes BY a Bloke (also suitable for blokettes of course)!

recipes.title: Mushroom  Goats Cheese Open Rav
recipes.description: Yes, I'm getting all fancy again. But yes, it's well worth it. My favourite flavours layered between fresh pasta sheets... Oh, AND easy garlic bread!

recipes.title: Smoked Haddock Chowder With Baguette Croutes
recipes.description: We've made a thick, creamy potato and fish chowder with zingy lemon, smoky fish, fresh tomato and sweet kernels of corn. It's really filling so perfect for healthy eating!
ingredients: 2 naturally smoked haddock fillets, skin removed
ingredients-original: 2 naturally smoked haddock fillets, skin removed

recipes.title: Shallot Tarte Tatin With Steak
recipes.description: Is there anything more satisfying than cooking the perfect steak? Cooking the perfect tarte tatin comes close. We've put both on the same plate and the combination is amazing. Sweet shallots and pastry with juicy charred steak...heaven!
ingredients: 1 pack of ready rolled puff pastry
400 g your favourite cut of steak
ingredients-original: 1 pack of ready rolled puff pastry
400 g your favourite cut of steak

recipes.title: Buttermilk Overnight Bread
recipes.description: A strange way to bake a bread, it tastes amazing but it took me a lot of patience not to open the oven to check for nearly 12 hours.
ingredients: 75 g sourdough starter or 3 tbsp dried one
ingredients-original: 75 g sourdough starter or 3 tbsp dried one

recipes.title: Sesame Tofu With Miso Rice
recipes.description: We've had loads of requests for tofu dishes and we've finally come up with the perfect recipe that really makes the most it!

recipes.title: Pulled Pork Sandwich
recipes.description: BBQ pulled pork is HUGE over in the America but we don't get enough of it over here... It's about time we change that!So we've taken matters into our own hands and cooked up a big batch for the crew. You'll love this one!

recipes.title: Hash Browns Lemon Chicken And Pine Nut Peas
recipes.description: This is a great example of clean simple flavours making a really tasty meal. We inject a little bit of technique with the homemade hash browns...an easy way to impress guests!

recipes.title: Mushroom And Pickled Cucumber Sweet Potato Toast
recipes.description: Who knew you could cook sweet potato in the toaster?! Just slice it up, give it about 3 rounds in the toaster then top it with something delicious like mushrooms and pickled cucumber. Pow.

recipes.title: Avocado Sweet Potato Toast
recipes.description: This might just be the greatest toast topping ever. Guacamole, roasted tomatoes, pesto and cashew nuts. And it's vegan. Wowzer

recipes.title: Caramelised Banana Sweet Potato Toast
recipes.description:
We couldn't go on a sweet potato toast binge without trying out something sweet. Banana, nutella and peanut butter is a bit of a classic combination that is perfect with sweet potato!

Remember to make it homemade nutella to make this vegan!

recipes.title: Apple Lemon Pork
recipes.description: Pork on the bbq just goes so well and the marinade means that it will stay nice and juicy. You want the bbq really hot so that you can caramelise the fat without overcooking the pork!

recipes.title: Spicy Smoky Steak
recipes.description: There is nothing better than a big hunk of meat on the bbq. We recommend an absolutely mahoosive steak for this recipe so that you can get it really dark but keep that centre nice and rare. Yum.

recipes.title: Apricot Pancakes
recipes.description: Apricots are my favorite summer fruits, so I definitely had to make those!)

recipes.title: Epic Millionaires Shortbread
recipes.description: How can we make the classic combination of shortbread, caramel and chocolate really epic? Add bacon and bourbon of course! Once you've tried this moorish recipe you'll never go back!

recipes.title: Lemon Posset And Strawberry Jam
recipes.description: This is probably the easiest dessert you'll ever see us make! You can do it way ahead of time so it's perfect for when you've got friends over. It's so easy that you'll have plenty of time to make some homemade strawberry jam to have with it :)

recipes.title: Herb And Cheese Bread
recipes.description: I have so many herbs on my balcony, I harvested 20 different ones and made a bread ring. More about it on the blog.

recipes.title: Black Forest Gateau
recipes.description: Black Forest Gateau originated in Germany almost 100 years ago. With so much history there's not much we want to do to change it! Here's our version of this chocolatey cherry cake.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Arugula Salad
recipes.description: Roasted (or, if you're in a hurry, microwaved) sweet potatoes tossed with arugula, feta, and a simple balsamic vinaigrette.

recipes.title: Blackberry  Black Pepper Jam
recipes.description:
Jam is one of the simplest... a basic ratio... just 1:1
Using blackberries and a crack of black pepper to slightly spice this one makes it extra special.

recipes.title: Chai Custard
recipes.description: A classic vanilla custard is good... but a sweet and slightly spiced one infused with the flavours of chai is better.

recipes.title: Orange Curd
recipes.description: Lemon curd is the obvious... but orange is really good too. Less tangy and more zesty.

recipes.title: Chocolate And Coffee Sauce
recipes.description: Simple. But simply delicious.

recipes.title: Vegan Ice Cream Cake
recipes.description: This is the winning recipe for the vegan battle. Who doesn't like an ice cream cake?

recipes.title: Crusted Lamb Chops With Roasted Squash Pure
recipes.description: You can't beat meat and potatoes, especially when it's perfectly pink crusted lamb and crispy roast new potatoes! We also add a bit of veg with our silky smooth butternut squash puree.

recipes.title: Salted Caramel Sauce
recipes.description: Yes it's a buzz word... but also... who doesn't love it?

recipes.title: Green Quinoa Risotto
recipes.description: It's vegan! I promise this will blow your mind when you try it. Vote for Mike by liking my recipe!

recipes.title: Roasted Tomato Squashetti
recipes.description: Spiralizing squash is the funnest thing ever. It could keep me entertained for hours. Literally hours.

recipes.title: Raspberry And Lime Jam
recipes.description: Not the classic combo... but a damn fine one I promise!

recipes.title: Hazelnut And Orange Biscotti
recipes.description: These twice baked biscuits are perfect for dunking in your lattes or cappuccinos. You can substitute the nuts and orange for your favourite flavours, making it well worth the extra effort to bake them yourself!

recipes.title: Blue Grapes And Pancetta Pizza
recipes.description: An other recipe from my Icelandic food magazine issue. The balance between salty and sweet is awesome.

recipes.title: Blueberry Blondies
recipes.description: If you've never had a blondie you're missing out! They're a similar texture to  brownies but replace the chocolate with brown sugar. We make them even better with lemon and blueberries.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Cheese
recipes.description: You need cauliflower cheese in your life. This recipe was made for all you students out there needing comfort food on the cheap. It's a whole dinner in one! Add sausages and beans into the mix and you're transported back to childhood in a flash.
ingredients: 1 handful of grated mature cheddar cheese
ingredients-original: 1 handful of grated mature cheddar cheese

recipes.title: Soy Glazed Bbq Salmon
recipes.description: A whole side of salmon is one of the best things to cook for a big crowd and it looks amazing in the middle of the table. This recipe with soy glaze is easy to cook and you just let everyone dig in after it's come off the BBQ smokin' hot.

recipes.title: Dirty Mushroom Burgers
recipes.description:
Vegetarian burgers can just be the worst. This one isn't. Two portobello mushrooms sandwiched around a tasty mix of herby goats cheese, and golden breadcrumbs. 

It's genuinely delicious and isn't trying to be anything it's not. Cook this.

recipes.title: Grilled Onions And Maple Bacon Carrots
recipes.description: These are two side that are perfect for the BBQ but slightly different to the usual offerings. The smoky onions go so well with the sweet and sour of the sugar and vinegar, and then carrots, but WRAPPED IN BACON!!! Which means they're sweet, salty and just all round delicious. Plus we're serving them with a maple syrup and mustard mayo. We just won.

recipes.title: Miso Grilled Aubergines
recipes.description: Miso just makes things taste good. Aubergine is the perfect veg to grill on the bbq (smoke + aubergine = yum). So miso and aubergine together in one epic bbq side dish seems like a no brainer.

recipes.title: Barbecue Strawberries
recipes.description: Ever thought of cooking strawberries on a barbecue? No? Well why not?! They're perfect left in the embers once you've cooked everything else.

recipes.title: Thai Fish Cakes
recipes.description: These simple fish cakes are the ideal starter to a homemade Thai meal. Authentic in flavour, yet simple to make. Oh... and the dipping sauce... one you'll be using time and time again for all sorts of dishes!

recipes.title: Chocolate Bliss Balls
recipes.description: These amazing little bliss balls is a healthier option inspired by a classic Swedish cake called ‘chokladbollar’ (I have a recipe for those up on SortedFOOD). These little nibbles still feel like a treat despite being good for you. Soft and gooey with a rich chocolate flavor that makes it easy to gollop the whole recipe down in an afternoon.

recipes.title: Chicken Fricasse
recipes.description: Very traditional in its method... but with new flavours that are perfect for spring/summer. Why not buy a whole chicken and cut it up yourself to save you money too?
ingredients: 2 tbsp butter (30g) + plus an extra knob
a large handful of button mushrooms
175 ml a glass of white wine
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp butter (30g) + plus an extra knob
a large handful of button mushrooms
175 ml a glass of white wine

recipes.title: Banana Lassi With Chocolate Chews
recipes.description: Merging two recipes... a soothing yoghurt based drink from India and one of the first recipes Ben ever cooked as a kid! Banana and chocolate in a combo that's made for them!

recipes.title: Pepperoni Pizza Swirl
recipes.description: There are so many variations of pizza out there... thin base, deep pan, stuffed crust, or even with a polenta or naan bread base. But by rolling it up and cutting it into swirls it makes it perfect for a packed lunch or picnic.

recipes.title: Chocolate Rice Pudding
recipes.description: rich and creamy and even on a day with 35 C a treat. Even better when you do not have to cook it on the stove but in the machine TM31

recipes.title: Crme Brle W A Pomegranate Twist
recipes.description: Crème brûlée is one of my absolute favorite desserts. The simplicity of the creamy, vanilla base and the caramelized sugar is just unbeatable to me. However, I really wanted to put a twist on a classic recipe to switch it up a bit and the recipe worked out so great! The pomegranate juice in the caramel transforms it from just being sweet to having a fruity hint and the seeds on top gives it freshness to cut through the heavy cream base.

recipes.title: German Burrito
recipes.description: We've had a recipe request from [Dave Days](http://www.youtube.com/davedays) asking us to create a german burrito. So, we've gone all out and made our own sauerkraut and spaetzle, then chucked in german salami, cheese and mustard. It's really unusual but it all works so well together in a wrap...you have to try it!

recipes.title: Chocolate And Coconut Pudding
recipes.description: [Jess](http://www.youtube.com/user/exoticjess) has requested a coconut inspired dessert that is vegan. We think that we've nailed this one...it looks impressive, it's interesting and most importantly it tastes great! Serve this to anyone and they'll be happy!

recipes.title: Key Lime Pie
recipes.description: This request from JIM CHAPMAN for a Key Lime Pie is an american classic. They use the amazing key limes, from Florida. We've put a few twists in, replacing the meringue with icing and the traditional base with ginger nuts...we think it's just as good as the original!

recipes.title: Vegan Curry
recipes.description: We often get asked for more vegan dishes... so this video recipe request from LISA SCHWARTZ was the perfect opportunity to give one a go. This savoury dish of spiced okra sits perfectly on a bed of cumin spiked humous.

recipes.title: Merguez Bell Pepper And Onion Pasta
recipes.description: This pasta is one of my recent obsessions – merguez, bell pepper and onion pasta. The one thing I love the most about the whole dish is the sauce. It’s one of those that is still thick enough to cling on to every last millimeter of the pasta but at the same time it’s still creamy and luxurious. And the taste, let us not forget the epic taste of the sweet bell peppers with the rich tomato sauce and the spicy sausage. Perfect!

recipes.title: Brown Butter Blondies
recipes.description: Don't listen to anyone who says these aren't a type of brownie. Don't limit yourself because these are amazing.

recipes.title: The Most Gooiest Gooey Brownies Ever
recipes.description: It's a brownie sandwich extravaganza and you're all invited! Why settle for a regular brownie when you can pour an entire tin of condensed milk in the middle? There'll be goo all over the place...

recipes.title: Fish And Pesto Lasagne
recipes.description: A very different request today from wheezy waiter... he's asked for us to recreate a dish that has previously hospitalised him. If you're not allergic to nuts, then this summery twist on a classic lasagne is quicker than the original and still damn tasty!

recipes.title: Salted Caramel Pretzel Brownies
recipes.description: Ladies and gentlemen, we have a winner. My life has been leading up to making these salted caramel pretzel brownies and now i feel complete. They are SO gooey and oozey and delicious. Bake them now.

recipes.title: Soy Glazed Salmon With Stir Fried Greens
recipes.description:
A quick and easy dish, perfect for a midweek dinner :). 

Vegetables can be changed to your preference
ingredients: ½ tbsp brown or palm sugar
ingredients-original: ½ tbsp brown or palm sugar

recipes.title: Chocolate Cherry Pots
recipes.description: As SortedFood celebrates it's 3rd birthday on YouTube we're stepping back to recreate one of our first ever recipes that has yet to make it onto our channel. This is a real treat... impressive, indulgent and super simple. You'll be making it in no time!

recipes.title: Baba Ganoush
recipes.description: Baba ganoush is easy to make, tough to get perfect! It's all about the smoky flavour and after testing this loads of people told us to use smoked paprika and smoked salt if we didn't have a BBQ or open flame to use.

recipes.title: White Bean And Rosemary Soup
recipes.description: Ben has genuinely been asking for this recipe for years and it really delivers. It packs a punch of flavour with a little hit of spice and it's silky smooth. All the good stuff.

recipes.title: Tomato Water
recipes.description: Maybe this sounds weird, but it's probably the most surprisingly delicious thing you'll try this week. The roasted tomatoes are a MUST! They bring it all together and it's heaven.

recipes.title: Pea And Mint Soup
recipes.description: Oh hello old classic. Pea and mint is well known and well loved (or not in a lot of cases). You love it or hate it, but let us tell you that no matter what, it's better with crispy bacon, creme fraiche and olive oil to finish it off.
ingredients: 100 g pancetta cubes, fried until crisp
ingredients-original: 100 g pancetta cubes, fried until crisp

recipes.title: Singapore Chilli Crab
recipes.description: Oh wow we hope we got this right. It's a pretty delicious (and very messy) dish. Comment below and tell us how you cook yours.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Quesadilla
recipes.description: Another recipe from our 1st cookbook that we're recreating to celebrate our 3rd year on YouTube. This one is so easy... that Barry and Jamie take the reigns!!!

recipes.title: Louisianastyle Pork Stew
recipes.description: So autumnal, comforting and rich and I really love that this stew has so many textures – the creamy sweet potatoes, the dried sausages with a bite, meaty pork to fill me up, the sweet and soft cherry tomatoes and the pop of sweet corn. All a pleasure and every bite offer something new. The best part is that you could make a huge batch out of this and the longer (with some limitations off course, haha) it sits in the fridge, the better it gets!

recipes.title: Danish Pastries
recipes.description: OK, if you're about to embark on this recipe be ready for the long haul. Danish pastries are not too scary, but they do take a bit of time and patience to make 100% from scratch. Still here? You're awesome. Go make these because it's worth it! You'll love the strawberry jam.
ingredients: 450 g strong white flour, plus extra for dusting
ingredients-original: 450 g strong white flour, plus extra for dusting

recipes.title: Mackerel And Grilled Watermelon
recipes.description: Ever cooked a watermelon? No? You're in for a total treat, especially if you grab some fresh mackerel (make sure it's good quality) then you're about to experience a taste sensation. Enjoy :)

recipes.title: Chorizo Bell Pepper Rice
recipes.description: A comfort dish, quick and tasty and depending on how much heat you use, it can be mild or spicy.

recipes.title: Spicy Kale Pesto Linguine
recipes.description:
The pesto was the most laborious task for this dish but all in all it is ridiculously simple to make and so damn tasty. Tastes even better the next day.

I used up the whole pesto I made with this to about 250-300g pasta which should give you about 4-6 servings so use half and save the rest. 

Waffle over!!!

recipes.title: Beer Can Chicken The Ultimate Barbie
recipes.description:
This method of cooking a chicken is incredible... whether you do it on a coal barbecue or in a hot oven like we did, the beer helps to keep the meat amazingly succulent. Served with a simple salad that can be thrown together in minutes. Just try to avoid smirking as you slip the carcass over the can!

If you like this then we know you'll love the BBQ Chapter of our new e-cookbook. And best of all, it's free to download!

recipes.title: Savoury Muffins The Picnic Hamper
recipes.description:
Picnics are the perfect excuse for hanging out with friends and family and enjoying good food... not just soggy sandwiches and crisps!

These muffins might look sweet but don't be fooled... with pear, feta and thyme they are spot on for the savoury section of your alfresco dining!

If you like these, then you'll love the whole variety of picnic ideas (sweet and savoury) in the Picnic Hamper chapter of our e-cookbook.

recipes.title: Quinoa Risotto  My Way
recipes.description: Yeah. I got a bit inspired and needed to make my own quinoa risotto. Here featuring chanterelles, pomegranate seeds and loads of parmesan. Easy enough for a weeknight. Fancy enough for a date-night.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Chicken
recipes.description: What's this? A recipe on a Tuesday? Well. The good news is I'm aiming to make StudentChow my full time project now! More recipes each week, more blogs on Tumblr, and some other cool stuff coming soon (make sure you follow the blog on Facebook, Tumblr, and Twitter for more info). For now though, I was thinking about this one back when I was making the Steak sandwich. If Stir-Fry is a royal staple of a Student Diet, then Teriyaki has to be the best stir fry sauce. It can be made out of cheap store cupboard ingredients and goes with anything as a sweet, salty, sour (and relatively clean) choice.

recipes.title: Canaps Smart Casual Canaps
recipes.description:
Hosting a canapé party sounds VERY formal. But in reality it's just getting together with a few friends or family and offering a few bites of food to help the occasion along. Prep them way ahead and finish last minute so that you can concentrate on being a top host.

If you enjoy the sound of these canapés then you'll love the 10+ other brand new ideas in our smart-casual canapés chapter.
ingredients: 1 a log of crumbly goat's cheese
ingredients-original: 1 a log of crumbly goat's cheese

recipes.title: Figs And Goatcheese
recipes.description: Fresh figs are such a treat. Combined with creamy goatcheese wrapped in coconut and served with some fresh toast, it is a great snack.

recipes.title: Raspberry Tartlets Food To Show Off
recipes.description: Cooking for somebody or a group of friends can be daunting... but wouldn't it be cool if you could churn out a few really impressive looking dishes and only you know how easy they are to cook. Well these little tartlets do exactly that!If you're looking

recipes.title: Twist My Melon Man Its Delicious
recipes.description: I came up with that name all by myself. It'll make sense after you drink this.

recipes.title: Jalapeo Heaven Or Something Like That
recipes.description: Everyone loves tequila. We all know that. But tequila and fresh chillies are even better.

recipes.title: Burnt Rosemary And Other Flavours
recipes.description: Tip: Char the rosemary but don't burn it! I need more practice at this whole cooking thing.

recipes.title: Raspberry And Chocolate Meringue Popsicles
recipes.description:
The world is divided on whether or not these meringue popsicles should even be a thing but we went ahead and tested this recipe anyway so that you can decide. 

Worst case scenario, just make the chocolate pudding and eat it.

recipes.title: Black Forest Brownie
recipes.description: So, I was supposed to study for my statistics-class but then some procrastibaking happened and I ended up with this. Super rich and fudge-like brownie, tangy cheesecake ripple and luxurious cherries. YUM!

recipes.title: Sticky Chicken
recipes.description: Getting in at the end of the day and having to cook... should never be difficult. This certainly isn't. It's made up with simple store cupboard ingredients and created in no time at all.For stacks more fuss-free dinner ideas, including a few sweet ideas

recipes.title: Goan Fish Curry Curry Nights In
recipes.description: This curry is quick, simple and you'll be really impressed by how great it tastes. A homemade curry paste, cooked with aubergine and coconut milk and served with grilled blackened mackerel... a Goan inspired treat with our twist! If you're fed up of the

recipes.title: Ricotta Gnocchi With Melted Tomatoes
recipes.description: my homemade ricotta made wonderful little pillows. With a mix of tomatoes from my plants and some capers it tastes wonderful.

recipes.title: Salt Baked Fish
recipes.description: Salt baking seems like a bit of a project... sooo much salt to buy, you've got to make the salt crust then build it up around whatever you're cooking. BUT trust us, it's so worth it. Our fish was so full of flavour that we just couldn't stop eating it.

recipes.title: Nasi Lemak
recipes.description: We're taking a risk with this one, because it doesn't get much more traditional than this dish from Malaysia. We hope we got it right!
ingredients: 1 pandan leaf, tied in a knot
ingredients-original: 1 pandan leaf, tied in a knot

recipes.title: French Toast With Goats Cheese And Caramelised Red Onion
recipes.description: At first this seems weird, but the more you think about it the more sense it makes! Why not dip your 'lost' bread into a yummy herb cheesy custard instead of a sweet one? Trust us, you need to try this.

recipes.title: Vanilla Macarons
recipes.description: We're not finished with these yet! We tried macarons again (we've done a few recipes before) and they were good but still not quite perfect. We kept it super simple but ice cream was also suggested as a cheeky filling. What do you think?

recipes.title: Chocolate Tacos
recipes.description: You know those dishes that you really don't think will work until you try them? This is one of those. Chocolate tacos are really quite delicious... especially the salsa that goes with them. You should at least make that!
ingredients: 100 g brownie, cut into small cubes
ingredients-original: 100 g brownie, cut into small cubes

recipes.title: Salad W Roasted Plums  Savory Granola
recipes.description: This salad is pretty darn tasty food. And it just happens to be good for you also. The plums is perfectly in season here right now, they are so sweet and juicy. Roast them to get even more sweetness out of them, combine them with crunchy salad, soft mozzarella and a salty, spicy savory granola. Oh gosh.

recipes.title: Neverbeendonebefore Hasselback Potato
recipes.description: I came up with a brand new idea. Slice potatoes before baking them and stuff with butter. Totally original and unbelievably delicious.

recipes.title: Dainty Little Twice Baked Potatoes
recipes.description: These are just SO cute I wanna hug them instead of eat them. Awwwwwwww!

recipes.title: The Sweetest Sweet Potatoes
recipes.description:
I've made a dessert from baked potatoes. If you don't like that idea then just like this recipe to tell me. 

If you love the idea of sweet sweet potatoes then give this recipe a like.

recipes.title: Hybrid Sourdough Bread
recipes.description: Sourdough is amazing, but it takes a really, really long time! With the added yeast in this recipe it's really quick and your sourdough starter doesn't have to be too active for it to work but still give a great flavour

recipes.title: Homemade Vanilla Extract
recipes.description: You won't believe how easy this is until you try it yourself. The best thing about homemade vanilla extract is you can keep topping it up, so you'll have vanilla extract foreverrrr! (Oh and you can boast about it to your foodie friends.)

recipes.title: Matsaman Curry Udon Noodles
recipes.description: with lots of Peanutbutter and some veg- aka vegetarian

recipes.title: Smoky Bacon Scotch Eggs
recipes.description: The smokiest smoky scotch eggs in the world. Bacon makes everything better. Whether you're looking for a warming snack in winter or a summer picnic showstopper, this is the recipe for you.

recipes.title: Blt Tortilla Wedge
recipes.description: Well this is a bit different... it's a sandwich in an omelette! An all new improved tortilla. We've stuck everything you love about a BLT into something that you can take anywhere. Almost anywhere...

recipes.title: Ploughmans Scones
recipes.description: Forget the Ploughman's sandwich! These are the most perfect picnic treats in the world and a great way to enjoy scones. Top tip: dip them in something delicious like sour cream. Yum.

recipes.title: Japanese Cotton Cheese Cake
recipes.description:
Here is the recipe for a delishes Japanese Cotton Cheese Cake! 

The fluffiest cheese cake I ever tasted! Yummy!

recipes.title: Turmeric Roasted Cauliflower W Dates An
recipes.description: This cauliflower bake ticks all my boxes. The turmeric and ginger are spicy and feels like autumn to me, the roasted almonds for a church and those sweet and chewy dates just makes it feel so luxurious.

recipes.title: Pulled Pork With Pineapple Salsa
recipes.description: If you need to know anything about cooking meat or BBQs then DJ BBQ is your man! Which is why we invited him to spotlight one of his infamous recipes in the Sorted kitchen. Stand back... this episode is not for the faint-hearted!

recipes.title: Schnitzel
recipes.description: How on Earth have we never done this recipe before? Schnitzel is an absolute favourite and we've been told that it definitely cannot possibly ever have a sauce with it. Just pork schnitzel, lemon and potatoes. Bam.

recipes.title: Lime Risotto
recipes.description: Served with king prawns, scallops, char and rainbow trout. A light and tasty Sunday meal.

recipes.title: Doughnut Kebabs
recipes.description: To celebrate the launch of our Fast Food chapter we combine two of the best... hot fresh sugary doughnuts and the concept of a kebab. The challenge though... with the twist of our 4 flavoured sugars can you eat them without licking your lips?

recipes.title: Yogurt Lime Sorbet
recipes.description: Served on shortcrust pastry with apples, pine nuts and thyme. For the pastry recipe check my blog.

recipes.title: Rainbow Fruit Crostini
recipes.description: Fruity crostini are little bits of bread with fruit on top of them. There's minimal cooking involved in the recipe so have fun and enjoy these easy little treats!

recipes.title: Cheaters Pretzel Bites W Chocolate Dipp
recipes.description: The best cheat you will ever do! The pillowy pretzels salty topping complements the sweet dipping sauce so nicely but i could see them go perfectly on the side of a big bowl of autumn soup or filled with cream cheese and tomato for some finger food.

recipes.title: Fondant Fancies
recipes.description: I'm sure we can all identify with these little cakes... the challenge though, is can you make them look as dainty as the shop bought ones. Well perhaps you can if you work together and team up. Team cooking makes this possible!

recipes.title: Quark Strudel
recipes.description: Here is an easy recipe that pimps your breakfast or tea time. You will love the smell went it comes out of the oven, it's so delishes.

recipes.title: Chicken And Chorizo Puff Pie
recipes.description: If you and the family are fed up of the same dinner ideas repeating themselves then maybe you need some new inspiration... how about this simple pie that tastes great. It has familiarity (it's a pie!), yet is brand new to the taste buds!
ingredients: 1 sheet of ready rolled puff pastry
ingredients-original: 1 sheet of ready rolled puff pastry

recipes.title: Magic Custard Cake
recipes.description: Up until your suggestions on Google+, Instagram, Facebook and YouTube we hadn't even heard about this... but wow are we glad you let us know! This is such an easy batter to make, but what's really impressive is that it separates in the oven to form 3 separate layers for our cake! It turns out almost like a creme brulée topped with a really light soufflé sponge...amazing. It's perfect served with a little fresh passionfruit... another suggestion of yours!

recipes.title: Pasta Alla Norma
recipes.description:
Pasta alla Norma is so simple but so full of flavour. Chefs Paige & Gregorio from Dinner In The Field cooked it up for our Big Night In using an abundance of fresh ingredients straight from the market. It's a showstopper main course and the kind of food you want to serve to a loved one to show how much you care.

www.dinnerinthefield.com/

recipes.title: Strawberry Goat Cheese Salad
recipes.description:
Need a fresh 'n' fruity idea for a starter or small lunch? This strawberry and creamy goat's cheese salad ticks all the boxes. The candied walnuts are the cherry on top of a fabulous dish. So easy, yet so effective. Thanks to Paige and Gregorio from Dinner In The Field for opening our eyes to these flavour combinations.

www.dinnerinthefield.com/

recipes.title: Perfect Tiramisu
recipes.description:
Italian Chef Gregorio from Dinner In The Field shared his recipe for an authentic and frankly 100% perfect tiramisu. You won't encounter one that's better! Light, airy and beautifully rich with the cocoa and espresso infusion. If you're cooking Italian food you simply cannot go on until this recipe is there to finish your meal.

www.dinnerinthefield.com/

recipes.title: Sweet Dumpling With Raz El Hanout
recipes.description: And filled with tiny tomatoes. A combination that is unexpected but very tasty.

recipes.title: Pork And Prawn Dim Sum
recipes.description: Dim Sum is notoriously difficult to make, so what better recipe to give our Sorted twist than this. We asked you guys for help on Google+, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube with this one and there were loads of suggestions! We make things easy by using wonton wrappers, then add a bit of texture with peanuts and water chestnuts...all your ideas!

recipes.title: Autumn Chicken And Pasta Soup
recipes.description: I´m so pleased to finally being able to eat soups again without sweating to death. This soup, with chicken, veggies and pasta is one of those that gets you heated up right into your bones, it’s like woolen socks for your inside. The chicken is tender, the tomato base is sweet and the pasta keeps you full all day – perfect to cure autumn chilliness.

recipes.title: Squash Eggs Benedict
recipes.description: Eggs benedict... eggs royale... eggs florentine... Classic brunch recipes that begin with poached eggs and a thick hollandaise sauce. At SORTEDfood we're all about innovation and on our recent trip to Lyme Regis we experimented and made this incredible recipe with squash. Yes squash! Sub out the muffins and voila... a spectacular autumn brunch recipe at your fingertips.

recipes.title: Spicy Corndogs
recipes.description: We're hoping that with your help, we've created the best corndog recipe ever! Your initial recipe requests and suggestions along the way resulted in this... We've stuck sweetcorn and jalapeños into the batter to make it fresh and spicy. We also used kosher beef hot dogs as suggested by you guys. Let us know what you think!

recipes.title: Courgette Cupcakes
recipes.description: Vegetable cakes are all the rage these days so we knew we had to make these gorgeous courgette based cupcakes when we ended up with loads of veg from the allotment. Did we mention they're topped with a cream cheese frosting. Yeaaah. The whole recipe is quick and easy from start to finish. Happy baking!

recipes.title: Bolognese Pasties
recipes.description: Need ideas for leftover bolognaise sauce? Well this pasty recipe is the bee’s knees and the exact food you need if you’re coming home from a big night out. Idea. Take some pastry, wrap up your spaghetti and meat sauce into parcels, bake and cover with parmesan. Ideal for cheap skates- students, we’re looking at you.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Potato Curry
recipes.description: a vegetarian dish, I used a steamer for the veggies and just one pan. Check out the other method on my blog.

recipes.title: Baklava
recipes.description:
We've been asked to do this recipe so many times, but we had no idea what the most authentic recipe might be...we didn't even know how to pronounce it! We got you guys to help and had some great input and advice. Hopefully this is the best version you've seen!

Or is it? You tell us!

recipes.title: Deep Pan Pizza
recipes.description: You asked and we made it! Here's our Chicago style Deep Pan Pizza recipe. It's the best. While the dough takes a bit of time, this might just be the quickest pizza you've ever made! We don't even use an oven to get this awesome vegetarian version cooked. It's straight up in a frying pan.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Muffins
recipes.description: Moist muffin interiors with a delightfully crispy muffin top. Gluten free made without butter or refined sugars. Let's get PUMPKINYYY!
ingredients: 2 1/2 cup Gluten Free All Purpose Flour (or your favourite blend!)
1/2 - 3/4 cup almond milk (to bring batter to mixable consistency)
ingredients-original: 2 1/2 cup Gluten Free All Purpose Flour (or your favourite blend!)
1/2 - 3/4 cup almond milk (to bring batter to mixable consistency)

recipes.title: Porterhouse Steak With Bone Marrow And Truffle Mac N Cheese
recipes.description: The title is basically a description because it's so long soooo you know what this is and since you're here I'm guessing you want it.

recipes.title: Swordfish Steak And Charred Toms
recipes.description: Swordfish is a steak too you know. Equal opportunities! I promise it's almost as good as the beef the other two made.

recipes.title: Cappuccino Pavlova
recipes.description: Pavlovas can get a bit boring if you've made a few! Plain meringue with cream and fruit just doesn't cut it any more! We asked for your suggestions and together found the perfect chocolate and coffee pavlova that tastes great and is totally different!

recipes.title: Red Wine Rump Steak With Garlic Gratin
recipes.description: I'm a steak man so it would just be embarrassing if I didn't win a steak battle wouldn't it? I took the biggest piece I could find and served it with amazing garlic potatoes.

recipes.title: Bacon And Cheddar Gourmet Popcorn
recipes.description:
If you're looking for a home cinema snack that's delicious and indulgent then you've hit the nail with cheesy bacon popcorn. There's a real interesting combination of things that go into this bad boy bowl: Pancetta, cheddar cheese, apricots, chives, paprika and honey. 

Mix it up, pop on Netflix and get cosy with all your pals.

recipes.title: Cheesy Eggs In Bread
recipes.description: A little while ago we changed lives with our egg in bread recipe. This cheesy development takes it one step further! Hollow out a roll and fill it with a creamy sauce, topped off with a baked egg. Weekend mornings will never be the same.

recipes.title: Doughnut Bread Pudding
recipes.description: Bread and butter pudding with the ultimate twist- doughnuts!  This is a great dessert idea if you're cooking for a big group that's nice and cheap to pull together. We recommend jam or custard doughnuts for maximum happiness.

recipes.title: Easy Naan Pizza
recipes.description:
Looking for an quick pizza recipe? This indian inspired naan version is full of flavour and uber quick to pull together. A good way to load up on vegetables and goodness. 

Each naan serves one. If you're a total baller you can probably manage more. Mix and match your toppings and let us know the best combinations.

recipes.title: Salted Caramel Affogato
recipes.description:
This Italian dessert is banging and we've added so many twists. The ice cream mixture is infused with mascarpone and salted caramel making it, honestly, unbelievable. A cheeky optional idea we love is to mix your espresso shot with amaretto. 

Indulgent, silky and smooth. Make it, we dare you.
ingredients: 1 tbsp roughly ground, good quality coffee beans
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp roughly ground, good quality coffee beans

recipes.title: Microwave Nut Brittle
recipes.description: Nut brittle? A recipe you can make in a microwave? YES! In this version we've used an array of cashews, peanuts and almonds but you can mix it up how you like. We developed this recipe with students in mind because it's so easy peasy but we know that everyone will love it.

recipes.title: Texmex Brunch Eggs
recipes.description: Cooking the eggs in the mushrooms gives them a kind of earthy flavor that I really enjoyed and the tomato-avocado topping together with the coriander adds a freshness it certainly needs. Some nacho-chips for crunchiness and tabasco for heat. Perfect for a lazy Saturday-brunch!

recipes.title: Scampi Cocktail
recipes.description: Vote for this. Cheers

recipes.title: Spam And Pineapple Sticks
recipes.description: If you've ever had spam before, you're probably already turned off... BUT COME BACK!! We're making our own spiced ham and it's blooming delicious, served with charred pineapple and a Hawaiian mayo! Go on, give it a go/like!!

recipes.title: Butterscotch Mousse With Brandy Snaps
recipes.description: So deece it's unreal!!!

recipes.title: Sticky Spare Ribs And Noodles
recipes.description:
These gorgeous sticky spare ribs are slow cooked in an easy, chinese inspired black bean sauce. The pineapple juice and spices come through as you take a bite of tender, succulent pork.

We've served ours over a bed of noodles because frankly, there's so much delicious sauce left over you're going to want to make the most out of it!
ingredients: 1 rack of ribs, cut into individual ribs
ingredients-original: 1 rack of ribs, cut into individual ribs

recipes.title: One Tray Roast Beef
recipes.description:
If you have the world's smallest oven, don't panic! You can still cook a roast dinner with lots of trimmings! This recipe shows you all the tricks and some great timings to pop it all in one tray- it even includes a giant yorkshire pudding.

Serve 3-4 hungry people with this amazing roast beef one Sunday this winter.

recipes.title: Patty Melt
recipes.description:
Why do burgers always have to be in a bun? Good question. We present the burger sandwich. Genius. Invite this into your life next time you're craving a burger but only have the funds and the time to cook a grilled cheese!

This recipe provides the tastiest patty you ever did eat. And we're firm believers that burger sauce should not be missed out of any burger recipe. You've got it all in one! Hooray!

recipes.title: Tarte Tatin
recipes.description:
Tarte tatin. Sweet nectar of the Gods. A complete french classic. This version gives a crispy, puff pastry base covered with the most beautiful, caramelised apples & all topped off with the lovely contrast of creme fraiche.

We'll help you reach perfection with your apples- a lovely crunch and not too mushy! If you're an avid baker, give it a go and let us know how you got on.
ingredients: 25 g unsalted butter, cold and cubed
ingredients-original: 25 g unsalted butter, cold and cubed

recipes.title: Apple And Chilli Jam
recipes.description:
When you're left with leftover apples left, right and centre we recommend cooking up a batch of this glorious apple, chilli jam. You'll be shocked at how easy this recipe is, considering how incredible it tastes. 

Store in the fridge or give jars away as a food gift. Friends and family will be chuffed to tuck in alongside a nice cheese board. It's the best.
ingredients: 4 jam jars with screw on lids
ingredients-original: 4 jam jars with screw on lids

recipes.title: Pork And Apple Stew
recipes.description:
One pork based winter warming coming right up! Pork and apple stew is simple, cheap to throw together and a hearty dish to feed the family. By using Pink Lady apples (or similar ones with a good crunch) you'll ensure your apples stay firm and delicious instead of reducing to a mush. Serve with roast potatoes!

Frankly, we all need more stew recipes in our life.

recipes.title: Cheese And Champagne Soup
recipes.description:
We love a challenge and this cheese soup proves it! Lovers of fondue will celebrate over this fancy, indulgent recipe. It's a winner to serve at a dinner party or a rather posh lunch. 

Ingredients include brie, champagne and apple juice. Give it a try, you'll honestly love it.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Spice Pavlova
recipes.description: This amazing pavlova recipe was inspired by the infamous pumpkin spiced latte that hits the high street every Halloween. Four crisp meringues are topped with a cosy, warm pumpkin puree, lashings of fresh cream, pistachios, dried cranberries and chocolate shavings. An October showstopper if there ever was one!
ingredients: 600 g peeled and chopped pumpkin or butternut squash
ingredients-original: 600 g peeled and chopped pumpkin or butternut squash

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs
recipes.description: Level up is where we take a simple dish and make it incredible! So this recipe will show you how to make the best scrambled eggs ever. Through some simple cooking tweaks and the magic ingredient, creme fraiche, you’ll be a breakfast master in no time.

recipes.title: Hotdogs
recipes.description: These Hot Dogs are the perfect movie night snack. The crispy fried onions and charred chili take it to another level. Incredibly easy and totally delicious!

recipes.title: Cherry Bakewell Slushie
recipes.description: This Slushie recipe has all the layers of your favourite Cherry Bakewell! With lemon, cherry and almond flavours, it's a tasty take on a classic cinema treat. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Tim Tams
recipes.description: All hail Tim Tams. These biscuits are a staple in Australia & New Zealand so we knew we had to make them. If you're not familiar with them, they're very similar to penguins! So if you like chocolate with a crunch, you should probably get baking.

recipes.title: Venison Sausage Pie
recipes.description:
Venison sausages are not only delicious but a great way to cook up a game pie this winter for a more economical price. The rich flavours in this recipe amount to something quite special. 

You can never have too many pie recipes up your sleeve, right?

recipes.title: Miso  Honey Quail With Sake Macerated Figs
recipes.description: Taking Classic French techniques of deboning a quail and stuffing it... but applying a few Japanese influences! Served with lotus crisps with seaweed salt, Japanese 7 spices scotch quail egg and an Asian pear slaw.

recipes.title: Cte De Boeuf With Smoked Bone Marrow Mash
recipes.description: This recipe really is the ultimate all out dish that you can still do at home. It's on the expensive side, but your family or mates are worth it. You're worth it. You're the best.

recipes.title: Danish Cardamom Ginger Waffles
recipes.description: with some lemon curd and pear elderflower compote. The spices making the start into the cold time of the year easier.

recipes.title: Apple Harvest Cake
recipes.description: The apples right now is just to die for, so crisp and full of flavor and just perfect for cooking and baking. And those in combination with a lemony soft sponge with just a hint of cardamom and a side serving of vanilla ice-cream. Heaven!

recipes.title: Chicken And Dumpling Stew
recipes.description:
We really want to show off about this one because it's our best winter warmer recipe yet. A mouth explosion of unbelievable flavours combined with the stodgy, cuddly, crispy topped dumplings that soak up all the juices. The cream and wine added to the stock mean it's indulgent and fancy enough to serve to guests. 

If you're a lover of chicken stew then print this recipe off and pin it to your head. Seriously.

recipes.title: Poison Apples
recipes.description: Trick or Treat?! MUHAHAHA! Half of these are filled with a delicious chilli chocolate ice cream and caramel sauce. The other is the same but with an eye popping amount of chilli. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 handful pistachio and dark chocolate crumb
ingredients-original: 1 handful pistachio and dark chocolate crumb

recipes.title: Spilled Guts Cheesecake
recipes.description: Guts on a Cheesecake actually works surprisingly well! But seriously they're not guts, they're strawberry laces you silly.

recipes.title: Zombie Cocktail
recipes.description: This drink is scary but delicious. And it takes no time to make. Do make the sugar syrup though. It's worth it.

recipes.title: Feta Schnitzel Vegetarian
recipes.description: A Mediterranian midweek meal served with Kritharaki or Risoni Pasta. More about it on the blog. Serves 2.

recipes.title: Simple Tomato Sauce
recipes.description:
Every good chef needs a tremendous tomato sauce recipe up their sleeve. This one will get you going! It's simple yes, but terribly effective. The flavours of the tomato are released like an explosion with the easiest tricks...

Level up your tomato sauce today!

recipes.title: Vegan Nutella
recipes.description:
Whether you're a vegan or not you should have this homemade nutella recipe in the bank. With a few simple ingredients this will make up one jar of everyone's favourite hazelnut spread.

Who said vegans had to miss out on all the fun?

recipes.title: Vegan Pesto
recipes.description:
"I could eat that if it wasn't for the pesky parmesan." Well, turn that frown upside down because now your vegan pesto dreams have been answered!

This recipe makes up 100g of vegan pesto with the same texture and flavour profiles as the real thing. You won't know the difference.

recipes.title: Peshwari Naan
recipes.description:
This naan was inspired by a recent trip to India. Though we don't yet have a tandoor oven in the studio we're in love with the soft, chewy, puffy texture that this recipe gives. 

Peshwari naan is the best filling for sure. We serve ours with a fiery chilli & coriander yogurt that packs a real punch but you can make some up as a side to mop up your favourite curry.

Makes 6 small naans.

recipes.title: Mikes Meaty Loaf
recipes.description: This is a deliciously meaty American classic. Make it.
ingredients: 50 g rolled oats, soaked in milk
ingredients-original: 50 g rolled oats, soaked in milk

recipes.title: Out N In Burger
recipes.description: This is the burger to end all burgers.

recipes.title: The Worlds Hottest Texan Chili
recipes.description: I may not actually be from Texas but I've just made the world's best ever chili. True story.
ingredients: 1 red onion, peeled and finely diced
3 whole dried chillies (hot, sweet and smokey)
ingredients-original: 1 red onion, peeled and finely diced
3 whole dried chillies (hot, sweet and smokey)

recipes.title: Chocolate Overnight Oats  Spicy Oranges
recipes.description: Creamy and chocolaty oats, spicy and sweet oranges and plump, orange-filled sultanas. The chili in here won’t kill anyone but just gives that little heat in the back of your throat. Also, this breakfast is super convenient since everything is made the night before and is ready to grab when you are halfway out of the door.

recipes.title: Baked Apple Belgian Waffles
recipes.description:
Warm waffles, hot baked apples with that lovely season  flavors, sweet maple walnut ice cream plus maple sirup and some crunchy almonds. 
Sounds like the best autumn and winter season dessert ever.
ingredients: 2 tbsp cookie crumbs oatmeal or others
3 Belgian styled waffles (homemade or store bought)
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp cookie crumbs oatmeal or others
3 Belgian styled waffles (homemade or store bought)

recipes.title: Japanese Chicken Rice
recipes.description: Served with pickled salad and green tea. Read more about the salad on the blog.

recipes.title: Squash And Apple Gnocchi
recipes.description: If you're looking for a lighter, but impressive dish then look no further. These little pillows of potato gnocchi with a simple one pan sauce will win. You can even share the rolling.

recipes.title: Cheesy Chard Gratin
recipes.description:
This chard gratin is the perfect comfort food for a cold winter day. It's rich but tastes zesty and light, meaning you can also go back for more! 

It's perfect eaten on it's own or as a side to a delicious roast.

recipes.title: Polenta Fries With Blue Cheese Dip
recipes.description: This recipe is a mega way of cooking up polenta. We infuse the polenta with parmesan, let it cool and bake them in chunky chip shaped rectangles. Dip them in this easy to make blue cheese dip and your mouth will do a happy little dance.

recipes.title: Espresso Shortbread
recipes.description: This is the recipe for you if you have a sweet tooth but are looking for something slightly more sophisticated than your average cookie. We give you rich espresso chocolate coating a light and crunchy shortbread biscuit. Dunk into a glass of cold milk and you'll be in heaven.

recipes.title: Baked Popcorn Chicken
recipes.description:
Popcorn chicken is the perfect thing to serve as a sofa snack for a casual night in or as a canape at something a little posher. This recipe is actually baked popcorn chicken, which is that little bit healthier without sacrificing any of the taste or the crunch. 

You and your mates are going to enjoy this one.

recipes.title: Beef Vindaloo
recipes.description: We took on the challenge of the famous vindaloo but don't be put off making it if you're not the biggest fan of spice- it doesn't always have to be a searingly painful experience. This recipe is aromatic, rich and fragrant. It's certainly a beef curry that fills a hole!

recipes.title: New York Baked Cheesecake
recipes.description: This original New York cheesecake recipe is here to change your perceptions of dessert one slice at a time. It's so epic it doesn't need any other flavouring and if we're allowed to boast, we reckon we've got the texture bang on. It's a centrepiece to be proud of at your next party.

recipes.title: Spiralized Hoisin Noodle Broth
recipes.description: Bored of the same old spiralizer recipes? Here's something new for you! This homely, comforting pork meatball broth is laced with spiralized daikon and carrots. It's packed full of vegetables and is very medicinal for beating any winter illnesses that might be knocking about.

recipes.title: Parmesan Zucchini Fries
recipes.description: Zucchini fries are our new favourite treat and as always we've taken the recipe to the next level by mixing in cheese & garlic flavouring to the batter. Cook until golden! We serve them with a pea and mint dip.

recipes.title: Turkey Crumble
recipes.description: Comfort food alert! This savoury crumble is the answer to all that leftover turkey kicking about from Thanksgiving or Christmas Day. We combine turkey breast, sweetcorn, onion, spinach, creme fraiche & mustard in a deep dish and scatter paprika crumble on top before baking to a beautiful crisp.

recipes.title: Turkey Pasta Salad
recipes.description: When you've got leftover turkey to play with, this ginormous pasta salad platter is an excellent solution which you could knock up to serve to guests. Layers of turkey, pasta, cheese, leaves and winter spices. Never will a salad go quite as quickly!
ingredients: 100 g grapes (red or green or mixed)
ingredients-original: 100 g grapes (red or green or mixed)

recipes.title: Tim Tam Cheesecake
recipes.description: A cheeky little idea for you! Take a Tim Tam (or your favourite choccy biccie) and sandwich it back together with this gorgeous cheesecake filling. It's a no-bake, easy peasy recipe.

recipes.title: Timtamingtons
recipes.description: Hold on to your knickers ladies and gents as we combine two of the greatest sweet treats to come out of Australia! We pop a Tim Tam in a Lamington. Ta dah! If you can't get your hands on a Tim Tam, don't panic because a penguin is incredibly similar.

recipes.title: Slutty Brownies
recipes.description: Try it, it's the best!

recipes.title: Turkey Banh Mi
recipes.description:
This Turkey Banh Mi is probably the best thing you can do with leftovers around Thanksgiving or Christmas. With a little effort you can transform your roasted turkey into the most delicious Vietnamese treat. 

If you're not cooking leftovers then use could use almost any meat for your banh mi!

recipes.title: Fish Pie With Lemon And Fennel Mash
recipes.description: This is a fish pie for special occasions because it's a little bit fancy! The tasty fish mix is layered with a luxurious fennel and lemon mash. To make it even better we then add a layer of cheese, flaked almonds and pine nuts. This is the one to make if you want guests to reach for an additional portion.

recipes.title: Pork Wellington
recipes.description: This mouth watering Wellington recipe is to die for and is vastly friendlier on pocket than the fillet of beef that's traditionally used. We wrap the pork in a pancake which soaks up all the juices, then wrap that in a nutty pancetta paté. This is all coated in a puff pastry before baking until golden.

recipes.title: Nut Roast
recipes.description: Our Nut Roast recipe is super satisfying as a side dish but is bold enough to take centre stage on your dinner table. Packed full of delicious nuts, mushrooms and fragrant herbs it's the perfect addition to your Christmas feast.

recipes.title: Pate On Toast
recipes.description: Who knew it was so easy to make a restauranty pate on toast at home?! Well we did... but now we're sharing it with you. The best bit is that you can personalise it with your own flavours. We reckon it's the perfect thing to cook for your mates.

recipes.title: Leftover Christmas Cake Toast
recipes.description: This is THE Christmas recipe of the year. No one ever knows quite what to do with leftover Christmas cake but finally there's a solution. Cut up a big slab, fry it and top it off with orange segments, cranberries, spiced cream, nuts and chocolate drops.

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon Crispbreads
recipes.description: These crispbreads are beautiful, dainty canapés. The salmon, beetroot, radish and greens combine to make the most gorgeous colours.

recipes.title: Marinated Cheese
recipes.description: Out of ideas for homemade holiday gifts? Marinated cheese is super easy to put together and makes a really lovely Christmas present for friends and family.

recipes.title: Risotto In A Microwave
recipes.description: OK, hear us out because this is genius! Gone are the days of aching arms from constantly stirring thick, heavy risotto for 40 minutes. We're letting the microwave do the hard work. It's also a great idea to try out cavolo nero. Scrumptious.

recipes.title: Microwave Fish Pie
recipes.description: This delicious microwave fish pie recipe is here to answer all your comfort food dreams. It's a classic take that ticks all the boxes. After some extensive testing we've decided we need to cook with microwaves more.

recipes.title: Tomato Ricotta Squares
recipes.description: A great snack to serve with an Aperativo.

recipes.title: Homemade Granola Gift
recipes.description: Make your own festive granola and either eat it all with your mouth or wrap it up in beautiful packaging to give as the perfect food gift. If stored correctly, it should last weeks!

recipes.title: Thyme And Clementine Champagne
recipes.description: It's always handy to have a festive champagne cocktail recipe to hand. This one makes the most out of three very simple yet complimenting flavours: Thyme, clementine and pomegranate. Check out our other two original champagne cocktail ideas!

recipes.title: Sloe French 75
recipes.description: This glorious champagne cocktail recipe mixes a classic winter drink with your favourite bubbles. It takes no time at all to whip up a lovely sugar syrup to blend with sloe gin, the juice of a lemon and some champagne. Don't forget to check out our other champers cocktails!

recipes.title: Maple Champagne Julep
recipes.description: This is one for all the Dads out there. 4 simple ingredients, fizz, whiskey, mint and maple syrup- they'll never say no to a glass of champagne if they know there's whiskey involved! Phwoar, what a tease. Take a look at our other champers cocktails for more celebratory ideas.

recipes.title: Christmas Spice Cake
recipes.description: Here's a recipe for your winter baking collection! It's a fantastically festive apple spice cake. Not only does it taste like Christmas, it looks and smells the part too. Fruit cakes don't need to be boring when you've got this recipe to hand.

recipes.title: Foolproof Double Baked Cheese Souffle
recipes.description: Cheese Souffle is an incredibly technical recipe and word on the street is, it's making a comeback! Don't be afraid to try it though, as we've made a simple version which works every time. It's rich, moreish and makes for the perfect starter. Enjoy.

recipes.title: Bacon Sandwich
recipes.description: This might be the best bacon sandwich on the whole planet. With a few little twists you can turn your bacon sandwich into something epic.
ingredients: 4 rashers thick cut smoked back bacon
ingredients-original: 4 rashers thick cut smoked back bacon

recipes.title: Irresistibles
recipes.description: Honestly they are irresistible ;)

recipes.title: Advent Cringles
recipes.description: Jam filled vanilla cookies with a lemon glaze and cranberry and pistachio crumble

recipes.title: Cheat Day Burger
recipes.description: This epic cheat day burger is dedicated to Joe Wicks, The Body Coach. It's got a double patty, lashings of bacon and barbecue sauce. You deserve it.

recipes.title: Homemade Nougat
recipes.description:
Homemade nougat takes a bit of effort but makes an awesome gift. They're worth it right? 

You can even personalise it to people's favourite flavours!

recipes.title: Vegan Pad Thai
recipes.description:
Pad Thai is a firm favourite with most people but this one is slightly different. We took on the challenge of making a vegan pad thai, swapping out a few key ingredients in the process.

We've got to say... it was totally delicious!

recipes.title: Cheese Fondue Spaghetti
recipes.description: FONGHETTI My kind of portmanteaus dish. I love a Swiss Cheese fondue and a good pasta dish. So here is the tasty combination of both.

recipes.title: Parmesan Palmiers
recipes.description: Palmiers are a delicate, savoury French pastry that make the ideal snack at any party table. Their distinct shape is easy to achieve if you carefully follow this awesome step-by-step recipe. Keep your eye on them in the oven though, they have a tendency to burn! You want to achieve the perfect golden brown colouring.

recipes.title: Old Fashioned Chocolate Fudge
recipes.description: Yes it's whiskey. I'm not even apologising because old fashioned chocolate fudge is the best thing to ever grace the internet.

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Yorkshire Pudding
recipes.description: I made a double chocolate Yorkshire pudding. It's like a Yorkshire pudding but it's got chocolate in it. Innit.

recipes.title: Pb And J Chocolate Tart
recipes.description: It's a PB and J chocolate tart sooooo... I win at life. Also, peanut sugar shards. You will not be able to eat just one slice of this.

recipes.title: Nougat Kipferl
recipes.description: Here is the recipe for Nougat Kipferl which I baked for Christmas.

recipes.title: Winter Breakfast Crumble
recipes.description: It feels a bit naughty to eat dessert for breakfast, but this one is packed full of everything you need to keep you going for the day. The crispy crumble is a mix of oats, coconut and warming spices that form small clusters of heaven that fills you up with loads of energy and the filling with sweet persimmons is super festive and so, so tasty!

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Pancakes
recipes.description: Sweet potato pancakes. Man oh man. We had a hell of a lot of fun developing this amazing breakfast of dreams! The recipe will give you the fluffiest, tastiest pancake stack on the planet, especially as it’s then doused in a cinnamon maple cream. Eat now, thank us later.

recipes.title: Baked Chocolate Mousse Cake
recipes.description: Get ready for the most indulgent chocolate dessert you've ever seen. The biscuit crumb and caramelised white chocolate topping take this chocolate mousse cake to another level.

recipes.title: Rice And Pasta Pilaw
recipes.description: Turkish style. A great vegetarian dish to serve at a brunch
ingredients: 1 tsp large jar of roasted red bell peppers
1 tsp small can of sweet corn
ingredients-original: 1 tsp large jar of roasted red bell peppers
1 tsp small can of sweet corn

recipes.title: Classic Yorkshire Puddings
recipes.description: Yorkshire puddings are very British but we truly believe that the whole world should get to experience the joy of eating them. They go perfectly with roast meat so cook up a big joint and introduce your friends to the most perfect Yorkshire puddings to ever grace your table

recipes.title: Classic Scones
recipes.description: Twists are fun but sometimes it's nice to stick to to the classics. These are the easiest, most delicious classic scones and the only twist it whether you choose cream or jam to go on it first!

recipes.title: Winter Slaw Salad
recipes.description: Salads aren't just limited to summer so this one will impress as the red cabbage flavour comes through. Make a batch and let everybody dig in! It's perfect to accompany roast meats. The smoked almonds are a really nice touch but aren't 100% essential if you can't get hold of them.

recipes.title: Black Garlic Veggie Pasta
recipes.description: This pasta is such an easy one, but it still packs on a lot of flavor thanks to the roasted peppers and black garlic.The brussel sprouts gets such a great flavor when charred and gives the dish some crunchy consistency. The peppers are sweet and flavorful and the black garlic makes it interesting. What else do you need really?

recipes.title: Parma Ham And Fig Charred Aubergine
recipes.description: These charred aubergines with parma ham and figs Are so delicious. They make an ideal light starter or even a lunch and can be eaten hot or cold so you can escape to the mediterranean any time you want!

recipes.title: Spicy Shiitake Sushi Rolls
recipes.description: You're not going to miss the meat or fish in these rolls for one minute! We've paired fresh cucumber strips and pickled ginger with spicy shiitake mushrooms in these vegetarian sushi rolls. They're packed with flavour!

recipes.title: Almond Roasted Cauliflower
recipes.description: Cauliflower is underrated and roasted cauliflower is SO underrated! Our rub of garlic, anchovy and ground almonds gives it loads of flavour and of course who can complain about finishing it all off with a cheesy sauce? Give this one a go, we promise you'll love it.

recipes.title: Homemade Pickles
recipes.description: Pickles are easy to make at home and an awesome way to use up scraps and leftovers. This recipe will help you on your way with cucumbers, red cabbage and cherries. Yes! Cherries! They're a thing, we promise.

recipes.title: Goat Tostadas
recipes.description: In this recipe we slow cook a boneless joint of goat with black beans and chilli. The mouth watering result is piled on top of tostadas and coated in charred sweetcorn, cabbage & yogurt. Sprinkle a bit of feta cheese on top and you have a rich, moreish dish which is perfect for sharing.
ingredients: 800 g boneless goat slow cooking joint
2 corn on the cob, blanched and charred
ingredients-original: 800 g boneless goat slow cooking joint
2 corn on the cob, blanched and charred

recipes.title: Hoppers
recipes.description: Hoppers are crepe shaped bowls and a very popular Sri Lankan street food. Traditionally these delicious bowls hold eggs so we stuck to the brief and generated this beautiful indian spiced breakfast. It was a first for us so the community helped us shape them in a big way! We hope you enjoy eating them as much as we did.

recipes.title: Osso Buco
recipes.description: Osso Buco is an excellent stew for the winter months. It's a Milanese dish of veal shanks braised with wine, vegetables and stock until the meat is falling off the bone. We serve ours on a bed of polenta with mashed mixture of fresh blanched tomatoes, parsley, lemon and garlic.

recipes.title: Ginger Nut Chocolate Pots
recipes.description: Chocolate pots are an easy way to impress. There's a secret ingredient in this recipe which improves it tenfold. Make them for a dinner party, a hot date or if you fancy something naughty and nice.

recipes.title: Coconut And Lemongrass Panna Cotta
recipes.description: Summer has arrived early in this classic Italian dessert! The exotic flavours and visually stunning presentation make this the panna cotta of the year. It's the perfect, light way to end a hearty meal as it cleanses your palette.

recipes.title: Pork Belly Bao Buns
recipes.description: Bao buns are all the rage at the moment and for a very good reason- they're to die for! Ours are stuffed to the brim with slow cooked pork belly that's glazed in a sticky, sweet sauce. The recipe makes 12 but remember! One is never enough! So make plenty if you're expecting guests...
ingredients: 1 kg pork belly, sliced into strips
ingredients-original: 1 kg pork belly, sliced into strips

recipes.title: Welsh Rarebit
recipes.description: We'd argue that rarebit is the most famous Welsh recipe of them all! If you like cheese on toast then this a recipe you'll fall completely in love with. First you need to make up your buttery, cheesy sauce that's spiked with mustard, beer and worcester sauce. Then you need to spread that over hunks of sourdough with some red onion chutney. Grill to perfection and eat it with your mouth.

recipes.title: Raspberry Ripple Marshmallow Ice Cream
recipes.description: This raspberry ripple ice cream recipe doesn't require an ice cream maker. It's a quick, simple and cheap pudding but  we obviously needed to give it a SORTEDfood twist! Cue the delicious little marshmallows laced through. Yummy.

recipes.title: Ultimate Marshmallow Hot Chocolate
recipes.description: This recipe goes far beyond your normal hot chocolate and you need to cook it up on weekend winter night in. You may be used to popping marshmallows on top of your drink but how about melting them into the mix beforehand too? Now that's an idea! Makes 4 hot chocs.

recipes.title: Sweet N Savoury Marshmallows
recipes.description: Here's a cheat's guide to making your own marshmallows. This recipe shows you how to melt them down so you can add your own flavour profiles to them- perfect for beginners. In this batch we've opted for rosewater & pistachio and peanut & sriracha. So good! Give them a go and add your own twists.

recipes.title: Breakfast Poutine
recipes.description: Average poutine wasn't enough until we combined it with breakfast. We've made the ultimate comfort food dish so listen up: Caramelised brandy onions, maple smoked bacon, cheese curds and homemade fries swim in the most glorious gravy and hollandaise sauce. If that's not enough for you, now's the time to mention there's poached eggs on top. You HAVE to try this recipe. It's divine.

recipes.title: Flumps
recipes.description: In the UK, we call them Flumps but you might be more familiar with the name 'marshmallow twists'. No matter what you think, if you have the right ingredients, time and patience then get down to business with the prettiest homemade sweets you ever did see. Family and friends will love 'em.

recipes.title: Level Up Mashed Potato
recipes.description: Who doesn't love mashed potatoes with just about everything? This is a stand alone recipe so that you can make it any time, any where, to go with any dish you want. You get to eat ALL the mashed potato.
ingredients: 1 kg russet potatoes (or any floury variety)
ingredients-original: 1 kg russet potatoes (or any floury variety)

recipes.title: Chocolate And Plum Gteau
recipes.description: This dessert should impress any guest, friend, work colleague or family member. This has a meringue base, a plum jelly and a chocolate mouse all smothered together in a gorgeous chocolate ganache glaze.

recipes.title: Lobster Bisque Fregola With Steamed Sole
recipes.description: A sunshine-worthy taste of the Mediterranean... Heavily seasoned with French! Worthy of a win in a Chef Battle... give it a like if you think so!

recipes.title: Coffee Hummus With Spiced Lamb
recipes.description: This doesn't sound as good as it is. Trust me, it's really great. Coffee hummus is the next big thing and you saw it here first.
ingredients: 60 ml extra virgin olive oil (+ extra for brushing)
1 big drizzle extra virgin olive oil
ingredients-original: 60 ml extra virgin olive oil (+ extra for brushing)
1 big drizzle extra virgin olive oil

recipes.title: Soft Pretzel Bites
recipes.description: Enjoy these super good soft pretzel bites sweet or savory. Here is the recipe for these delicious snacks

recipes.title: Pizza Ring
recipes.description: A whole ring of great fillings, good for a small group of people and easy to prepare.
ingredients: 2 cup Kraft/Pillsbury dinner crescent roll dough
1/2 cup can sweet corn, peas and peppers
ingredients-original: 2 cup Kraft/Pillsbury dinner crescent roll dough
1/2 cup can sweet corn, peas and peppers

recipes.title: Loaded Baked Sweet Potato
recipes.description: Inspired by my favorite burger this baked potato has everything - airy cream cheese, crispy bacon, hot jalapeno and the sweet potato. Yum!

recipes.title: Bavette Steak With Ants
recipes.description: Insect eating is set to be a big thing of the future and believe it or not, choosing the right ones and cooking them in the right way can be delicious! This bavette steak coupled with with ants and is something you can make at home. The ants add a really interesting & earthy, citrus flavour.
