Surprise your friends and family when it's next your turn to cook.

recipes.title: Tofu Scramble
recipes.description: If you were blindfolded, you probably wouldn't be able to tell the difference between this tofu and scrambled eggs! We've added some great curry flavours in this recipe to take tofu to the next level. And the best thing? It's all served on classic avo on raisin toast. A breakfast of kings.

recipes.title: Tofu Cheesecake
recipes.description: This gorgeous looking masterpiece is a no-bake vegan cheesecake made from tofu. The three layers are simple! Blueberry... coconut & white chocolate... all on a bed of crushed hobnobs. It was an interesting experiment of ours which resulted in an epic recipe. Of course you don't have to but a smart touch is to serve them in glasses, like we have.

recipes.title: Tofu Noodle Curry
recipes.description: Don't be put off by the large list of ingredients here- they're all necessary to create the flavour profile and silky, rich sauce that makes this curry so immense. What a way to eat tofu! We'd recommend this for a healthy midweek meal. It serves 4.
ingredients: 1 tbsp soft brown sugar (or palm sugar)
2 tbsp chopped and toasted macadamia nuts
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp soft brown sugar (or palm sugar)
2 tbsp chopped and toasted macadamia nuts

recipes.title: Lemon And Yuzu Bars
recipes.description: We include yuzu juice in these lovely lemon bars for extra zing. Let the exotic citrus flavours and ginger, poppy seed shortbread carry you away somewhere else as you snack. Fun to bake, even better to eat. They're the best.

recipes.title: Chocolate Mocha Smoothie W Sneaky Greens
recipes.description: To me, smoothie is kind of the perfect breakfast and this one has everything you need - chocolate, coffee and some sneaky greens. Because, to be honest, we want dessert for breakfast with ALL the taste and none of the unhealthy stuff!

recipes.title: Loaded Sweet Potatoes
recipes.description: This is an awesome, balanced, nutritional meal that you can treat yourself to after a hefty workout. It's fuss free and has heaps of incredible ingredients- sweet potato, chorizo, mushrooms, spinach and egg. Get it in your tum.

recipes.title: Level Up Guacamole
recipes.description: This is a ridiculously easy but very fancy method of making guacamole. The recipe will give you the freshest tasting dip out there. Serves 2.

recipes.title: Avocado Baked Eggs
recipes.description: We hollow out an avocado and use the remaining flesh, pancetta, jalapenos and eggs to create a beautiful baked surprise. What will you fill yours with?

recipes.title: Double Chocolate Marble Cake
recipes.description: Looking for a Birthday cake recipe? You're in the right place. This double chocolate marble cake looks phenomenal inside and out. Checkerboard buttercream AND a mirror glaze. We do spoil you.

recipes.title: Pancake Lollipops
recipes.description: A great recipe to try with little ones for a fun snack on Pancake Day. They're so cute looking and really fun to make. Don't forget to get really creative with what you dip them into. Chopped nuts... hundreds and thousands... chocolate sauce....

recipes.title: Pancake Muffins
recipes.description: Pancake batter is so light and fluffy so we thought they'd bake into the perfect actual pan-cakes! We've taken inspiration from the flavours found in blueberry muffins with added excitement of white chocolate chips. You can personalise them to your tastes easily. Choose your favourite muffin flavours and get cooking.

recipes.title: Pepperoni Pancake Pizzas
recipes.description: If you're not a fan of sweet pancakes there's no reason why you can't turn 'em savoury! This pizza pancake recipe brings together pancake batter, pepperoni, cheese and sundried tomatoes. Pancake fun for everyone and a great brunch idea.

recipes.title: Sweet Churros Pizza
recipes.description: Churros is a sweet doughnut like dessert that has captured the hearts of so many. You usually dip it into molten hot chocolate but what if it formed the base of a sweet pizza?! That's what we've done here. Yes. We went there. We've topped our churros pizza with nutella, hazelnuts, white chocolate and raspberries. YUM.

recipes.title: Popping Coke Coco Pop Cake Pop Popsicles
recipes.description: I just didn't know what to cook for a cereal battle but what I did know was that my favourite cereal is coco pops. I've made the most meta cereal dish ever.

recipes.title: Granola Fried Chicken
recipes.description: Ok so this one is a little bit different but I think it absolutely rocks your socks off. It's granola like you've never seen it before, featuring fried chicken, whiskey soaked bleubs and a hot sauce gravy.

recipes.title: Anti Gravity Cereal Panna Cotta
recipes.description: Anti Gravity Cakes are so passé. 2017 is the year of the Anti Gravity Cereal Panna Cotta. It's my greatest invention to date.
ingredients: 2 ea plastic straws (with a bend at the top)
1 ea small variety pack honey nut cornflakes box
ingredients-original: 2 ea plastic straws (with a bend at the top)
1 ea small variety pack honey nut cornflakes box

recipes.title: Jalebi
recipes.description: If you've ever wondered if you can deep fry pure sugar in butter then meet our new best friend, Jalebi. It's an amazing Indian sweet treat that you will definitely only need one of.

recipes.title: Tropical Layered Chia Pudding
recipes.description: According to Swedish morning-tv we are in the middle of winter right now, aka we have to suffer through about 80 cm of snow. So, I felt I needed a tropical twist to my usual morning dish. This layered beauty contains; creamy and sweet coconut chia pudding, tangy kiwi-pineapple-orange smoothie and a load of roasted coconut-flakes. Just looking at it makes it feel a bit warmer here!

recipes.title: Sticky Slowcooker Bbq Meatballs
recipes.description: To be frank, the title covers this recipe in one! It's an absolute killer. All you need is ten minutes to prep the ingredients and 2 hours for it all to bubble away in the cooker. We advise serving with garlic bread, polenta or your favourite slaw.

recipes.title: Level Up Garlic Bread
recipes.description: How many of you naughty spuds out there buy your garlic bread? NO MORE. When you see HOW easy it is to make and HOW much better it tastes you won't anymore. Bookmark this recipe.

recipes.title: Pizza Pot Pie
recipes.description: Pizza pot pie. Let us repeat: Pizza pot pie. Oozing melted cheese, spicy meats and an irresistible tomato sauce are loaded into a crunchy, moreish bowl of pizza dough. A must make for any large gathering. Bring in the beers.
ingredients: 500 g ‘00’ flour or strong bread flour, plus extra for dusting
50 g black olives, pitted and halved
1 large ball mozzarella cheese for pizza (it should be dryer)
ingredients-original: 500 g ‘00’ flour or strong bread flour, plus extra for dusting
50 g black olives, pitted and halved
1 large ball mozzarella cheese for pizza (it should be dryer)

recipes.title: Cheesy Yorkshire Puddings
recipes.description: Take your yorkshire puddings in a different direction by stuffing them with cheese. These beauties have parmesan laced through the batter,  hold a cube of melted brie & quince and are then scattered with cheddar. Naughty but oh so nice. Indulge!

recipes.title: Berry Brownie Brioche Loaf
recipes.description: This is our take on a sweet 'trencher'. By slicing the top off a freshly baked brioche loaf, hollowing it out and filling it with layers of ganache, amaretto soaked shortbread, brownie, berries and cream cheese you'll end up with a complete masterpiece. Ideal for a picnic or afternoon tea.

recipes.title: Cider And Date Lamb Shank
recipes.description: Upskill yourself with this delicious gourmet recipe. If you've ever had lamb shank before you'll know the slow cooked meat is totally irresistible as it falls off the bone. We serve it with pureed parsnip and foaming, golden butter with apples, dates and sage. Perfection!

recipes.title: Chorizo And Feta Hasselback Squash
recipes.description: We've been experimenting recently with the Hasselback technique. Nothing looks quite so visually stunning as what we've mastered with a butternut squash. Make veg the centrepiece of your table with this epic recipe! The flavours from the oils of the chorizo lead to something quite special.

recipes.title: Chicken Pot Au Feu
recipes.description: 'Pot au feu' literally translates as 'pot on the fire' and is a classic French family winter warmer. This version is based around chicken and will help you practice your poaching skills. It's a long slow cook but very easy to make as you chuck in a variety of vegetables roughly chopped at different points. A lovely twist is to serve it with pistou (very similar to pesto and you can use this too). Everyone can add a little to their own bowls- it completely lifts the dish. Serves 8.

recipes.title: Rhubarb And Ginger Muffins
recipes.description: These delightful seasonal muffins are made all the more delicious thanks to the elderflower syrup that you generously spooned over after baking. They're lovely to look at and even better to eat. Treat friends and family to one over a cup of tea.

recipes.title: Cream Of Mushroom Soup
recipes.description: This recipe is a total classic and the best out there! It can be difficult to make a mushroom soup look aesthetically pleasing so we've created some chunky ciabatta croutons and drizzled in marscapone to lift it into the light.

recipes.title: Ham Hock And Pasta Scrap Broth
recipes.description: The Italian name for this kind of pasta dish is 'Maltagliati' which literally means 'badly cut'.  We've made our version in a ham hock broth packed with flavour. It's a wicked recipe to practice your skills homemade pasta making skills because the end result doesn't have to be perfect. In fact, it looks and tastes better the more 'scrappy' the pasta shapes are! Ideal! Grate heaps of parmesan over and dig in.

recipes.title: Potato And Leek Pie
recipes.description: This recipe is all about practising your homemade pastry tekkers so get your baking beans and pie cases at the ready! This recipe makes two of the most comforting, carby, stand alone winter potato and leek pies.

recipes.title: Pulled Pork Pancakes
recipes.description: Learn how to make the best homemade BBQ pulled pork then load it up in between stacks of spicy paprika pancakes and top with honey, sour cream and pork scratchings. This is a real treat to make for Pancake Day or a particularly special breakfast or brunch.

recipes.title: Double Hot Wings
recipes.description: I don't even care what Ben says... These are for me and the people. I'm giving the people what they want. They want hot, hot wings.
ingredients: 1 tbsp Franks hot sauce (or hotter if you dare)
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp Franks hot sauce (or hotter if you dare)

recipes.title: Saffron Chicken Fries
recipes.description: These are the freshest, most delicately flavoured fried chicken strips you'll ever taste. The saffron is amazing. Best of all it's Ebbers approved.

recipes.title: The Big Daddy Burger
recipes.description: This is my hopes and dreams on a plate. I want to be this burger. You will never ever have a better fried chicken burger. It has it all.
ingredients: 1 ea corn on the cob, boiled
ingredients-original: 1 ea corn on the cob, boiled

recipes.title: Fried Chicken Three Ways
recipes.description: Next time you make fried chicken mix up the flavours a bit by using one of these ideas, inspired by three different parts of the world: Japan, India and Malaysia!
ingredients: 1 recipe *Plus your choice of flavourings… see below
100 g roasted peanuts, blitzed to a crumb
ingredients-original: 1 recipe *Plus your choice of flavourings… see below
100 g roasted peanuts, blitzed to a crumb

recipes.title: Bounty Samosas
recipes.description: We show you a cheat's guide to making sweet samosas by using filo pastry. This recipe could be replicated with any of your favourite candy bars. We love the flavours of bounty paired with a big dollop of mango ice cream. Serve piping hot right out of the oven.

recipes.title: Pain Aux Reeses
recipes.description: Pan au Chocolat gets a revamp. With 5 simple ingredients you can make the most insane peanut butter pastry treat. It's  a quick, foolproof recipe that you won't be able to resist making again and again.

recipes.title: Rainbow Chocolate Creams
recipes.description: These rainbow chocolates are wicked. They look impressive and taste delicious! You can make them in an array of colours and flavours- it really is up to you. We opted for coffee, gingerbread, chai, orange and lemon.

recipes.title: Roast Beef Dinner
recipes.description: This roast beef dinner is one that goes the extra mile with charred veggies, gravy and a giant tear and share yorkshire pudding. The recipe will help you roast your meat so the inside is lovely and rare with the end pieces being slightly more well done- great for keeping the whole family happy! We also teach a nifty little trick for perfect crispy roasties using polenta.

recipes.title: Chicken Katsu Curry
recipes.description: fried chicken with thick veggie sauce and distict Japanese flavour
ingredients: 1 tsp dried onion and garlic powder
2 tbsp pieces Japanese golden curry roux
ingredients-original: 1 tsp dried onion and garlic powder
2 tbsp pieces Japanese golden curry roux

recipes.title: Orange Chicken
recipes.description: Now this is a real saturday night takeaway favourite. Chunks of tangy, crispy fried chicken in a spicy & sweet sticky orange sauce. Don't forget to plate up with steaming rice and sesame seeds scattered over the top. This recipe serves four people and is damn delicious.

recipes.title: Orange Soda
recipes.description: Who loves orange soda? We love orange soda! First things first in this recipe is to make the syrup. Orange, cinnamon, ginger and carrots (they add the colour but don't compromise the flavour) are reduced down to a sticky mess. Top a little of this up with some lemonade, passionfruit and heaps of ice. Voila! A cooling, refreshing, sharp summer drink.

recipes.title: Homemade Orange Marmalade
recipes.description: Homemade marmalade is such a nice treat to spread all over a golden piece of toast. Here's a foolproof recipe so you can start making batches of your own! Our secret? A tiny bit of whiskey to the mix. It adds a little kick that Grandads out there will love.

recipes.title: Croque Madame
recipes.description: The croque madame was originally created as a quick snack by the French. Slices of ham, cheese and bread complete with béchamel sauce and a fried egg on top. Of course we had to take the SORTEDfood recipe a step up by making it a monster three tiered sandwich.

recipes.title: Seafood Paella
recipes.description: This recipe is our version of an authentic spanish seafood paella and we've tried to keep true a classic recipe as much as possible by leaving out the chorizo and loading up on seafood. Remember not to disturb the rice at the bottom of the pan too much. This is what brings out that perfect crisp. We should cook with shellfish more often. It brings out so much flavour in food!

recipes.title: Meringue Buttercream
recipes.description:
This is the best buttercream recipe you'll ever try because meringue buttercream is the most silky smooth icing out there in the world. It's quick, easy and really takes your cakes to the next level.

We've gotta hand it to our mate Ed Kimber for showing us this recipe. It changed our lives.
ingredients: 450 g unsalted butter, diced and softened
ingredients-original: 450 g unsalted butter, diced and softened

recipes.title: White Chocolate And Raspberry Blondies
recipes.description: The Swedish blondies has been known to steal the hearts of many, and so will this one. Perfectly dense but still gooey, sweet with an amazing pop of raspberry. YUM!

recipes.title: Full English Breakfast Yorkshire Puddings
recipes.description: We're here to tell you that munching yorkshire puddings for breakfast is completely OK. In fact, with this recipe, it's more than OK... it's damn delicious! If you go down this road you'll end up with a delicious toad in the hole loaded up with sausages, homemade beans and fresh guacamole. There's enough for 4 people so put on a spread.

recipes.title: Spring Green Shakshuka
recipes.description: This is an awesome variation of your typical shakshuka recipe. A pile of delicious grilled greens are scattered on the top of the spicy tomato baked egg dish to create a brunch showstopper fit for a King. Don't forget to chuck in some seeded crispbreads to mop up the lovely juices!

recipes.title: Bloody Mary
recipes.description: Sometimes you're in desperate need of a hair of the dog! This cocktail came out trumps as the number 1 hangover cure for breakfast! Our recipe is infused overnight and comes with a stick of delicious snacks to have with it like maple bacon and pickles to go with the tomato flavours of the cocktail.

recipes.title: Duck Congee
recipes.description: Congee is an everyday breakfast dish that's phenomenally popular in Asia. The best way we can describe it is like a savoury rice porridge. It's comforting and often eaten when ill. Our version is a Chinese style congee recipe with an added twist! We add some crispy duck.  Delicious.

recipes.title: Biscuits And Gravy
recipes.description: Mike and Barry first tried this in Austin on our Lost And Hungry trip to the USA and have always wanted to bring it to the UK. It's a popular breakfast in the South. Biscuits are very similar to scones and the sauce poured over is a meaty sausage gravy. Really unusual for breakfast! First time we tried it the community let us know that the biscuits we made were too dense. So we amended the recipe to make sure we nailed it.
ingredients: 90 g unsalted butter, cold and cubed
6 cumberland sausages or spicy breakfast sausage
ingredients-original: 90 g unsalted butter, cold and cubed
6 cumberland sausages or spicy breakfast sausage

recipes.title: Cheats Dosas
recipes.description: Dosas are a savoury breakfast pancake crammed with delicious fillings; usually potato, vegetables and cheese. As a popular street food originating from Southern India, the construction of them can be something of an art! So to help y'all out we've made a cheat's recipe. Whip up a quick pancake using chickpea flour and fill it with the gorgeous mixture yourself.
ingredients: 2 green chillies (or one if they're very hot)
ingredients-original: 2 green chillies (or one if they're very hot)

recipes.title: Kit Kat Lasagna
recipes.description: This recipe is not for the faint hearted. A grand total of 42 Kit Kats are used to make a chocolate lasagne like no other. Layered with white chocolate ganache, marscapone, cherries and liquer it makes the most easy yet indulgent dessert probably ever. Great food to cook for friends. It's one of SORTEDfood's greatest recipes!

recipes.title: Level Up Crumble
recipes.description: Once you've got a basic crumble recipe you really can go anywhere with it. This is our level up of a basic crumble, using brown sugar, ground almonds and porridge oats.

recipes.title: Simple Bao Bun Recipe
recipes.description: This recipe is here to help you achieve the pillowy, fluffy, dreamlike Bao buns which are quite possibly the best things in the world. Once you've mastered the technique you can fill your Bao buns with whatever you like! We recommend a classic pork belly or Korean fried chicken. You can find both of those recipes on SORTEDfood too.

recipes.title: Tomato Risotto
recipes.description: This restaurant style vegetarian risotto is amazing! The flavours are incredibly intense thanks to the method of making it. Get started on it the day before you want to cook it as the beautiful tomato consommé needs to develop overnight.

recipes.title: Strawberry And Lemon Meringue Pops
recipes.description: These meringue pops make fabulous little homemade gifts. Light, crispy pink & white flavoured meringues with a gooey middle. We've gone for strawberry and lemon flavours. They're so much fun to make and even better to eat. Treat someone lovely- they deserve it!
ingredients: 2 drops red food gel (or any colour you prefer)
2 drops lemon flavouring (or any flavouring you prefer)
ingredients-original: 2 drops red food gel (or any colour you prefer)
2 drops lemon flavouring (or any flavouring you prefer)

recipes.title: Mushroom  Goats Cheese Breakfast Quesadillas
recipes.description: Quesadillas? For breakfast? Yup. This quick recipe is crammed with mushroom, spinach, goats cheese and cheddar. Stack 'em up high and serve with a fried egg on top. Foolproof!

recipes.title: Salted Caramel And Chocolate Pastry Squares
recipes.description: We all love a Pop Tart. A terribly naughty breakfast treat or an indulgent snack. They come in all shapes and flavours but have you ever thought about baking them at home? We fancied a salted caramel version because we really believe the shelves are lacking in them. Here's our recipe made with love and care just for your mouth.

recipes.title: Guinness Braised Short Ribs In Soda Bread
recipes.description: Beef beef beef. This dish of short ribs braised in Guinness is me on a plate and if you don't like it then that's a sad thing. Vote for me!

recipes.title: Irish Coffee Cake
recipes.description: It's Irish, it's got coffee, whisky and it's a cake. I've ticked every box. This is all I got and if you don't vote for me then we can't be friends.
ingredients: 500 g unsalted butter, diced and softened
ingredients-original: 500 g unsalted butter, diced and softened

recipes.title: Rainbow Guinness Brownie Blondies
recipes.description: Guinness, Baileys, Rainbows and Gold. This is as Irish as it get right? Plus they look great and most importantly the taste will blow you away. You've gotta try this at home!

recipes.title: Cranberry White Chocolate Cookies
recipes.description: Thank you so much for following me. I never thought to reach 20000 ! I made some American cookies to celebrate.

recipes.title: Seafood Pasta
recipes.description: 3 kinds of seafood with veggies and linguine pasta. Super tasty.

recipes.title: Honeycomb And Baklava Ice Cream Cones
recipes.description: Sweetened chopped nuts and flakes of crisp filo pastry are piled into an easy no churn ice cream. This is all ladled into simple to make homemade cones and drizzled with an orange blossom syrup. Refreshing and cooling on a hot day!

recipes.title: Honey  Harissa Aubergine Halloumi Freekeh Stack
recipes.description: Fried aubergine and halloumi flavoured with delicious harissa are piled high on top of a stack of freekeh. Freekeh is our new fave ingredient. It's got a nutty texture that's simply perfect to accompany midweek meals. The finished dish is drizzled with honey for a mouth watering result.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Honey Roasted Ham With Papaya Salad
recipes.description: If gammon's on your menu then this recipe will add a welcome change to the classic honey roasted ham. The meat is boiled in an aromatic broth and rubbed with a spiced paste inspired by the flavours of Vietnam. Once roasted, it pairs perfectly with a fresh, fragrant papaya salad.
ingredients: 100 g fine rice noodles, cooked and cooled
ingredients-original: 100 g fine rice noodles, cooked and cooled

recipes.title: Level Up Grilled Cheese
recipes.description: Everyone in life just needs to be better. That's why we're helping you achieve the perfect grilled cheese with a couple of nifty tricks. One of them being by using honey!
ingredients: 50 g grated pizza mozzarella (the dry stuff)
ingredients-original: 50 g grated pizza mozzarella (the dry stuff)

recipes.title: Cheesy Enchiladas
recipes.description: Chicken and vegetable enchiladas with a bubbling cheesy topping. This recipe is extra generous with the filling- you'll find it hard to not to scoff your face! A great mid-week meal OR part of a Mexican feast. Pair it with one of our great nachos recipes if you've got mates coming round.

recipes.title: Salmon And Shiitake Onigiri
recipes.description: Onigiri is a flavoured Japanese rice ball that's then shaped into triangles and served with nori. We took on the challenge and flavoured ours with soy & salmon and chilli & shiitake mushrooms. They're worth making because they're simple and taste so delicious.

recipes.title: Cheats Chicken Biryani
recipes.description: This biryani recipe was designed to be easy to make and cheap to put together. That's what we like to hear! We took the tips and tricks of our fabulous community to put this together so it's inspired by many a different country around the world- fusion.

recipes.title: One Pot Pesto Pasta
recipes.description: There's a whole host of things that make this recipe truly excellent. It's only around 15 minutes from start to finish to create the creamiest pesto pasta dish that's jam packed with veggies and flavour. So get stuck in if you're looking for a quick midweek meal with minimal washing up.
ingredients: 150 g cooked chicken breast, torn up
ingredients-original: 150 g cooked chicken breast, torn up

recipes.title: Shrimp Poboy
recipes.description:
Ladies & gentlemen here we have the SORTEDfood creole shrimp po'boy recipe. It's simply the best. We char prawns in a crispy cornmeal seasoning, create a southern ranch inspired dressing and cram it all into a toasted roll with crunchy slaw and avocado. It's probably the greatest sandwich you'll have all year. 
Makes 2 sandwiches.

recipes.title: Herby Pistachio Porchetta Sandwich
recipes.description: This sandwich was inspired by a traditional Italian lunch that James feasted on in Florence. It's loaded to the brim with succulent pork that in turn is stuffed with fennel chilli and lemon. The shoulder of pork used will give you plenty of sandwiches so save this recipe for the next time you get the family over for a casual lunch.

recipes.title: The Best Banana Sandwich Ever
recipes.description: Banana sandwiches take us zooming back to childhood. This recipe is something a little more special than what you were expecting because it involves a homemade blueberry compote AND caramel walnuts. So bookmark it next time you're looking for an indulgent nostalgic treat. It really is the best banana sandwich in the entire world.

recipes.title: Olive Stuffed Lamb Breast With Tomato And Date Hummus
recipes.description: Have you ever considered cooking with lamb breast? Well you should because it's cheap as chips and you can do some mega things with it. Take this recipe: the breast is crammed with a delicious tapenade style stuffing. We serve it on a bed of date and tomato hummus. Each mouthful is a mouth explosion of the highest degree.

recipes.title: Simnel Cake
recipes.description: It's pretty cool that this very traditional Easter cake dates back to Medieval times. All these years later, no one actually knows what 'simnel' means! In essence it's a rich fruit cake decorated beautifully. The 12 little balls represent Jesus and his apostles (minus Judas).
ingredients: 350 g mixed dried fruit (currants, sultanas and whatever else you like!)
1 handful mixed dried fruit or peel
ingredients-original: 350 g mixed dried fruit (currants, sultanas and whatever else you like!)
1 handful mixed dried fruit or peel

recipes.title: Ham Goats Cheese  Pea Linguine Frittata
recipes.description: The perfect summer dish that's so creamy, versatile and packed full of fresh herbs and delicious ingredients. Have it hot for lunch or dinner? Cool it down and serve at a BBQ or take it on a picnic! It's a simple recipe so get stuck in.

recipes.title: Nut And Berry Yogurt Snack Pots
recipes.description: These lovely little DIY yogurt pots are really excellent for breakfast or a during-the-day snack. By making a berry compote and roasting a load of nuts with maple syrup you can mix it all into some delicious greek yogurt and make it really special. Don't forget to store it in some see through jars so you can see the lovely marbling of berry & yogurt.

recipes.title: Ginger Pecan Popcorn Bars
recipes.description: One of our favourite recipes of all time has to be the marshmallow popcorn bar we made back in the day. We've decided to revisit it with a few more funky flavours. Cue mango, pecan and ginger. They're absolutely wonderful!
ingredients: 50 g dried mango pieces, roughly chopped
ingredients-original: 50 g dried mango pieces, roughly chopped

recipes.title: Upside Down Cupcake Assortment
recipes.description: Confused? Well don't be! We recently held an afternoon tea with a cupcake theme. This recipe creates 24 cupcakes with 4 separate flavours. Maple bacon, nutella & peanut butter core, vanilla & basil and lemon drizzle. Give your mates a surprise and host your own tea party!
ingredients: 450 g unsalted butter, diced and softened
4 rashers streaky bacon, cooked until crisp
ingredients-original: 450 g unsalted butter, diced and softened
4 rashers streaky bacon, cooked until crisp

recipes.title: Roasted Figs With Feta Ice Cream
recipes.description: Ok ok... this is not a very 'Jamie' dish, but I can do dainty stuff too you know. And don't knock cheese in ice cream until you've tried it.

recipes.title: Barrys Exploding Cheesy Balls
recipes.description: The title says it all. Ham and potato croquettes with gooey mozzarella in the middle!

recipes.title: Rainbow Mac N Cheese
recipes.description: my rainbow mac n cheese is not a real rainbow with real rainbow colours. Get over it, internet. Love from Mike.

recipes.title: Fully Loaded English Breakfast
recipes.description: This is a step up from our other classic English Breakfast recipe (check it out)! What sets it apart? Maybe it's the creamy creme fraiche scrambled eggs, the homemade baked beans, the rich mushroom purée or the mustard mayo? Sounds like a winning combination when you add it with the classic bacon, sausage and black pudding. THAT is how Brits do breakfast.

recipes.title: Perfect Hollandaise Sauce
recipes.description: If you're a fan of hollandaise sauce over your eggs benedict you're going to want to see this recipe. It's light, mellow and packed with flavour because of the insane vinegar reduction it begins with. Take your breakfast a level up!

recipes.title: Hainanese Chicken Rice
recipes.description: Here's how to make Hainanese chicken rice, a Chinese recipe that's famously popular in Singapore and Malaysia. There's literally no translation for the word that explains how silky and smooth the chicken tastes. It's an easy recipe but does require slow cooking for maximum flavour so set aside time.
ingredients: 2 tbsp sunflower oil (or chicken fat, if you have some)
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp sunflower oil (or chicken fat, if you have some)

recipes.title: Spiced Momos With Tomato Chutney
recipes.description: Momos are a Nepali steamed dumpling popular in other South Asian countries like Tibet and India. Recently they've become a bit of a street food trend and it's no wonder why! Their spicy, fragrant flavours make them incredibly moreish. This recipe give you easy DIY step by steps to cook them at home. We use turkey mince but any ground mince you fancy can be used. Hope you like 'em.

recipes.title: Spiced Goats Cheese Omelette
recipes.description: Omelettes are one of the speediest meals that you could possibly knock up. But how do you take them to another level? This recipe focuses on a mix of spices and uses a beautiful goats cheese and yogurt finish to cut through the flavour. You're going to love it.

recipes.title: Level Up Instant Ramen
recipes.description: Who knew you could completely transform a packet of standard ramen noodles? This hack of adding a few extra ingredients from your store cupboard can upgrade a bowl and make it a worthy, practically gourmet lunch. No microwave needed! Just a kettle.

recipes.title: Egg Mayo Sandwich
recipes.description: How to make a perfect egg mayo sandwich? Add some spice because it really brings out the flavour of the filling! You too can give this classic a boost with just a few simple ingredients. It's timeless and simply delicious.

recipes.title: Awesome Tuna Mayo Sandwich
recipes.description: Tuna mayonnaise sandwich! A firm favourite of so many people. We pop celery, watercress and plenty of fresh lemon juice in our recipe to give lunch a cutting edge. Remember this filling can also be used in wraps, toasties and jacket potatoes too.

recipes.title: Ploughmans Sandwich
recipes.description: The Ploughman's lunch. A British institution. Here we've got a portable version! This sandwich holds cold cuts of ham, cheese, piccalilli and apple all complimented by mustard and mayo. Lip smacking. Don't forget to get your hands on some real good quality roast ham because it makes all the difference.
ingredients: 8 slices good quality honey roast ham (leftovers would be ideal!)
ingredients-original: 8 slices good quality honey roast ham (leftovers would be ideal!)

recipes.title: Sweet Cherry Chocolate Momos
recipes.description: We've recently fallen head over heels with momos. A street food inspired steamed dumpling usually filled with spiced meat. BUT we thought hey, why can't we make a sweet momo? And voila. These parcels of heaven are filled with cherry, dark chocolate and marzipan to give you a delectable treat like no other.

recipes.title: Steak And Chilli Cheese Fries
recipes.description: So meaty, so cheesy, so unbelievably good and you don't need a fryer! This bad boy recipe makes the most of potato skins that are crisped up in the oven and loaded with cheese, chilli and of course, juicy smokin' steak. It's a classic food truck recipe that you can recreate easily in the comfort of your own home.

recipes.title: Sticky Pressure Cooker Ribs On Noodles
recipes.description: Juicy, tender, sticky, fall off the bone ribs have just become accessible for a midweek meal thanks to the glorious pressure cooker. This recipe combines a delicious wet rub with a spicy dry rub to soak a rack of ribs and prepare it for a half hour cook under pressure. The results are insane and the leftover sauce is mega over a bowl of noodles. Haven't got a pressure cooker? We've got plenty of ribs recipes for you too, don't worry. Just search on sortedfood.com

recipes.title: Matcha And Black Sesame Baked Alaska
recipes.description: The baked alaska is a showstopper thanks to its scientific method of baking. Ice cream and sponge are wrapped in a seriously amazing meringue and then baked. But HOW does the ice cream not melt?! This recipe is flavoured with matcha and black sesame making it a truly unique dessert to completely blow the minds of your friends. Tuck in.

recipes.title: Tropical Chimichanga
recipes.description: It's a deep-fried sweet burrito full of delightful fruit and a delicious coconut rice pudding, topped off with game changing kiwi ice cream.

recipes.title: Spicy Charred Chicken Burrito
recipes.description: This is everything I love in a burrito. Super fresh, a little bit spicy and absolutely full of flavour!

recipes.title: Paella Burrito
recipes.description: I like to put my favourite foods where they shouldn't go. So I'm putting paella and chorizo into a burrito and let me tell you that it works. It's surprising and delicious. So there.

recipes.title: Triple Chocolate Coconut Cookies
recipes.description: makes 24 cookies and people love them.

recipes.title: Sicilian Pistaccio Pasta
recipes.description: The roux for the sauce is not made with flour but with ground pistaccios. They grow lots of these nuts on the island.

recipes.title: Strawberries Elderflower And Cream
recipes.description: When it comes down to a short time limit, it's all about being clever with colour, texture and flavour rather than making fancy things from scratch. This dish is all about appreciating strawberries and the classic flavours that go with them!

recipes.title: Sticky Cajun Chicken With Corn 3 Ways
recipes.description: I wanted to use all the tricks picked up from our fast food week to cook up a delicious sticky chicken and corn cooked 3 ways in under 15 minutes. It really delivers!

recipes.title: Deconstructed Key Lime Pie
recipes.description: So, its the middle of May and its still snowing here so this weekend I craved summer on a plate rather than outside. Lime, coconut and strawberries, so tasty, but so easy I promise! Serves 4 people with a sweet-tooth, maybe 6 if not ;)

recipes.title: Roti John
recipes.description: I liked the sound of this recipe because it's named after a guy called John, which sounds kind of like Jamie if you think about it. Anyway it's also a delicious spicy beef and egg sandwich, which is right up my street!

recipes.title: Satay Chicken
recipes.description: I know what you're thinking... a satay recipe uses thin slices of chicken breast. I KNOW! But please be assured that satay chicken thighs are extremely delicious with peanut sauce.

recipes.title: Grilled Chicken And Prawns Laksa
recipes.description: I love a laksa. Start with a delicious base and you can add whatever you like to make it your own recipe! What do you add to yours?
ingredients: 50 g toasted macadamia nuts or candlenuts
200 g rice noodles, cooked and cooled
2 tbsp toasted and chopped macadamia nuts or candlenuts
ingredients-original: 50 g toasted macadamia nuts or candlenuts
200 g rice noodles, cooked and cooled
2 tbsp toasted and chopped macadamia nuts or candlenuts

recipes.title: Rehydration Lunchbox
recipes.description: I don't even know how to describe this recipe. It's something that came from deep in my mind and probably wasn't a good idea but I did it anyway. Standard.

recipes.title: Taco Lunchbox
recipes.description: Listen, I know people will judge me for this recipe. I've said it before and I'll say it again. These things taste great so I'm happy!! Also, carne apache is a game changer for me... one more excellent way to enjoy steak.

recipes.title: Lads Afternoon Tea Lunchbox
recipes.description: What if you could have all the elements of the perfect afternoon tea in a lunchbox? Scones, sausage rolls and a rather deece scotch egg. I cooked it. I wanted it all in me and I got what I wanted.
ingredients: 2 l vegetable oil or similar for deep frying
ingredients-original: 2 l vegetable oil or similar for deep frying

recipes.title: Cinnamon Sugar Nachos
recipes.description: Yes you heard it here first. It's a SWEET nachos recipe. Tortillas are fried and coated in a magnificent cinnamon sugar then topped with chilli chocolate sauce and cajeta, a Mexican inspired caramel style sauce. The whole lot is topped off with cocoa nibs, lime and sour cream to cut through the sweetness. We had such a positive reaction when we sold this at our food stall. You're going to love it!

recipes.title: Cuban Sandwich
recipes.description: Whether you've seen the movie 'Chef' or not, you're going to want this sandwich in your mouth. It's seriously worth the effort to brine and mojo marinate your pork in advance so you can then stack it with cheese, ham, gherkins and mustard in between a long white baguette. Grill it to perfection and you've got a serious masterpiece on your hands.

recipes.title: Homemade Butterbeer
recipes.description: Step into Hogsmeade with this brilliant butter beer recipe. It's alcoholic, it's delicious, it slides down your throat like a dream. Complete with a foamy head, it really is the ultimate wizarding experience that you can now concoct at home! Warning: Seriously indulgent.

recipes.title: Mole Fried Eggs And Tortilla Chips
recipes.description: Craving something savory yet sweet? We've got you SORTED! This recipe is a spin off of a traditional Mexican dish: Mole but with a sweet chocolate-y twist! A perfect snack for when you can't decide whether you crave something sweet or salty. Easy and quick to make, try our Mole Fried Eggs and Tortilla Chips!

recipes.title: Homemade Twix Bars
recipes.description: This homemade recipe of your favorite childhood chocolate bar is easy, delicious and will have you craving for more. With a crunchy chocolate exterior and a gooey caramel center, this is the perfect combination of ingredients for a cheeky afternoon snack. Warning: seriously addictive.
ingredients: 2 twix shaped silicon moulds (~10 bars per mould, optional)
ingredients-original: 2 twix shaped silicon moulds (~10 bars per mould, optional)

recipes.title: 15 Minute Chocolate Fondant
recipes.description: Craving a delicious, melt in your mouth chocolate dessert? We've got you SORTED! This chocolate fondant recipe is easy to make and only takes 15 minutes! With a soft chocolate cake exterior and a mouth watering melted centre, you will dream of this dessert for days after making it. But guess what? It's so easy and quick, you can make it again!

recipes.title: Triple Chocolate Mousse Cake
recipes.description: What's better than a chocolate mousse cake? A triple chocolate mousse cake! Try this delicious recipe for a dessert that's both pleasing to the eye as well as to your sweet tooth. It's perfect for a special occasion or a celebration. Whoever you make it for will love it.

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs
recipes.description: Never had a Scandinavian dish before? This Swedish Meatball recipe will have you curious for more... it's creamy, it's meaty, and it has a delicious sweet touch of lingonberry! A perfect dish to WOW your friends and family.

recipes.title: Macerated Berries With White Chocolate
recipes.description: Berries have never tasted so good! These macerated berries are the only case we know of where berries can taste smoky, zesty, spicy, and sweet all at the same time. Better yet, they're paired with delicious creamy white chocolate ganache! So delicious.

recipes.title: Mixed Berry And Rose Water Smoothie
recipes.description: Rushing to work? Needing to quench your thirst? Craving a quick, fruity snack? This berry smoothie is what you need. It only takes 30 seconds to make and is crammed with oats, bananas and heaps of fresh berries. The coconut water adds a refreshing twist. It'll keep you going for hours.

recipes.title: Duck And Berry Salad With Smoked Almonds
recipes.description: In need of a new salad that's absolutely delicious? Well we've got you SORTED! Our duck and berry salad has everything: crispy roasted duck, leafy greens, smokey nuts, and a sweet touch of berries. Perfect for a nutritious lunch or dinner at home.

recipes.title: White Chocolate Berry Brioche Cake
recipes.description: This is a monster dessert recipe is completely unique and ready to go for that extra special occasion. You hollow out a brioche loaf and stuff it to the brim with spectacular sweet ingredients like amaretto shortbread, chocolate ganache, berries, and cream cheese. Leave this to set together overnight and voila! A sweet trencher you can cut into slices, just like a cake.
ingredients: 25 g unsalted butter, chilled, cut into small cubes
ingredients-original: 25 g unsalted butter, chilled, cut into small cubes

recipes.title: Gooey Fudgey Chocolate Brownie
recipes.description: We were given a challenge and a half. How to take out all of the butter, eggs and gluten out of a chocolate brownie recipe but still create something that tastes incredible?! The answer was in sneaky ingredients- black beans and avocado! You'll get the gooiest, richest, chocolatiest brownies from this recipe.

recipes.title: Lean Chicken Katsu Curry
recipes.description: Chicken katsu curry is a real treat but we've made a recipe that's far more nutritious with a lower GI so you can enjoy it more often!! The traditional tasting sauce is made by grating up apple & parsnips and cooking them with curry powder, reducing the need for honey and other sweeteners. The wholemeal breadcrumbed chicken breast is baked, rather than fried and the finished dish is served with cauliflower rice.

recipes.title: Diy Gourmet Granitas
recipes.description: Using a juicer we create some vibrant and nutritious fruit & veg juices which are then combined with simple sugar syrups and frozen. By occasionally scratching your ice with a fork you can achieve a granita effect and enjoy a refreshing summer drink! Flavour number 1 is a delicious tropical mix of pineapple, grapefruit, apple and cucumber. Flavour number 2 is cooling & refreshing, made from lemongrass, ginger, oranges and carrots.

recipes.title: Ratatouille Risotto
recipes.description: A risotto is incredibly indulgent especially when it’s started with butter and finished with cream & of cheese. By blitzing up a purée of fresh and vibrant roasted vegetables and using that to stir through the base of a cooked risotto, this recipe not only looks amazing, but packs it full of flavour and freshness without the need for the naughtiness. A lighter and less dense dish that’s dairy free.
ingredients: 1 handful of mustard cress to serve
ingredients-original: 1 handful of mustard cress to serve

recipes.title: Herby Sweet Potato Pancakes
recipes.description: Pancakes are popular the world over but the problem is they're so often associated with unnecessarily high stacks of dripping in sweet syrup and laden with bacon. You can have savoury pancakes too! We'll show you. This recipe gives you super fresh, herby, sweet potato pancakes that are light and fluffy. Served with this corn relish you'll find them hard to resist.

recipes.title: Mango Lassi Pots
recipes.description: Fresh mango blitzed up, natural yogurt, a pinch of ground cardamom & turmeric plus a squeeze of honey are all layered up in a pot and topped with cayenne spiced homemade granola packed with nuts & coconut. All can be made ahead in little to no time and then it’s a grab and go in the morning. Enough to keep you satisfied until lunch!

recipes.title: Butterless Butter Chicken
recipes.description: An Indian Takeaway favourite in the UK is butter chicken. What if we told you this version is made (wait for it) without butter?! By using nuts as a base this recipe gives you a super creamy sauce which you can then pair with gorgeous marinated chicken breasts. Serve with a side of baked, not fried, onion bhajis for a classic dish that's a little bit better for your insides.

recipes.title: Gingerbread Groot Beer Float
recipes.description: Guardians of the Galaxy fans will love this baby groot beer float! This recipe will teach you how to make delicious gingerbread that packs a sweet punch. It's all super easy to make and a load of fun.

recipes.title: Miso And Sesame Glazed Cauliflower Steak
recipes.description: This dish is not just for veggies, it's for everyone! And what a great way to break up your classic meat-centric barbecue with a delicious miso and sesame glazed cauliflower steak. YUM!

recipes.title: Grilled Asparagus And Burrata Salad
recipes.description: In need of a side dish at your summer BBQ and sick of the expected coleslaw? Try our incredible asparagus burrata salad! Inspired by a recent trip of Barry's to the beach it's packed with delicious ciabatta and parma ham. This salad is definitely a crowd pleaser so whack it out if you need to impress your Nan.

recipes.title: Barbecue Jersey Royal Potato Salad
recipes.description: Looking for an upgraded potato salad? This is a team favorite from BBQ week and so simply and easy to make. You can barbecue or oven roast, both methods will result in an incredible dish. So what are you waiting for? Get stuck in?
ingredients: 1 kg jersey royal potatoes (or any new potato)
ingredients-original: 1 kg jersey royal potatoes (or any new potato)

recipes.title: Chimney Cake
recipes.description: A barbecued dessert!? Yes, that's right! Originally a popular Hungarian street snack, this chimney cake has a perfect crisp exterior and soft inside making the most delicious dessert. Even better, it's coated in cinnamon and sugar! Warning: seriously addictive.
ingredients: 200 ml whole milk, warmed to be tepid
1 wide metal tube (or fizzy drink cans wrapped tightly in foil)
ingredients-original: 200 ml whole milk, warmed to be tepid
1 wide metal tube (or fizzy drink cans wrapped tightly in foil)

recipes.title: Blooming Pizza Bread
recipes.description: If pizza is your guilty pleasure, you have to try our blooming pizza bread recipe. It's filled with all of your favorite pizza ingredients and topped with some essential honey and chili flakes. It's so delicious Barry said he'd leave his wife for it...

recipes.title: Level Up Vanilla Milkshake
recipes.description: We've taken the classic, delicious vanilla milkshake to the next level. This creamy, smooth milkshake uses pure vanilla pod seeds with vanilla ice cream to give a real vanilla taste throughout. Better yet, we've added cola and malt powder for an extra sensation!

recipes.title: Chicken Fried Steak
recipes.description: Fried chicken is unbelievable. We're all in agreement. Steak is unbelievable. We're all in agreement. How about combining the two and ending up with a fried and breaded steak cut? Well this will get you there! It's a magnificent Southern inspired recipe that you should definitely reserve for cheat day. We recommend serving with our spicy paprika sauce and a mound of mashed potato.

recipes.title: Ragu Lasagna
recipes.description: We've started cheat week off with a bang! Ragu Lasagna. It's packed with four different types of meat, two cheeses, and delicious bechamel sauce. YUM. This dish is perfect for a cheeky cheat day or if you just want an incredible lasagna.
ingredients: 4 good quality pork sausages, meat out of their skins
250 g chuck steak, cut into a small-medium For the ragudice
ingredients-original: 4 good quality pork sausages, meat out of their skins
250 g chuck steak, cut into a small-medium For the ragudice

recipes.title: Bbq Smoked Beef Brisket
recipes.description: How do you ensure a killer barbecue? Cook this smoked beef brisket! With a simple marinade of salt, pepper, and cayenne, this brisket is not only easy to make, but packed with flavor. Perfect for a sunny day with the family or winter BBQ in need of some heat! Check out the full video we made to learn more about smokers.
ingredients: 3-4 handfuls wood chips (any flavour you prefer)
ingredients-original: 3-4 handfuls wood chips (any flavour you prefer)

recipes.title: Homemade Baguette And Butter
recipes.description: It's just bread and butter recipe. It's inspired by that bit in Aladdin that no one remembers.

recipes.title: Spiced Rum Cake
recipes.description: This is my spiced rum cake recipe. Basically I made a mess and I'm sorry.

recipes.title: Mad Hatters Tea Party
recipes.description: It's not what you think. No really, I've mixed up all the flavours in my tea party recipes. There's even edible tea cups. I said edible. tea. cups.

recipes.title: Coco Pop Frappe
recipes.description: By using the milk leftover from a bowl of Coco Pops we’ve conjured up this amazing frappé! Inspired by flavours from a Mexican Horchata, like cinnamon & peanut, it’s the perfect sweet treat if you’re looking for something a little bit different.

recipes.title: Toffee Apple And Bran Flake Cake
recipes.description: Making a cake has never been so easy - this caramel apple and Bran Flakes cake can be made in under 3 minutes and will satisfy any late night snack craving. And the best thing? You’ve probably already got all the ingredients you need... What are you waiting for?!

recipes.title: Bbq Cornflake Waffles
recipes.description: How do you improve on the classic Chicken and Waffles? By adding Corn Flakes… No, seriously! Savoury waffles, flavoured and topped with Corn Flakes and served with chicken in a pimped BBQ sauce - the perfect half time snack during your favourite sports game!

recipes.title: Special K Frozen Chocolate Bites
recipes.description: We developed these chocolate crispy snacks with a movie night in mind. We give you crunchy Special K bound together by dark chocolate, yogurt, lime, coconut & blueberries. So easy, so delicious. They’re screaming your name.

recipes.title: Chocolate Rice Krispies Marshmallows
recipes.description: This cheeky little dish takes Rice Krispies to a whole different dimension, using orange and lemon zest, chocolate, marshmallow spread and (obviously) mint to create a perfectly simple evening snack.
ingredients: 25 g dark chocolate, chilled and grated
ingredients-original: 25 g dark chocolate, chilled and grated

recipes.title: Chicken Parmigiana
recipes.description: This chicken parm recipe is here to blow your mind. To take that classic recipe up a notch, we soak our chicken breasts in buttermilk before coating & frying in an onion flavoured breadcrumb. We finish of the dish by placing the chicken into a tray of homemade basil & tomato sauce with a grating of mozzarella and parmesan, before sticking it into the oven. The end result? Cheesy, indulgent heaven. Recommended with a bowl of fresh buttery pasta.

recipes.title: Banoffee Cheesecake
recipes.description: Banoffee + cheesecake. What could go wrong? If that sounds like heaven then this no-bake dessert needs to go on your to-make list.

recipes.title: Jerk Spatchcock Chicken
recipes.description: This recipe gives you three excellent guides. The first- how to spatchcock a chicken. The second- how to turn that chicken into the most delicious, succulent jerk flavoured dinner. And third- how to serve it with rice and peas! After a quick prep all you need to do is bang it in the oven for 30-40 minutes. So easy peasy lemon squeezy. A great mid week recipe.
ingredients: 400 g tin of kidney beans, drained
ingredients-original: 400 g tin of kidney beans, drained

recipes.title: Fresh Mint Cheesecake
recipes.description: Your mouth is going to feel minty fresh after this mouthful. My cheesecake also has a mighty matcha tea base that's the perfect match to mint.

recipes.title: Marshmallow Chocolate Cheesecake
recipes.description: This might be the best battle recipe I've ever created. The flavours, the textures and of course, the most important part... the looks... are all on point!

recipes.title: Lomo Saltado
recipes.description: Have you heard of Chifa before? It's what you call the amazing blend of Peruvian and Chinese cuisines that create dishes like this Lomo Saltado! The flavours that go into this beef stir fry are unbelievable. But the best bit? It's served with rice AND french fries. MEGA.
ingredients: 1 bowl lime flavoured rice to serve
ingredients-original: 1 bowl lime flavoured rice to serve

recipes.title: Causa Limena
recipes.description: Causa Limeña has a fantastic history and no, it's not out of a 70s dinner party recipe book! It originates from Peru and was created as a way to add life and flavour to three very simple, cheap ingredients: potato, seafood and pepper. They're the ideal starter, canapé or side to a Peruvian spread. We can recommend serving alongside Ceviche and Pisco Sours if you're looking for something a little bit different.
ingredients: 1 tbsp yellow chilli paste (Aji Amarillo if you can get it)
280 g tinned white crab meat, drained
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp yellow chilli paste (Aji Amarillo if you can get it)
280 g tinned white crab meat, drained

recipes.title: Picarones Sweet Potato Doughnuts
recipes.description: Picarones are a Peruvian sweet snack originating from the city of Lima. The best way to describe them is as a doughnut made from squash and sweet potato. Mental! They have an incredibly unique flavour from the cinnamon, star anise and citrus fruit used to create the dough and accompanying syrup. If you often like to go outside the box with your cooking be sure to give them a go. See what you think...

recipes.title: Ceviche
recipes.description: We've already got a wonderful ceviche recipe. This version is more of a showstopper that enables you to prep all the ingredients and showcase the process AT the table in front of your guests, keeping it ridiculously fresh. In true Peruvian style we recommend serving with sweet potato.

recipes.title: Pisco Sours
recipes.description: The pisco sours cocktail. A total South American classic! It's sweet... it's sour... it's tangy... it's refreshing. This is a recipe Ben learnt from a top notch bartender on his trip to Peru. So if you're going to make it, better do it as authentically as possible, right?!
ingredients: 25 ml sugar syrup (2 parts sugar : 1 part water)
1 egg white (if shaken by hand, use 1/2 if using a blender)
3 drops bitters, splashed on as garnish
ingredients-original: 25 ml sugar syrup (2 parts sugar : 1 part water)
1 egg white (if shaken by hand, use 1/2 if using a blender)
3 drops bitters, splashed on as garnish

recipes.title: Hot Choc Cookie Mallow Sundae
recipes.description: This might be the greatest ice cream sundae in the world. There are 6 desserts in one!!! Hot chocolate fudge sauce... toasted marshmallows... sandwich cookies... chocolate, strawberry AND vanilla ice cream. All homemade and layered in one glorious sundae glass.
ingredients: 150 g strawberries, blitzed to a puree
1 tbsp icing sugar (+ a little extra)
50 g fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced
ingredients-original: 150 g strawberries, blitzed to a puree
1 tbsp icing sugar (+ a little extra)
50 g fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced

recipes.title: Grilled Artichoke Bruschetta
recipes.description: It's antipasto time with this delicious bruschetta recipe. Load up your charred, hot bread with a mix of mozzarella, tomato, basil, garlic, artichoke and shallots. Sounds so simple but after smothering it all in an olive oil dressing and leaving to infuse for an hour, it's anything but!

recipes.title: Serrano Ham Croquettes
recipes.description: The cheesiest croquettes we've ever seen! The flavour profile of the manchego cheese and serrano ham is banging. The real winner of the recipe however is using panko breadcrumbs to deep fry your delicious mix. Revolutionary. Whack these out at you next Spanish feast. P.S. DON'T forget to leave plenty of time to chill the mixture right down before you roll and fry your mixture.

recipes.title: Chocolate Babka
recipes.description: We've had a bit of an argument in the SORTEDfood studio about Babka bread. It's such a rich, buttery dough that the end result is more like a cake. Laced with chocolate and cinnamon it's pretty darn impressive when you cut into it. We serve ours drizzled with a gorgeous sticky syrup studded with cloves. It's the perfect treat to serve alongside a cuppa when your mates pile into your kitchen.

recipes.title: Chicken And Mushroom Pie
recipes.description: Chicken is not boring. I've used some cheffy techniques to take my chicken and mushroom pie to the next level. It's amazing if I get the pastry right...

recipes.title: Saffron Chicken Sandwich
recipes.description: A sandwich for a battle? Well this is no ordinary sandwich. This will punch you in the face with flavour! Like in a good way.

recipes.title: Salt Baked Chicken And Fondant Potatoes
recipes.description: Listen, it's not about looks... it's about substance, and I am substantial. Anyway, this recipe is probably the tastiest chicken you'll ever taste. It has all the flavour.

recipes.title: Lean And Green Chicken Tacos
recipes.description: Check out this lovely lean chicken taco recipe. We've left out the naughty stuff like cheese & sour cream so you can enjoy these Mexican bites on a little more frequent basis. And if we do say so ourselves the flatbread dough is exceptional. Mint and spinach give them a lovely green colour and subtle fresh flavour.

recipes.title: Chocolate And Avocado Mousse
recipes.description: A rich, smooth chocolate mousse made better with the addition of avocado which adds a whole new dimension to the fluffy texture. You can also bake some lovely little coconut biscuits which compliment the whole shebang nicely.  It's also dairy free and gluten free!

recipes.title: Mini Mushroom Pasty
recipes.description: These vegetarian pocket pies based off the traditional Cornish pasty recipe come served with a fruity homemade tomato ketchup. Perfect for the autumn time! Recipe makes 4 delicious parcels.

recipes.title: Apple Pie Iced Bun Bowl
recipes.description: I like apple pie and I like iced buns. This is the perfect combination for me and my mouth to enjoy. A worthy battle winner!

recipes.title: Beer And Cheese Soup Bread Bowl
recipes.description: I didn't give James a recipe brief. I don't like cheese. He gave me a cheese soup recipe. I do like beer though, so that's something. This is actually a delicious recipe... try it for yourself!
ingredients: 300 ml pale ale (or your favourite beer, but something not too bitter)
ingredients-original: 300 ml pale ale (or your favourite beer, but something not too bitter)

recipes.title: Butter Chicken Bunny Chow
recipes.description: This might be my favourite battle recipe yet and I think I did it justice! It's a peshwari inspired bread bowl filled with the most delicious butter chicken. It was a popular one with everyone in the studio.

recipes.title: Red Velvet Cheesecake Brownies
recipes.description: Red velvet, gooey brownie, baked cheesecake goodness all in ONE tray bake! WHAT a way to kick of dessert week eh?! Big thumbs up to Caroline McCracken from our community for suggesting it!
ingredients: 1 tbsp Good Quality Red Food Colouring Gel
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp Good Quality Red Food Colouring Gel

recipes.title: Berry Froyo Bark
recipes.description: Frozen yogurt bark was trendy approximately 2 years ago so of course, we're making it now! It's the greatest grab & go snack ever ever ever. Raspberry and lavender flavour anyone?
ingredients: 1 handful redcurrants and blackcurrants to decorate
ingredients-original: 1 handful redcurrants and blackcurrants to decorate

recipes.title: Tangy Lemon Tart
recipes.description: This recipe is the classic lemon tart reimagined with a delicious buttery, nutty porridge oat base and a yogurt based filling. There's still all your favourite flavours in there- including that sharp lemony tang that makes it complete. We'd also recommend serving with a mind blowing elderflower creme fraiche.

recipes.title: Coffee And Hazelnut Swiss Roll
recipes.description: tbc

recipes.title: Almond Butter Porridge
recipes.description: Nut butters are all the rage these days. A spoonful on a steaming, creamy bowl of porridge topped with maple syrup and blueberries is the best way to start an action packed day. This recipe uses almonds as a base but you can apply it to any nut you like!

recipes.title: Halo Halo
recipes.description: Halo halo is an incredibly unique dessert originating from The Philippines. With this recipe you'll get layers of shaved ice, ube ice cream, sago pearls, mango, creme caramel and (strange for us at first) beans! We learnt not to knock it until we tried it... so give a go for something totally different.
ingredients: 300 g crushed ice (sweetened with the sugar syrup)
100 g nata de coco (red and green)
1 shop bought leche flan (or creme caramel)
ingredients-original: 300 g crushed ice (sweetened with the sugar syrup)
100 g nata de coco (red and green)
1 shop bought leche flan (or creme caramel)

recipes.title: Carnitas
recipes.description: 'Carnitas' means 'little meats' and that's exactly what this dish creates, the crispiest most succulent pork in the world to have shredded up with homemade pickle, salsa and jalapeños on a flat tortilla! Pork shoulder is braised for three hours then grilled off in all its juices. The flavour of each bite is an explosion.

recipes.title: Onepot Pork Medallions And Apricot Cassoulet
recipes.description: If you're running out of inspiration for simple, tasty midweek meals, you're not alone. This is something new and delicious to try using smashing pork medallions. The warming cassoulet is built around beans, spinach, apricots and prunes for insane flavour and textures. It's all made in one dish, so less fuss and less washing up!

recipes.title: Tartiflette
recipes.description: This classic Alpine French dish is straight off the ski slopes. It's cheesy, warming, rich and packed with potatoes which makes it the ultimate comfort food for a cold autumn or winter's day. The reblochon cheese used gives a unique taste so it's important to get hold of it for this recipe if you can. Thanks to our friend Charles from Fast, Good Cuisine for the recipe!

recipes.title: Granita Pistacchio E Nutella Con Tanto Di Brioche
recipes.description: I made this for the ultimate ice cream sandwich battle and it contains no ice cream and it isn't a sandwich
ingredients: 200 g unsalted butter, diced and softened
ingredients-original: 200 g unsalted butter, diced and softened

recipes.title: Deep Fried Cookie Dough Ice Cream Cookie Sandwich
recipes.description: I made this recipe for the ice cream sandwich battle. It's not a sandwich but there are cookies and ice cream involved.

recipes.title: Lemon And Raspberry Macaron Ice Cream Sandwich
recipes.description: This is delicious raspberry ripple ice cream and zesty tangy lemon curd sandwiched between two giant macaron shells to create an unbeatable ice cream sandwich fit to win a battle!
ingredients: 120 ml lemon juice (about 2 lemons plus the two already zested)
ingredients-original: 120 ml lemon juice (about 2 lemons plus the two already zested)

recipes.title: Blt Croque Madame
recipes.description: My BLT croque madame might look like a mess, but that's just because I made it. Don't think that it isn't delicious and that you could do a better job.

recipes.title: Level Up Chocolate Fudge Sauce
recipes.description: tbc

recipes.title: Bouche  La Reine
recipes.description: Béchamel is a classic, so I'm keeping it classic and this recipe is all about flavour. It's rich and delicious!

recipes.title: Black Pepper And Prawn Tagliatelle
recipes.description:
Another savoury eyeCandy recipe! This time it's amazing homemade black pepper pasta with crab and king prawns. This one isn't just good to look at...you really have to have a go at making it!

Tag your photos using #eyeCandySorted and we'll take a look!

recipes.title: Steak Fajitas
recipes.description: This is always a go-to meal for when friends come over. It's quick and easy to make for loads of people but there are a few simple tricks in our recipe that will make your Fajitas stand out from the crowd.

recipes.title: Hot Chocolate And Waffles
recipes.description:
This is amazing when it's a cold night outside and all you want is to stay indoors and keep warm. Thick, spiced hot chocolate with mini waffles to dip! Perfect! 

Keep tagging your photos with #eyeCandySorted!

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Fudge
recipes.description:
Present buying isn't always easy... you want to avoid the cliché box of chocolates, bunch of flowers or novelty socks... but lack inspiration. So how about these... our take on some beautiful homemade fudge gifts, perfect for any occasion.

Show that you care by putting in a little effort to create these simple, yet damn tasty pieces of fudge for someone special. Better still... whilst making and wrapping you can eat some too... and trust us... you'll want to!

recipes.title: Roast Beef Trencher
recipes.description: You've probably never seen a roast beef sandwich quite like this! We hollow out an entire loaf of bread and layer amazing beef, roasted onions, rocket, mozzarella and tomatoes. If that doesn't get you excited then we don't know what will!

recipes.title: Ultimate Birthday Cake
recipes.description: Not only does this cake combine two gorgeous rich vanilla sponges, chocolate buttercream, orange curd and fondant icing, but we also give you some cake decorating tips that will make sure that the next birthday cake you make will be the ultimate version! Everyone wants different sizes, shapes and flavours but decorating with fondant icing and using chocolate writing can always be used to make your cake really stand out!

recipes.title: Banoffee Bites
recipes.description: Banoffee pie is a firm favourite around the world, but the flavour combination works in loads of different ways. We've stuck banana and toffee into filo parcels that you could almost mistake for wontons! They're a cool little snack or a great dessert if people just want to pick at the end of a meal.

recipes.title: Black Pudding Fritters
recipes.description: This is a real hearty dish for the winter months that will fill you and the family up. The sharp, sweet apples and turnips go brilliantly together and complement the really savoury fritters and crispy bacon!

recipes.title: Brussels Bacon And Chestnut Potato Bake
recipes.description: This is a great way to use up all those ingredients that might be around your kitchen right after Christmas. Brussels, bacon and chestnuts are just the perfect match, all brought together with potatoes and a creamy cheese sauce.

recipes.title: Hot Choc Mocha And Biscuit Dunkers
recipes.description: Enjoy this luxurious thick hot chocolate...ideal for dunking your incredibly easy-to-make biscuits. This is the perfect recipe for when it's freezing outside and you're having a night in on the sofa!

recipes.title: Jerk Chicken With Crisp Potato Skins
recipes.description: This dish is vibrant, spicy and great to share with friends...everything you'd expect from an amazing Caribbean meal! We crisp up some potato skins to scoop up our sticky jerk chicken. Perfect for around a table with your friends.

recipes.title: Lamb Biryani
recipes.description: Everyone loves a curry and the Sorted crew are no exception! We've cooked a lot of curries but never this classic Biryani...perfect when cooking for all your mates this baked dish uses yoghurt to keep it super soft and tasty.

recipes.title: Moroccan Turkey Pie
recipes.description: The Moroccan flavours in our pie give an unusual sweet flavour to this savoury dish and the eggs thicken the sauce as it cooks inside layers of crisp filo pastry. It's definitely a change from your average chicken pie!

recipes.title: Pear And Cranberry Lattice
recipes.description: This is a great throw together dessert for the family or even unexpected guests. There are a few little tricks to make it super easy but tasting and looking fantastic!
ingredients: 320 g ready to roll puff pastry
ingredients-original: 320 g ready to roll puff pastry

recipes.title: Squid Ink Risotto
recipes.description: This week Ben and Jamie bring to the table an amazing squid ink risotto. It's definitely one of those simple recipes that has a lot of wow factor when you serve it. The squid ink turns this classic risotto t o dark colour, which looks amazing against the pink and white squid! Finish it all off with some homemade seaweed garlic ciabatta and you've got a sure winner.
ingredients: 1 squid ink sachet (from the fish counter)
ingredients-original: 1 squid ink sachet (from the fish counter)

recipes.title: White Chocolate Panna Cotta
recipes.description: This is a luxurious but fresh end to a meal that makes a great centrepiece for the middle of the table. Our smooth white chocolate panna cotta is served on shards of dark chocolate that add extra indulgent crunch and fantastically vibrant champagne strawberries! A winning, romantic combination!

recipes.title: Wild Mushroom Noodles
recipes.description: These noodles makes a fantastic vegetarian meal to impress. Pile the noodles and crispy tempura shiitakes high in the middle of the table and let everyone take as much as they like before pouring over the rich mushroomy sauce.
ingredients: 2 tbsp butter, stirred with a little warm water
400 ml sparkling water, kept ice cold
ingredients-original: 2 tbsp butter, stirred with a little warm water
400 ml sparkling water, kept ice cold

recipes.title: Braised Beef With Pappardelle
recipes.description:
Good food can take time but this slow cooked beef is definitely worth it in the end. It's cooked in an amazing sauce flavoured with white wine, passata and porcini mushrooms.

We made some fresh pasta to go with it, which is easier than you might think... you don't even need a pasta machine!

recipes.title: Sweet Ravioli
recipes.description: You can find great pasta everywhere nowadays, but you might not have tried sweet pasta for dessert! It's made in just the same way as normal pasta, but for the filling we use brilliant fresh cherries and mascarpone then we pour over amazing runny kirsch custard! You have to try this!

recipes.title: Chicken Tikka Masala
recipes.description: We all love a takeout, but our tikka masala is so easy and delicious that we'd far rather cook everything ourselves. It takes under an hour from start to finish... probably quicker than ordering in and you'll get our amazing aubergine raita as well!

recipes.title: Chocolate  Beetroot Brownies
recipes.description: Brownies are one of our favourite chocolatey treats but we've managed to make them even better by adding a secret ingredient...beetroot! It goes perfectly with the chocolate and keeps the brownie lovely and moist.

recipes.title: Cider Mussels And Soda Bread
recipes.description: This is one of the easiest, yet most impressive recipes we've done @ the table. We kick off by making our own soda bread, which doesn't need any kneading or proving...so quick and easy! We move on to steam our mussels in a creamy cider sauce, perfect for dipping. Yummy!

recipes.title: Lamb Kebabs With Giant Couscous
recipes.description: This lamb is incredible because we've mixed it up with herbs, spices, fruit and nuts. We serve it with a really fresh tasting salad using giant couscous, which is great if you're looking for something a bit different to your usual starches!

recipes.title: Giant Sausage Roll
recipes.description: This is the ultimate sausage roll! It's no longer party or picnic food though, ours is big enough to make the perfect centrepiece for a gathering with family or friends. Give it a go!
ingredients: 2 sprigs thyme, leaves removed and chopped
6 portions roasted root vegetables to serve
ingredients-original: 2 sprigs thyme, leaves removed and chopped
6 portions roasted root vegetables to serve

recipes.title: Hot Prawn Cocktail
recipes.description: We're bringing the tired prawn cocktail bang up to date today, serving it up hot, in a brand new way that's perfect for sharing. We also add a few Sorted twists by drying out the tomatoes and grilling the lettuce...your guests will LOVE this!

recipes.title: Creamy Polenta And Pork Fillet
recipes.description: Pork and apple is an absolute classic. Throw in an amazing balsamic glaze and creamy cheesy polenta and you've got a sure winner that will impress anyone who is lucky enough to eat it.

recipes.title: Thai Chicken Broth
recipes.description: Thai food makes it so easy to pack in loads of big, bold flavours. It means that you can be pretty healthy but still have great tasting food. We've snuck in a cheeky tin of coconut milk, but our broth recipe uses lean chicken breast, plenty of veg and rice noodles which are gluten free!

recipes.title: Toasted Apple Cake And Butterscotch Sauce
recipes.description: The apple sauce makes this cake really dense and moist, which is the perfect contrast to the crispy outsides once we toast it. Try it before you think we've gone mad, toasted cake is amazing...especially with our homemade butterscotch sauce and a dollop of ice cream!
ingredients: 2 scoops vanilla ice cream to serve
ingredients-original: 2 scoops vanilla ice cream to serve

recipes.title: Trio Of Flatbreads
recipes.description: Flatbreads are probably the easiest bread you can make. There's no yeast, so no waiting for it to prove and because they're so thin they take no time to cook. We've whipped up three different toppings that are used with the same dough. Impressing your friends has never been easier!
ingredients: 1 handful fresh coriander, leave some to garnish
ingredients-original: 1 handful fresh coriander, leave some to garnish

recipes.title: Deconstructed Caesar Salad
recipes.description: Salads can be boring right? Who would order one when out at a restaurant? Perhaps not... after all they aren't always that imaginative... until now. We take all the usual elements of a caesar salad and perfect each one or give them one of our usual twists.

recipes.title: Ribs And Coconut Rice
recipes.description: This is the type of food that we love more than most... slow-cooked sticky ribs, a sticky rice and a simple salad that is sharp and refreshing to balance the plate of flavours out. Trust us... you'll be an instant fan!

recipes.title: Coffee Marinated Beef With Maple Slaw
recipes.description: Ben's trip to Costa Rica last year inspired this slow-cooked beef recipe. The very savoury and slightly bitter flavours of coffee and chicory balance beautifully with the maple coleslaw.

recipes.title: Egg Custard Tart
recipes.description: This treat has it's roots in Portugal... but our simplified use of ready made puff pastry which we enhance with chocolate and pistachio makes it super Sorted! Served with personalised coffee it's a true winner.

recipes.title: Greek Mez
recipes.description: The great thing about this... is that there is something for everyone! Plenty of Greek inspired flavours to jump between and enjoy. Each part is really simple, but together it forms a spread of food to be proud of.
ingredients: 500 g lamb neck fillet, cut into large chunks
ingredients-original: 500 g lamb neck fillet, cut into large chunks

recipes.title: Meaty Paella
recipes.description: This is perhaps the most iconic taste of Spain... one that focusses on two key meats (chorizo and rabbit) and helped with a glow of saffron. Finished with a punchy garlicky aioli it's perfect sunshine food. Plonk the pan on the table and let everybody dig in for themselves.

recipes.title: Happy Egg Farm
recipes.description: It's not often we get chance to head out of the SORTED kitchen to explore with food... but this week... Mike and Jamie were invited along to the Happy Eggs farm to see first hand what makes their hens so happy and their eggs so good.

recipes.title: Cake Pops
recipes.description: With Mother's Day just around the corner Mike and Ben finally get around to cooking up and decorating some smart little cake pops... as inspired by Lovelyladycakes last summer. With the help of a handy machine the baking part becomes easy and avoids the messy reforming of crumbs that's more traditional.

recipes.title: Mosaic Sushi
recipes.description: This is awesome!

recipes.title: Cookie Monster Cake
recipes.description: This week is a muppet-fest as Mike shows you how to make a Cookie Monster cake. Withhold judgement for now because it actually turns out pretty well.

recipes.title: Donut Milkshake
recipes.description: Our donut milkshake brings not just the boys, but everyone to the yard! Although it's definitely one for sharing. Also this week, Barry and Mike bring you fridgecam from the US of A and give a run down of what the team have been up to this week.

recipes.title: Mini Key Lime Pies
recipes.description: The most incredible mouthful you will ever experience. Fact.

recipes.title: Caramel Popcorn
recipes.description: Never fails!

recipes.title: Fish And Chips Goujons
recipes.description: I came across a version of this recipe on Itsgrace and thought using salt & vinegar crisps to bread the fish was an awesome idea. She's a genius!

recipes.title: Tiny Corn Dogs
recipes.description: We're hoping that with your help, we've created the best corndog recipe ever! Your initial recipe requests and suggestions along the way resulted in this... We've stuck sweetcorn and jalapenos into the batter to make it fresh and spicy. We also used kosher beef hot dogs as suggested by you guys. Let us know what you think!

recipes.title: Easter Eggs
recipes.description:
With Easter just around the corner, what better time to make Easter Eggs?

Loads of you wanted us to make them, so we set Ben to work... Unfortunately Jamie & Mike don't quite have Ben's explanation skills... What do you think?
