recipes.title: Chewy Brownies
recipes.description: Not too fudgy and not too cakey - the perfect middle ground brownie. You can either have them plain, with peanut butter or strawberry cream cheese frostings.

recipes.title: Strawberry Chiffon Cupcakes
recipes.description: Chiffon cupcakes are perfect if you are tired of eating regular cupcakes and they also contain less butter/oil. A moment on the lips forever on the hips? Not when you’re eating these.

recipes.title: Chorizo  Pea Mini Quiche Cupcakes
recipes.description: We've made quiche before and we all know it's one of my favourites. But this method beats them all if you want quick results. Little individual ones without the need for fussing with pastry... they look almost like quiche cupcakes!

recipes.title: Mini Burgers
recipes.description: Mini Burgers with Caramelised red onion, goats cheese, red pesto mayo. A classic from the book and still going strong ;-)

recipes.title: Rainbow Cake
recipes.description: We put our heads together to make the very best Rainbow Cake recipe and we're pretty happy with the results... Not double, but TRIPLE Rainbow Cake with an M&M centre, four-tone buttercream icing and Skittles. Who needs a pot of gold now?

recipes.title: Chocolate Slabs
recipes.description:
Making chocolates the professional way does take a little more time and care. If you just melt chocolate and let it set again then the re-crystalizasation of the cocoa butter means that it will be dull, can 'bloom' (get white dots), have a grainy texture and never quite go hard enough to give that satisfying chocolate snap.

What you need to do is temper your chocolate... and here's how...

recipes.title: Brigadeiro
recipes.description:
This week Barry cooks up a Brazilian treat (Brigaeiro) with Danielle and Caroline and Ben is shown how to make a fish taco properly by Hilah! 

Not only that... but we wish Jamie all the best for his wedding this week... have you got him that gift he asked for? :D

recipes.title: Sandcastle Cake
recipes.description: This week we pay tribute to the 4-day British summertime by making a cake that looks like an actual sandcastle!! On top of that, Ben single-handedly takes mens fashion into another dimension...
ingredients: 1 handful light brown sugar to decorate
ingredients-original: 1 handful light brown sugar to decorate

recipes.title: Mini Meringue Drops
recipes.description: These dainty little treat are seriously simple to make... just a few ingredients and they look great on a platter as they are or crumbled over ice cream. As Ben suggests... they look like Unicorn teardrops!?! :S

recipes.title: Hot Chocolate Fondants
recipes.description: For me this is the easiest,almost foolproof chocolate Fondant recipe . The secret is in the timing  & baking it from the fridge .. Enjoy with a dollop Creme fraiche ..

recipes.title: How To Make Cronuts
recipes.description:
We've had so many requests for these over the last few weeks that we couldn't wait any longer... So here's our video for CRONUTS!

Cronuts are a mix between a croissant and a doughnut/donut, and are the most gorgeous sweet treats that have been taking over Manhattan and London for the last couple of months! Dominique Ansel may have started them, but we've shared with you a recipe courtesy of @theboywhobakes to bring them to you guys!

recipes.title: Ramen Noodle Burger
recipes.description:
Who's heard of them?   
If you keep yourself up to date with all the latest food crazes then you'll know that the perfect fusion of 'east meets west' is an odd one to get your head around... and yet it works! Straight out of a Brooklyn food market, started by Keizo Shimamoto it's the result of Japanese and American food culture colliding... and it tastes pretty damn good!

What other food crazes should we be cooking up?

recipes.title: Fancy Swiss Roll
recipes.description:
When roaming through images on Pinterest... this idea jumped out at us! We simply had to make it. So combining Barry's artistic flare and Ben's baking this is what we end up with.   

What do you reckon? Look good or could you do better?

recipes.title: Nutella And Salted Caramel Stuffed Cookies
recipes.description:
Does life get better than Nutella and Salted Caramel Stuffed Double Chocolate Chip Cookies?!

Well, when you film them in stop motion not only do they taste amazing, they also look INCREDIBIZZLE!

Yes, we invited our friend Izy from Top With Cinnamon down to show us how real food is done, and she doesn't disappoint!

recipes.title: Megaburgerpizza
recipes.description:
We covered the next hybrid food crazes, now we're making them! Sorted presents... the MEGABURGERPIZZA!

We were a bit nervous about this one...even with a bit of lettuce thrown in, it's not the healthiest beast! In fact, we were pleasantly surprised; it tastes amazing. Definitely a special treat, but a worthwhile one!

recipes.title: Grasshopper Pie
recipes.description: This is an American favourite.... inspired by the popular 1950's cocktail. A really simple method using marshmallows makes this super quick to make. The chocolate oreo base is great... but nothing compared to how we decorate this dessert... with real life, edible grasshoppers.

recipes.title: Bubble Tea
recipes.description: Bubble tea, a fairly new concoction started in the 1980's, is a Taiwanese tea-based drinks made with tapioca pearls or bubbles. It's often called boba tea and since it's become incredibly popular as a refreshing soft drink in the summer we thought Grace might like it... so we invited her down to try some.

recipes.title: Tomato Soup Cake
recipes.description: Yep, we didn't believe it as first either! Even up to the point of spooning the cake batter back into the tin to bake it, it smelt bad. But once cooked it was delicious... soft, moist and well spiced. A true autumnal treat!

recipes.title: New York  New York Cheesecake
recipes.description: The KING of Cheesecake !!! The Big Apple Classic ...

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cupcakes
recipes.description: Every year we conjure up a spooky Halloween treat... we went all out on costumes this year... and to be honest... we think it might be an improvement on the norm!

recipes.title: Spicy Aztec Hot Chocolat Chaud
recipes.description: The oldest known hot chocolate recipe .. It will give you extra VAVAVOOM !! A magic elixir ...

recipes.title: 50Th Anniversary Dalek Bread
recipes.description:
Last time we paid homage to Doctor Who it didn't go quite to plan! In fact Jamie and Barry made a right pigs ear of fish fingers and custard!
So this time... Ben stands up for the millions of whovians out there and creates an awesome Dalek Bread to celebrate the 50th Anniversary.

recipes.title: Chocolate Cookie Cupcake Icecream Cone
recipes.description: This recipe is pretty epic... it was built for the internet... crammed with all the stuff you guys love. But when Chris and Nick from The Brothers Riedell came to help us bake them... they had to make it even more epic by transforming the whole thing into a blockbuster movie!

recipes.title: Scientifically Proven Best Cup Of Tea
recipes.description:
Britain is a fine nation... but we probably wouldn't even be able to stand on our own two feet if we didn't have the humble cup of tea. It's pretty simple... just 3 ingredients... but do you know how to make the PERFECT cup of tea? Watch this to find out... or simply follow this formula:-

**tb+200ml(H2O at 100C)2minsbt+m(10ml)+6minsbt=pt(at ot 60C)**

We also make a Moroccan inspired mint tea and a peach iced tea.

recipes.title: Chocolate Brownie In A Mug
recipes.description: Settle your chocolate craving and make a 5 minute brownie in a mug to eat on the sofa. It's quick, easy, cheap and perfect for students thanks to the trusty microwave. There's an idea for you.

recipes.title: Swedish Meatballs Sorrel Mash  Raspberries
recipes.description: Adapted from thedomesticman's recipe. Love the addition of raspberries

recipes.title: Masala Dosa
recipes.description: South Indian crispy lentil pancake filled with spiced potatoes. Oh the feels.
ingredients: 6 medium sized potatoes, peeled, diced and parboiled
½ cup whole urad dal (skinned black gram)
1 cup medium grain rice (basmati worked for me)
ingredients-original: 6 medium sized potatoes, peeled, diced and parboiled
½ cup whole urad dal (skinned black gram)
1 cup medium grain rice (basmati worked for me)

recipes.title: Recipe Of The Day Mulled Wine Cake
recipes.description: Wreaths are a symbol of the arrival of Christmas... they look great when hung on the door... but... you just can't eat them! So we've changed that! Made with the flavours of Christmas and finished with a mulled wine icing it's the perfect alternative for those who aren't a fan of traditional Christmas pudding.

recipes.title: Iced Gems
recipes.description: Everyone at Sorted remembered these little sugary biscuits from our childhood... but we didn't even know you could still buy them. We grabbed ourselves a bag and were massively disappointed. They weren't what we remembered so we set out to fix that!

recipes.title: Root Veg Crisps
recipes.description: Barry's cousin makes a triumphant return to FridgeCam to assist in the making of some of his favourite food... crisps. We manage to trick him into eating a few veggies too! Our homemade version uses carrot, parsnip, squash, white radish and beetroot to create something very wintery

recipes.title: Frozen Cheesecake
recipes.description:
Everything tastes better on a stick... Ben still seems convinced of this! So we've taken another of your favourites, the humble cheesecake and set about creating something different.

With the flavours of grapefruit, tangerine, kumquat, orange and lemon this is super tangy but deliciously sweet too!

recipes.title: Fortune Cookies
recipes.description: With Chinese New Year and the year of the Horse on the approach we thought we'd celebrate with some bespoke fortunes wrapped up in deliciously crispy and sweet cookies. Our idiot proof recipe to making awesome fortune cookies means you can create them at home with family and friends and not just in chinese restaurants.

recipes.title: Cheesy Mice
recipes.description: If you think a cheese board after a meal is a bit too mature for you then have a go at our little mice. They make a variety of cheeses more playful and are perfect for packed lunch too.

recipes.title: Marshmallow Popcorn Bars
recipes.description: If you struggle to decide what to eat when watching a film then let us solve your problem for you! Why not bung them all into one amazing morsel! popcorn, pretzels, chocolate and even marshmallows! Whether you wrap these up as a gift for a friend or loved one or munch on them with mates during a movie night... they are a definite win!

recipes.title: Banana Monkey Cake
recipes.description: This one even surprised us! But a generous dollop of mayonnaise in the cake mix makes the lightest and fluffiest sponge ever! Combined with the flavours of banana and cardamom it's a definite winner.

recipes.title: Fools Gold Loaf
recipes.description: This sandwich was rumoured to be the King of Rock 'n' Roll's absolute favourite. He once boarded a 3 hour flight to Denver just to eat the sandwich with friends before returning home. We figured if it was that good, we should give it a go for another musical legend we know... Chester See! Except our version is a little neater, with multiple layers of bread, peanut butter and Jelly.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Swirl Pancakes
recipes.description: We've done stacks of delicious pancakes over the years but these cinnamon ones might just top the lot. Learn how to make fluffy American-style pancakes for breakfast. Grab a fork and eat them with your mouth.

recipes.title: Rainbow Pasta
recipes.description: We've done rainbow coloured stuff before but it's always been sweet, or needed loads of syrup drizzled over the top. This time we tackle savoury and cook up some delicious tasting bright coloured pasta. Not exactly all the colours in the rainbow but wow do they look good!

recipes.title: Guinness Cake
recipes.description: Excusing the stereotyping that may or may not occur in this particular episode we can promise that the cake is devine! Rich, heavy chocolate cake with a hint of guinness and a gorgeous Guinness frosting that'll have you running for the end of the rainbow!

recipes.title: Flower Pot Bread
recipes.description:
Spring is finally here in the UK, which means it's time for Ben to get gardening! Or in this case to plant a few seeds inside of his flower pot breads and rest them into his edible herb garden allotment! 

Get baking... cos these are perfect for Mothers Day in the UK.

recipes.title: Toffee Apple Cookie Pie
recipes.description:
We've played around with the wonders of a Portmanteau before with the likes of Cronuts and Ramen Burgers but we thought we should up our game!

How about combining 3 things into one treat! The humble apple pie, collides with a toffee apple and is wrapped up with delicious chewy cinnamon cookie dough. Toffee Apple Cookie Pie... we couldn't come up with anything more catchy to call it... can you?

recipes.title: Savoury Swiss Roll
recipes.description: This one might mess with your head. It did with ours! It was suggested to us, so we had a bit of a play and came up with the following! It's brilliant!

recipes.title: Creme Egg Brownie
recipes.description: No Easter basket of chocolatey treats should be complete without a few of these... the brownie mixture itself it awesome... cracked and crumbly on top, gooey and fudgey inside... but then the partly baked creme eggs take it to another level.

recipes.title: Chocolate Salami
recipes.description:
Another one to play with your mind... something that looks savoury... but is in fact sweet! This was suggested to us by one of you guys and at first we didn't believe it... after testing though... we LOVE it!

We even (almost) avoiding any awkward innuendos...

recipes.title: Milk And Cookie Shots
recipes.description: Dominic Ansel has done it again... first the cronut and now the most brilliant merge of a childhood memory... warm cookies and a glass of milk. We've done our version to celebrate but swapped the milk for ice cream and mixed up the flavours! Enjoy!

recipes.title: Diy Smoked Fish
recipes.description: A new toy... we had a play with a home smoker to create some gorgeous whisky oak smoked trout and salmon... then served it on a beautiful bed of salad. All done in Barry's Nan's garden!

recipes.title: Dog Biscuits
recipes.description: We heard that dog food is put the test on humans first! So we thought... why not cook up some delicious canine treats! We started with the nicer option of dog biscuits and you'll see form the video... dogs love them!

recipes.title: Quiche Cupcakes
recipes.description: We've made quiche before, and we all know it's one of Ben's favourites. But this method beats them all if you want quick results. Little individual ones without the need for fussing with pastry... they look almost like quiche cupcakes! And who are we going to share this recipe with... Donal Skehan of course! He was in London and we simply couldn't refuse the opportunity to cook with him.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
recipes.description:
What's better than a carrot? CAKE
What's better than a carrot cake? BIGGER CARROT CAKE!!

Yep, we've made a giant carrot cake in the shape of a carrot because... Well, why not?! Plus we left all the nice cooking sounds in for you...!!

recipes.title: Chefs Mushroom Risotto
recipes.description: A risotto is a go to dish for Ben when he needs to impress without much time to prepare… this version is crammed full of tips on how to make the perfectly loved risotto. Homemade stock made with dried porcini mushrooms, Italian wine, finished with hand-picked broad beans, picked cress, truffle oil and shaving of pecorino.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Noodle Salad
recipes.description: If, like Ben, you spend most days cooking, then when you finally get home you don't want to slave away in the kitchen... what you do want though is more great food. So this is one brilliant solution, made in under 10 minutes... it's fresh, vibrant, healthy and has plenty of zing and spice!

recipes.title: Chicken And Preserved Lemon Tagine
recipes.description: A fairly unique flavour that as soon as you smell it, it takes you right back to the spice markets and souks of Morocco… if you’ve been. The recipe makes use of preserved lemons, sumac and arghan oil… all 3 ingredients new to Ben and discovered during his travels.

recipes.title: Chicken Teriyaki Skewers
recipes.description: Whether you cook this on a bbq or under the grill like we do... it's really speedy and yet so unbelievably tasty. The sale you can make in the time it takes for the chicken to cook... an absolute winner.

recipes.title: Lemon And Sage Roasted Chicken
recipes.description: Roast chicken is always a comforting favourite! This version is a little more summary and served with a warm pea and potato salad.

recipes.title: Ras El Hanout Chicken Breast
recipes.description: This is one of Ben's new favourite flavours... **Ras el Hanout** is a Moroccan spice blend which literally translates to "Top of the shop" meaning it has all the best spices! And some caramelised lemon is a neat little trick for this one.

recipes.title: Strawberry Jelly And Ice Cream
recipes.description: Strawberries and cream are a marriage made in heaven and with the British elegance of Wimbledon just about to begin we thought we'd treat ourselves to some champagne. Apologies in advance for the puns... can you keep score?

recipes.title: Gin And Tonic Cake
recipes.description: Ben is quite partial to G ‘n’ T… so the thought of adding it into a cake was pretty cool. Baked with tonic water and lime, drenched in gin once baked and finished with a cream cheese frosting these taste as good as they look. Served with the first cocktail Ben ever drank, it’s a match made in heaven.

recipes.title: Caramelised Onion Tart
recipes.description: Whether you eat this whilst still warm or enjoy it cold in a packed lunch or picnic it's one to impress. Most people don't consider tucking into a dish so heavy with onions but these are sticky and sweet and the the salty, savouriness of anchovies and olives and the rich buttery puff pastry we can assure you that the French really do know what they're doing with their classics!

recipes.title: Sweet Onion Relish
recipes.description: Burgers, sausages and hot dogs can be found at bbq's right through the sumer months... but never will a squeeze of mustard or ketchup quite do the job. Not once you've tired our sweet onion relish. Barry described the flavour as weird... but in a good way! We think it's sweet, sticky, tangy and fresh from the dill. It even works awesomely in a cheese sandwich.

recipes.title: Crispy Onion Bhajis
recipes.description: You may already make a curry at home, but have you ever considered a bhaji? It's so quick and simple, that you've got to give it a go. Our own spice blend (all dry spices that are easy to keep in the cupboard) and use of gram flour make this version taste as great as at a restaurant, but anybody and everybody can cook them!

recipes.title: Olaf Sushi From Frozen
recipes.description: Mike and Ben have wanted to do a Frozen themed FridgeCam for while... and we're glad they did. This is a winner and so simple for you to make at home. Olaf from Disney's Frozen is perfect for sushi and awesome in a packed lunch!

recipes.title: Welsh Cakes
recipes.description: Great Britain is particularly 'great' because it combines a handful of countries and so many local and regional specialities... these welsh cakes showcase just that. Perfect for the summer, great with strawberries and cream and unbelievably tasty given their simplicity.

recipes.title: Baileys  Maltesers Cheesecake
recipes.description: A non-bake cheesecake that is easy to make.

recipes.title: Strawberry Peaches  Cream Popsicles
recipes.description: Super easy, creamy popsicles to help you beat the heat! Naturally sweetened with some crushed amaretti for even more flavour. (It's easy to make even healthier by swapping out the cream for more yogurt)

recipes.title: Hayleys Green Superpower Juice
recipes.description: Gold pressed juice from super greens. Packed full of micro nutrients, vitamins and minerals.

recipes.title: Gooey Chocolate Fudge Brownies
recipes.description: This recipe will give you deliciously gooey brownies that will satisfy your need for chocolate!

recipes.title: Rhubarb And Ginger
recipes.description: Poached rhubarb, ginger shortbread, iced yoghurt and raspberries with Elderflower and rhubarb syrup. Amazing summer dessert and easy to make!

recipes.title: Piquant Tomato And Cod Bake
recipes.description: This is a real summery dish... with a truly mediterranean feel. The same classic tomato sauce is elevated with some roasted red peppers, a handful of capers and zest of a lemon. Using that as a base to bake off some cod and served with boiled new potatoes or crusty bread and it will become a new favourite!

recipes.title: Tomato And Mozzarella Salad
recipes.description: This is a fancy looking dish and whether you enjoy it as a light lunch or the perfect start to a meal it tastes as good as it looks. The simplicity of it is part of it's beauty... the same tomato sauce as a base finished with freshly ripped basil leaves is spooned over creamy torn mozzarella and garnished with a crispy shard of baked parma ham.

recipes.title: Spicy Spanish Flatbread
recipes.description: One small twist on a classic tomato sauce and you can create a spicy base to this flatbread. By using a pre-made garlic flatbread, some goats cheese and slices of chorizo you can have this dish ready to eat in no time at all.

recipes.title: Roasted Mushroom  Chive Eggs
recipes.description: The perfect brunch this weekend. Who needs scrambled egg on toast, when you can have scrambled egg on mushroom!?!

recipes.title: Basils Pesto
recipes.description: A simple pesto that suits every pasta dish under the sun!! It's my go to lazy dish.

recipes.title: Thai Red  Lemongrass Fish Skewers
recipes.description: The fragrance of this dish is brilliant, even as it cooks you get the aroma of lemongrass and Thai spice.
ingredients: few sprigs of baby coriander sprouts
ingredients-original: few sprigs of baby coriander sprouts

recipes.title: Pineapple  Tamarind Rice
recipes.description: A sweet and sour rice dish served in a gales pineapple as a brilliant talking point!

recipes.title: Bazzas Bbq Sauce
recipes.description: This has never failed me. Get these ingredients in your store cupboard and knock this up every time you light the BBQ!

recipes.title: Dumplings
recipes.description: A recipe that originally was designed to bring ones family and relatives together during the holidays, which I've now simplified to suit the busy simple student life and a spontaneous dinner party with friends during a weekend in Stockholm.

recipes.title: Perfect Pimms For Wimbledon Final
recipes.description: Everybody has a favourite summer concoction... This is one of my favourites! Also good with cucumber, but I didn't have any!

recipes.title: Yakitori Prawn Stirfry
recipes.description: A Japanese inspired prawn and veg stir-fry served with sesame noodles. Speedy dinner ready in 10 mins!

recipes.title: Mojito Fruit Salad
recipes.description: A simple fruit salad with a Mojito kick ;)

recipes.title: Ginger Ale And Apple Crush
recipes.description: Having a BBQ or picnic this weekend? Don't forget to pack your punch! This is our homemade ginger ale (the quick cheat's version) transformed into an awesome icy drink.

recipes.title: Simple Bruschetta Supper
recipes.description: Using a bunch of leftovers after a day of filming... A speedy and light supper... Just what's needed when you've been cooking and eating all day!

recipes.title: Full English Breakfast
recipes.description: We couldn't resist doing this one as part of the Sorted Eats Britain series... after all... we're english and that even appears in the title of this dish. That said, we've given the breakfast a nod to Scotland too with some haggis and share how to cook the perfect full-english for a big crowd, so that everything is ready at the same time.

recipes.title: Cod Lemon  Cauliflower
recipes.description: Love this combination! Rich salty Jersey Royals, Cod, mild wild garlic with lemon mayo and Romanesco.

recipes.title: No Bake Coconut  Chocolate Granola Bars
recipes.description: Chewy, crispy and quite healthy! They happen to be gluten free and vegan too.
ingredients: ¼ cup coconut manna or coconut butter
5 tbsp agave or brown rice syrup
ingredients-original: ¼ cup coconut manna or coconut butter
5 tbsp agave or brown rice syrup

recipes.title: Chinese 5 Spice Burger
recipes.description: The classic beef burger is easily adapted and transformed... this is just one way... but a pretty special one! The combination of ginger, spring onion, coriander and 5-spice gives this minced beef a hint of Chinese flair. We know they work in a  stir-fry, so why not a burger? Served with steamed pak choi and in a sesame bun with chilli sauce completes the burger.

recipes.title: Beef And Mushroom Burger
recipes.description:
Combining multiple classic methods of cooking into one dish is usually a good thing.. it definitely is here! 

A mushrooms duxelle, served with beef, is a trick that might more commonly be seen in a beef wellington, but it really improves a burger as it keeps it seriously succulent and the flavour combo can't be beaten!

recipes.title: French Inspired Burger
recipes.description:
Steak tartare is a very traditional dish of well seasoned minced beef, served raw with an egg cracked on top (also served raw) alongside from brioche toasts.

We understand not everybody likes the idea of the raw beef and egg, so we borrowed those same flavours (capers, mustard, cornichons, parsley) and applied them to our burger mix, but this time we cooked it... and served with a poached egg in a brioche bun.

recipes.title: Banoffee Trifle
recipes.description: Banoffee pie is a relatively recent addition to the list of British desserts, whilst trifle has been around for ages. For this one we merge the two... as if the Portmanteau of Banoffee (banana and toffee) wasn't enough... we squeeze in the elements of a trifle too.

recipes.title: Healthy Cucumber Smoothie
recipes.description: Cucumbers are a brilliant base to a smoothie as they are mostly water, but also incredibly refreshing. As a base they are spot on to add loads of other bits to. This raw smoothie is vibrant, sweet and seriously refreshing.

recipes.title: Cucumber  Roasted Cashew Raita
recipes.description: If you struggle with hot food then you need a dollop of this. The cucumber and yoghurt accompaniment not only tastes incredible but has a cooling effect when served with spicy food.

recipes.title: Cucumber Strip Salad
recipes.description: Using this smart but stupidly simple method of cutting cucumber it will give your salads a completely different dimension. The lime, soy, sugar and chilli dressing provides a zing and it works beautifully with crab cakes, teriyaki chicken skewers or alongside sushi.

recipes.title: White Wine Poached Peaches
recipes.description: A simple summery dessert that takes little effort but looks amazing!

recipes.title: Avocado Cucumber And Feta Salad
recipes.description: My basic go to healthy summer salad.

recipes.title: Blueberry Honey Scones
recipes.description: Blueberry Honey Scones

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Crack Brownies
recipes.description: Brownie, peanut butter, peanut butter cups, Oreos and rice crispies
ingredients: 1 packet brownie mix, or batch of homemade
ingredients-original: 1 packet brownie mix, or batch of homemade

recipes.title: Its A Super Cake Super Cake
recipes.description: With lemon. Loooooots of lemon.

recipes.title: Scampi And Chip Sarnie
recipes.description: Scampi and chips, served in a basket is a favourite in any pub garden in the summer. That and a proper doorstep sandwich. So we've tried to blend the two together, making a deliciously crisp beer batter for the scampi and a homemade tartare sauce... plus some baked salt and vinegar crisps.

recipes.title: Broccoli And Peanut Butter Soup
recipes.description: Don't run away just yet... allow us to explain. You wouldn't think twice about a few roasted peanuts tossed into a broccoli stir-fry because the flavours work... so why not in a soup. This is a little tip that transforms your soup instead of the usual broccoli and stilton classic.

recipes.title: Roasted Broccoli Salad
recipes.description:
Root vegetables are commonly roasted... but who thinks about roasting broccoli? It colours and wrinkles a little around the edges, but the flavour as a result of it is not to be argued with.

Combined with dried fruit, sweet potatoes, onions and a sour cream dressing it's a unusual combo that you won't forget!

recipes.title: Broccoli Mornay
recipes.description: This is essentially our twist on a cauliflower cheese! Not only do we throw a little blue cheese into the sauce but the addition of pumpkin seeds on top as it grills gives this a real nutty flavour!

recipes.title: Pork Pie And Picallilli
recipes.description: Traditional meaty snacks that once you've made them you'll be sure to bake them time and time again. Traditionally designed to be eaten on the back of a horse by english gentlemen... nowadays, more suited a picnic or packed lunch!
ingredients: 200 g chicken fillets, sliced to fit the pies
ingredients-original: 200 g chicken fillets, sliced to fit the pies

recipes.title: Mackerel With Warm Potato Pea  Horseradish Salad
recipes.description: We should all be eating more oily fish... At least once a week. A couple of fillets of smoked and peppered mackerel is a speedy option for a summer supper.

recipes.title: Cod With Piquant Potatoes
recipes.description: I had some leftover cooked new potatoes from the other night, so dinner was cooked in a lot less than 10 mins!

recipes.title: Smoky Bacon Crumb
recipes.description: This is the best part on any salad cart right? Well now you can make it at home and sprinkle it liberally over soups, salads, risottos and pasta dishes for added texture and a hit of smoky bacon flavour.

recipes.title: Bacon Egg And Asparagus Brunch
recipes.description: Breakfast is the most important meal of the day... and at weekends you have time to enjoy it even more than usual. Bacon plays an big role in the standard cooked breakfast, whether it's a simple Bacon Sandwich or this slightly more impressive option.

recipes.title: Bacon And Leek Pasta Bake
recipes.description:
This is my go to dish on the days that I can't be bothered to get creative. The flavours are awesome... sweet leeks, smoky bacon and cheesy sauce with a very slight chilli kick... it's got it all going on.

The sauce is super simple too!

recipes.title: A Chocolate Duck Ice
recipes.description: Wow... Ben's been at it again... buying novelty bakeware off of the internet and desperately trying to come up with an idea to use it. Welcome to homemade brown bread ice cream inside of a tempered chocolate shell!

recipes.title: Spotted Dick
recipes.description: It's a traditional steamed pudding from the British Isles... promise! Served with an Earl Grey infused custard it's a proper family favourite and centre-piece desserts for everyone to help themselves to. Apologies in advance for the smirks... Barry finds the concept of a 'spotted dick' hilarious!

recipes.title: Red Pepper Filo Crunch Pie
recipes.description: Pies for some reason are considered to be notoriously tricky to make... but when you see our cheat for a pastry top that still gives you that satisfying golden crunch before getting into the tasty medley of Mediterranean veg and prawns... you'll wonder why you haven't tried this before.

recipes.title: Roasted Red Pepper Pesto
recipes.description:
It's fair to say most people understand what pesto is and can probably come up with a couple of decent ways to use one. But what if we were to change up the flavours in a pesto... that will lend itself to a host of new ideas. Our version substitutes pine nuts for pecan nuts and makes use of home roasted peppers rather than stacks of fresh basil. 

We serve it with Orzo pasta and wedges of fried aubergine.

recipes.title: Red Pepper And Chilli Jam
recipes.description: Make up a jar of this and it'll keep a while in the fridge. Use it to spread on burgers, to dunk chips into and it's ideal as a condiment for a cheese board.

recipes.title: Swedish Kladdkaka
recipes.description:
This cake is simple and delicious! 
It is a moist and almost brownie like cake. 
It is also called "Sticky Cake". 

I know it is a simple cake and a lot if people already have tried it but I really think it is important to get it right! 

Please try this recipe and I hope you will like it!

recipes.title: All Butter Croissants
recipes.description: If we're focussing on French recipes... then it would be criminal to overlook the humble croissant. Seen everywhere, all across France they are a pretty fundamental part of the the breakfast table. We show you how to get them right... it's not an easy or quick process... but it is worth giving it a go!

recipes.title: A Different Take On Chilli Con Carne
recipes.description: Whenever I make chilli I always cook a big batch and freeze it in small portions. Today I used one leftover portion with something other than just rice!

recipes.title: Apple And Berry Charlotte Puddings
recipes.description: When you bake bread into a dessert it transforms into something very special. Bread and butter pudding is the obvious example... but this charlotte pudding is heavenly. It's crammed with a mixture of apple and berries with a crisp golden cinnamon bread casing.

recipes.title: Italianstyle Panzanella Salad
recipes.description: This is a brilliant way to use up stale bread. Soggy bread salad might not sound that appetising... but you have to try it!

recipes.title: Lemon And Dill Breaded Goujons
recipes.description: Think of them like adult chicken nuggets! These fingers of chicken are coated in flavoured breadcrumbs and fried off to create an awesome little snack, finger food for  party or perfect in a packed lunch. Served with a mustard mayo there are always going to be a favourite.

recipes.title: Strawberry Roses
recipes.description: Learn how to create gorgeous roses from strawberries.

recipes.title: Ratatouille
recipes.description: All hail ratatouille! If you know the film then you'll know that a rodent knocks up a gorgeous signature dish inspired by a more traditional provencal recipe. This version is great for vegans and is perfect to share with family or friends as a main dinner or a side dish.

recipes.title: Lemon Olive And Caper Butter
recipes.description: This butter lends itself perfectly to fish... but with Mediterranean flavours can also be tossed into steaming hot pasta. Simple flavours... but boy do they work!

recipes.title: Rocket Walnut  Blue Cheese Butter
recipes.description: This butter is an awesome way to show-off and treat your friends and family if you have some decent cuts of steak to serve up. Blitz the butter up and serve it super soft at the table for people to help themselves too. A tablespoon also works nicely stirred through freshly mashed potato for something a bit special.

recipes.title: North African Butter
recipes.description: Not just another awesome flavour combo, but a nifty way of presenting it to make yourself look super pro. Plus, if you don't fancy lamb... then this works nicely spread onto a flatbread for a brilliant new take on garlic bread.

recipes.title: Pot Au Chocolat
recipes.description: An impressive looking dessert with perhaps two of the best flavours that the French love to combine with chocolate... coffee and hazelnut!

recipes.title: Eggs Benedict Bagel
recipes.description: Best not to mess with a favourite… this one uses eggs twice and is served in a bagel. The leftover egg yolks from our meringue are used to make a rich buttery hollandaise sauce and that’s drizzled over a toasted bagel with crispy bacon and a perfect poached egg.

recipes.title: Chicken And Sage Scotch Egg
recipes.description: Which came first... the chicken or the egg? Regardless, we're combining the two in this awesome scotch egg... served with what might sound unusual but is actually delicious... a mustard, cranberry sauce and mayo dip.

recipes.title: Spiced Apple Eton Mess
recipes.description: Creating individual mini meringues from sweetened egg whites and baking them crisp, but still with a slight chewy centre. Served with diced apples and autumnal berries (blackberries) mixed up with cream, a little calvados and your homemade meringue droplets. Topped with a scattering of pecans... this is a brilliant Autumnal version of the summer classic.

recipes.title: Zesty Crab Spaghetti
recipes.description: This is a neat little pasta dish that I like to treat myself to (even if it is just tinned crab) but also know it's perfect to impress if you have to throw something together. The kick of chilli, tang of lime and sweetness of the crab will quickly turn it into a favourite of yours too!

recipes.title: Homemade Vanilla Rice Pudding
recipes.description: Takes no time at all to get started, then bung it in the oven and let it cook whilst you concentrate on the main course. A hint of cinnamon and plenty of vanilla makes this rice pudding one of the best... and by using whole milk, it's super creamy!

recipes.title: Pommes Dauphinoise
recipes.description: Layers of thinly sliced potatoes baked in cream, egg, herbs and cheese.... served with a golden roasted whole chicken. This is the kind of family food that people get jealous of. A true French classic!

recipes.title: Chilli And Rosemary Polenta
recipes.description: A speedy vegetarian dish using chilli and rosemary infused milk that's transformed into creamy polenta as a bed for some pan-fried mushrooms. Proper comfort eating once the nights start drawing in again.

recipes.title: Iced Banoffee Milkshake
recipes.description: The trick of pre-freezing a bunch of banana chunks makes this a stupidly simple to throw together when you want one. Whether it is banoffee or in fact "banaramel" is still left to be decided.

recipes.title: Bombay Aloo
recipes.description: Whether you treat it as a side order or the real deal this blend of spices fried off in ghee and combined with the boiled and fried potatoes is tricky to beat.

recipes.title: Spinach Gnocchi
recipes.description: This Italian favourite is surprisingly easy to make... and fun too! The rolling, cutting and shaping of the dough can be done with family or friends. They look impressive, just don't let on how cheap they are to make either!

recipes.title: Pea And Ham Croquettes
recipes.description: Golden crisp breadcrumbs encasing soft mash rammed with the fresh summery and British flavours of minted pea and ham... now that is a croquette!

recipes.title: Duck A Lorange
recipes.description: Criticised now for being a cliché and associated with naff dinner parties from the 1970's in the UK we've decided it's worth reviving. This is our version of  brilliant duck dish to impress!

recipes.title: Corned Beef Hash
recipes.description: Tinned food isn't always bad... you can do some decent stuff with it... and this is the perfect example. If you're camping and can't keep things refrigerated then make the most of a couple of tins to knock up an awesome breakfast.

recipes.title: Easy Campfire Pancakes
recipes.description:
If you want pancakes for breakfast but you're not in a kitchen then you can still win! A little bit of prep before you leave home and you can have fresh pancakes made in minutes! 
Our little cheat of incorporating milk powder into the pancake mix means you only have to add eggs and water from outside camping!

recipes.title: Cookware Gets Sorted
recipes.description: What's the first thing you'll cook with your new cookware? :)

recipes.title: Maple And Walnut Flapjack
recipes.description: I made this a lot as a kid... But haven't done so for ages! Usually I go for honey in my flapjacks but thought I'd experiment with maple syrup... Deffo a winner!

recipes.title: Mean Chocolate Chip Cookie
recipes.description: This idea is not original to us (We can thank Meg Hourihan for that!)... but the recipe most certainly is. Well actually, not original to us (SORTED) but original to the 16 people who helped create it! By collecting recipes from a bunch of awesome cookies and instead of testing them all to find the best one... we combined them all to create the best one!

recipes.title: Shampoo Smoothies
recipes.description: You can get inspiration from all over the place... not just the kitchen, cookbooks or food markets. How about your bathroom or the toiletry isle of a supermarket? These 3 drinks are all inspired by shampoo flavours... what do you wash with and could it become a drink?

recipes.title: Mussels In Ale  On An Open Fire
recipes.description: Campfire food doesn't have to just be sausages and marshmallows on sticks... although they're pretty good too. Why not try some mussels cooked in a make shift and disposable saucepan of tin foil! The flavours of fennel, lemon and ale are really hearty too.

recipes.title: Trout On An Open Fire
recipes.description: One of the best things to cook on an open fire is fresh fish... it cooks quickly, tastes incredible and is not only healthy but pretty impressive looking. We went for rainbow trout and kept it really simple!

recipes.title: Salami And Spinach Orzo
recipes.description: When cooking over an open fire (on in fact in any kitchen with limited kitchen space or equipment) you want something without fuss. This is it in my books, loads of flavour... simple process... and just one pot.

recipes.title: Campfire Smore Cones
recipes.description: Everyone knows when you have an open fire you have to cook s'mores or at the very least marshmallows on sticks. These little treat take it up a gear... and make them super easy to cook/melt. You can even do them before leaving home if you like!

recipes.title: Caramel And Orange Eclairs
recipes.description:
This is homage to 2 separate sweet dishes from France. The eclair, which we know often becomes the vessel for countless delicious flavours and toppings and crepe suzette. Plus an impressive flambéed dessert often cooked at the table. 

When orange pastry cream meets caramel frosting and candied orange, all encased with crisp golden choux pastry you know you've yet French heaven!

recipes.title: Tomato And Chive Vinaigrette
recipes.description: This is a a dressing that packs a punch and is brilliant if tossed through beans, pasta or mixed salad, taking anything kind of basic to another level. Plus, make it in a jam jar and it'll keep for ages.

recipes.title: Vegetable Bean Chilli
recipes.description: This bean stew has brilliant depth of flavour from celery, carrot and bay leaves, a trio of beans (all bunged in from tins) and a sauce made simply from tomato juice and selection of dried spices. If there's any leftover, it makes amazing beans on toast the next day!

recipes.title: Tomato Juice Cake
recipes.description: If you like carrot cake, then the chances are you'll like this! A simple swap of grated carrot for sweet potato and substituting more typical orange juice for tomato juice makes this an awesome cake for afternoon tea!

recipes.title: Warm Tuna Salad
recipes.description: Okay... Not a lot to this one... Just a bunch of stuff pulled out of the fridge and thrown together... But oh boy it's good if you have really fresh tuna!

recipes.title: Vegan Pistachio And Dark Chocolate Fudge
recipes.description:
EyeCandy is back with a BANG!!

Don't let the sweet intro from the wonderful Alessandra fool you, we're about to shake you to your core with one of the most face-melting, grungiest recipes we've ever done!!

Only once you've recovered will we let you into a couple of secrets...

1) This is Alessandra's recipe that she uploaded to SORTEDfood, and it's amazing!  
2) It's vegan. BOOM! Didn't see that one coming, did you?

We can't thank 'thefoodieteen' enough for letting us show you her awesome vegan dark chocolate fudge recipe, we hope you like it as much as we do! Make sure you go follow her

Want your recipe or photo featured on eyeCandy? Upload your photos and recipes to SORTEDfood or share your images and videos with us using the hashtag **#eyecandysorted** on Twitter/Instagram/Facebook

recipes.title: 6 Superfoods Your Body Will Love
recipes.description:
We should all eat a varied and balanced diet but there are a few ingredients that are exceptionally good for you. Our mate Layla shows us some of the ones everybody's talking about right now... with the help of Jamie... in a Morph suit!

Be sure to check out more of Layla by following her on the app - @layla

What other super foods should we be using and how?

recipes.title: Orange Rum Pancakes
recipes.description:
This video is the epitome of a lazy weekend breakfast... the sun is shining through an open window and without a care in the world you're cooking up from gorgeous orange and gingerbread pancakes with yoghurt, fresh fruit and a little naughty kick of rum.

We'd love to say a massive thanks to Chockywoky for her recipe which sits art the heart of this video... Make sure you go follow her!

recipes.title: 7 Secrets To Perfect Pasta
recipes.description: Pasta is one of the humblest of ingredients... so comforting, yet so simple. We invited Michela and Romina from the Chiappa Sisters down to show us their secrets to making awesome pasta. Done properly... there is very little in this world that beats fresh, handmade pasta.

recipes.title: Red Velvet Oreo Brownie Bars
recipes.description: If you like Oreo cookies, chocolate brownies and red velvet cake then you'll love these... they are the best of all 3 and topped off with a silky smooth ganache they are incredible.

recipes.title: Quickest Pasta Ever
recipes.description:
The perfect 15 minute dinner, use whatever you have in the fridge... Veg, meats, fish etc.

The juices from the chorizo and cherry tomatoes make the perfect sauce... DELICIOUS!!

recipes.title: 5 Secrets To Better Cake Decorating
recipes.description:
When it comes to baking you'll need to follow recipes rather than attempt to make stuff up as you go along. But even then, these handy tips from Edd (aka TheBoyWhoBakes) help make the end result look as awesome as it tastes.

Go grab the buttercream recipe from his profile!

recipes.title: Fragrant Pilaf Rice
recipes.description: Sometime the rice dish can be as tasty as whatever you've cooked to go with it... This one is a bit like that! So good!

recipes.title: Banana Oat Pancakes
recipes.description: Easy and healthy

recipes.title: Aubergine Tommy Bake
recipes.description: My very basic italian bake to go with my Sea Bass ;)

recipes.title: Tequila Lollies With Lime Sherbet
recipes.description: I'm not sure anybody in the Sorted studio can stand a tequila slammer... and yet if we're out and have had one or two drinks they seem like a good idea. I took our love for the concept of tequila, lime and salt and combined it into a nostalgic sweet from our childhood... sherbet dippers. This was the result! Winner!

recipes.title: Ginger Pork Fried Rice
recipes.description: Looking for something simple, quick and filling to get you through the week? This Asian inspired dish uses suggestions from the community to put a sweet twist on this takeaway classic!

recipes.title: The Mexican Burger
recipes.description:
The Mexican Burger: a home-baked, fluffy and sweet cornbread bun encasing a bed of smoky and spiced black beans cooked in ham stock. On top sits slow-cooked, melt in the mouth, chilli brisket of beef topped with crunchy salty corn chips, fresh, tangy, chunky guacamole and a dollop of cooling sour cream. Served up with a side of sweet, spicy and crunchy corn.

We’re on a quest to find the internet’s ultimate burger and this suggestion came from top YouTuber and seriously handsome human being, Jim Chapman.
ingredients: 1 kg beef, brisket, chuck or shank (slow-cooked beef)
ingredients-original: 1 kg beef, brisket, chuck or shank (slow-cooked beef)

recipes.title: Baked Salmon Parcel With Lemon And Asparagus
recipes.description: Baking salmon in aluminum foil is a technique which helps trap the moisture inside the foil, preventing the salmon from drying out. It also makes it very easy to clean up :D

recipes.title: Pan Fried Honey Lemon Chicken
recipes.description: Sweet & sour sticky honey lemon chicken without the fuss of deep drying
ingredients: ½ tbsp chinese rice cooking wine
ingredients-original: ½ tbsp chinese rice cooking wine

recipes.title: Salmon Pho
recipes.description: This is a whole new level of awesome. Inspired by the brilliant recipe by @danger (go check out his profile!), we've made the most flamin' amazing salmon pho, and it tastes as good as it looks.

recipes.title: Caramelised White Chocolate Passion Fruit  Mango Cheesecake
recipes.description: The sweetness of the caramelised white chocolate balances out the tartness of the passionfruit.

recipes.title: The Sushi Burger
recipes.description:
The Sushi Burger: Crispy golden sushi rice ‘buns’ flavoured with the sweetness of mirin sandwich fresh tuna and wasabi patties. Ribbons of crunchy and vibrant rice wine vinegar pickled cucumber and radish turn these sliders into a mouthwatering 'LA meets Japan'-inspired burger. Finished with a drizzle of a salty orange and soy glaze and plenty of tangy citrus yuzu mayo, these sliders will definitely take some beating.

We’re on a quest to find the internet’s ultimate burger and this suggestion came from top YouTuber and seriously handsome human being, Fleur De Force.

Go check out our chat with Fleur that inspired this burger over at BurgerQuest 

Is this your ultimate burger? If so, rate it to let us know!

recipes.title: Strawberry Raspberry Banana Ice Cream
recipes.description: Dairy, gluten and sugar free!

recipes.title: Elderflower Turkish Delight
recipes.description: The sticky, soft, chewy sweet is usually incredibly floral with the flavours of rose water or orange blossom... but our version takes a green twist with Pandan extract and elderflower. Whether you know of it from Narnia or street markets and stalls across Europe and North Africa... when dusted in icing sugar and cornflour everybody want a square!

recipes.title: Chocolate Sheet Cake
recipes.description: This chocolate treat will be sure to tantalise your tastebuds. With an ump-ta-haws ganache topping, and crunchy honey-roasted pecans, this is one cake you need to try!

recipes.title: The Hellabig Burger
recipes.description:
A black pepper and fresh thyme criss-cross baked jacket potato forms the burger ‘bun’ here. This lacto-free and bread free burger is not for the faint-hearted! An impressively-sized beef burger seasoned with mustard powder and draped with a sunny side up fried egg sits in between. To cut through the richness enjoy slices of juicy beef tomato, some homemade cider vinegar pickled red onions infused with star anise, cloves and peppercorns and a generous dollop of creamy dill mayonnaise. You may need a knife and fork… but you sure won’t want to leave any on the plate! It's elegantly trashy!

We’re on a quest to find the internet’s ultimate burger and this suggestion came from top YouTuber and all round brilliant creator, Grace Helbig

recipes.title: Burger Cupcakes
recipes.description: Following two requests from Mitchell Davis we thought we'd have a go at combining both. Barry couldn't manage it alone, so with the rest of the team away James stepped up to the plate and delivered this beauty!
ingredients: 2 piping bags buttercream (coloured red and yellow)
ingredients-original: 2 piping bags buttercream (coloured red and yellow)

recipes.title: Figs And Ricotta
recipes.description: A super simple dessert, and the thyme and ricotta mean that it's not too sweet!

recipes.title: Glazed Smoked Pork Ribs
recipes.description: Smoky, sweet, sticky and sexy. What more could you want from your pork ribs? This incredible piece of Eyecandy was inspired by portrait_cook. Go follow him!

recipes.title: The Allamerican Burger
recipes.description: All conjured up for Chester See... A soft brioche bun, glazed with maple and finished with bacon crumb holds the all American burger. 100% home-ground beef seasoned with salt and pepper is shaped into a 1/2 pounder, and topped with a duo of molten and oozing Monterey Jack and blue cheese as well as three rashers of crispy streaky bacon. All this is cleverly balanced out by fresh raw red onion rings, oak leaf lettuce and lashings of homemade tangy and sour chive ranch dressing. To hold it together it’s spiked with a skewer, but not any old skewer, one laden with 3 crispy, golden southern fried peppers.

recipes.title: Pear Cider Braised Pork Shoulder
recipes.description: A comforting version of meat and two veg. Fennel seed, paprika and lemon rubbed shoulder braised in pear cider... Served with cheesy mash and roasted roots!

recipes.title: Macaron Burger
recipes.description: Burger with a sweet twist. Patty - dark chcolate ganache/ cheese - mango lime curd/ lettuce - white chocolate/ tomato sauce - strawberry balsamic vinegar jam.

recipes.title: Ultimate Grilled Cheese Sandwich
recipes.description: We've made the most perfect grilled cheese sandwich. You'll never have a toastie like it. By far the best recipe on the internet thanks to the homemade bread, two types of cheese and a herby, mustardy kick. Go out and buy the ingredients right now and create this melted mess.

recipes.title: The Mac N Cheese Burger
recipes.description:
This towering stack is best shared!!! 

At the base is a battered and deep-fried slice of creamy, cheesy macaroni pasta. A dollop of spicy homemade tomato and eggplant ketchup is spread upon the base and topped with ample fresh peppery rocket leaves. Next, strips of juicy chicken thigh meat slowly braised in pepsi, smoked paprika, garlic and onions, then shaped and rolled in bacon breadcrumbs before deep-frying for a crispy coating. Another battered macaroni slice completes this monstrosity. Rhett's has added cheese (as if there wasn't already enough) and plenty of fiery heat from red chillies and sriracha.

recipes.title: Smoked Salmon Canape
recipes.description: One of three beautifully simple canapé ideas that we suggest you create this festive season to wow your friends and family... just don't let them know how easy they are to make.

recipes.title: Duck Pate On Bagel Croutes
recipes.description: Making the most of a pre-made ingredient like a pate and transforming it into a neat liltle canapé is smart... but using other tricks like a bagel to cut out the rounds makes it even easier!
ingredients: 100 g duck and ruby port paté
ingredients-original: 100 g duck and ruby port paté

recipes.title: Festive Baked Camembert
recipes.description: This ones seconds to prepare and then simply bung it into an oven minutes before you want to serve it. With cheese straws, crudités and drinks on the side it's the perfect start to any meal or party.
ingredients: 1 selection of cheese straw and crudités
ingredients-original: 1 selection of cheese straw and crudités

recipes.title: Dark Chocolate Baileys Tart
recipes.description: Simple, rich and smooth. There are a couple of variations on the ganache for those who don't want the added sugar or the alcohol.

recipes.title: Bloody Mary Burger
recipes.description: A lightly toasted english muffin stands proudly on the plate topped with a spoonful of tangy vodka and tomato braised onions. Above this nestles a vodka flambéed double stack of beef patties seasoned heavily with Worcestershire sauce and celery salt, sandwiching slices of oozing cheese. Topped with pickled matchsticks of crunchy celery and plenty of hot and fiery Tabasco and chive mayonnaise capped with the lid of the toasted muffin. With a chilled glass of Bloody Mary on the side this’ll get your day off to a proper start!

recipes.title: 9 Fun Fondant Facts
recipes.description: Our friend Elise from MyCupcakeAddiction came all the way from Australia to give us some fantastic tips for how to work with fondant.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Biscotti
recipes.description: In preparation for Thanksgiving we give you an awesome recipe for Pumpkin Biscotti that was showcased on SortedFood by @will_fett and Ben gets a helping hand from Barry Lewis!

recipes.title: Toblerone Brownies
recipes.description: These brownies are simple to whip up and have the gorgeous taste of Toblerone!

recipes.title: Aprs Ski Sliders Beatmyburger
recipes.description:
Everything I love about Apres Ski in a burger. 
Flour Bun, Potato Rosti, French Saucisson, German Wurst, Swiss Emmental Cheese and a Fried Egg

recipes.title: The Spanish Burger Beatmyburger
recipes.description: I’ve taken some of my favourite parts of Spanish cuisine and shoved them into a burger… Is it traditional? No way, Jose! Is it delicious? It’s muy bueno amigo!!
ingredients: ½ bottle sangria (rioja is a great replacement!)
ingredients-original: ½ bottle sangria (rioja is a great replacement!)

recipes.title: The Nyc Bagel Burger Beatmyburger
recipes.description: I love New York City. I LOVE a good bagel sandwich, so I've taken classic flavours and added a proper freshly ground steak burger into the mix. Heaven!

recipes.title: Festive Carrot Cake With White Chocolate Frosting
recipes.description: Over the weekend we're cooking up this recipe in the Super Theatre at the BBC Good Food Show in Birmingham. It's really simple, especially when you use the Kenwood Chef Sense, but a few little festive twists make all the difference.
ingredients: 170 g flour (50:50 ratio of Self raising & Wholemeal)
ingredients-original: 170 g flour (50:50 ratio of Self raising & Wholemeal)

recipes.title: The Hot Dog Burger
recipes.description: The base of a crusty white roll glazed and baked with egg white for the extra shine kick starts this German-inspired burger. Next up plenty of German mustard-spiked sour cream and then the star of the burger... the flattened German pork meatball spiced with flavours from the classic Lebkuchen biscuit and covered in schnitzel-style golden fried breadcrumbs. Topped with slithers of grilled salami, then raw crunchy red cabbage followed by tangy sauerkraut. Before the lid of the shiny roll, the burger is completed with a split, char-grilled Bavarian frankfurter and sweet caramelised onions.

recipes.title: Chocolate Panettone Pudding
recipes.description:
This is one of the most comforting Christmassy desserts ever! And, better still, we constructed it using ingredients left over from our Xmas shoot. 

If you don't get too distracted by Mike in the background then you'll love it!

recipes.title: Soft  Chewy Vegan Bars
recipes.description: Sugar-free, gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free!
ingredients: ¾ cup gluten free rolled oats
ingredients-original: ¾ cup gluten free rolled oats

recipes.title: Butter Chicken
recipes.description:
I'll be honest, anything more than a whisper of chilli and my eyes are sweating and I'm grasping the nearest litre pot of yoghurt. It's probably no surprise then that I love butter chicken (or if you're feeling more exotic, "Murgh Makhani"). 

This recipe is mild in heat but packed with flavour in the rich, creamy sauce.

recipes.title: Figs In Blankets
recipes.description: A beautifully alternative to mini sausages wrapped in bacon for your Christmas table... a talking point this year.

recipes.title: Cranberry  Orange Pork Stuffing
recipes.description: This festive flavour combo for your stuffing is a sure fire winner. Make plenty of them because we know that people will be coming back for seconds!

recipes.title: Herby Roast Potatoes
recipes.description: Everybody has there favourite part of a roast dinner... but from meal to meal you'll mix up the veg options, the meat, the stuffing flavours and the sauces... but the one thing that stay consistent are the roast potatoes... so make sure you get them right!

recipes.title: Cumin And Honey Roasted Roots
recipes.description: Three hardy robust root veg all roasted up with the additional of a little honey and cumin. What's easy about these is you can prep them way in advance and not have to worry until the last minute!

recipes.title: Rosemary  Garlic Peas
recipes.description: A bag of peas straight out of the freezer is an awesome option for veg. Quick, simple and always to hand. With just a few added flavours though, these become a brilliant part of your Christmas feast.

recipes.title: Sauted Shredded Sprouts
recipes.description: Sprouts are a Christmas must... as important as the crackers you pull at the table. Yet, they might not be everyones favourite. So disguise them like this and people will be piling them onto their plates!

recipes.title: The Veggie Burger
recipes.description: This gorgeous vegetarian burger begins with a soft, freshly baked sourdough roll and then we spread on plenty of zesty chickpea hummus blitzed up with toasted sesame oil. The pattie itself is a spiced and herby sweet potato falafel and nestled on top of that is a split roasted red romano pepper filled with oozing goats cheese. For the fresh, healthy crutch to top the burger we offer a tossed salad made with julienne of tomato, yellow pepper and onion, lightly dressing in lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil and picked leaves of coriander.

recipes.title: Homemade Oreo Cookies
recipes.description: Makes 25 to 30 sandwich cookies

recipes.title: Stained Glass Cookies
recipes.description: Here's a treat for you... Jamie starts to decorate the studio and Ben bakes up a few cookies to hang on the tree. What could possibly go wrong!?!

recipes.title: Prawn Pie With Spinach  Ricotta Potato Top
recipes.description: A very different approach to fish pie... A few frozen, shelled prawns thrown into a quick tomato and red pepper sauce. Topped with a combo of half mashed potato and half spinach and ricotta mix that I had leftover from some tortellini! Pretty decent for a Sunday eve!

recipes.title: Cookie Dough Ice Cream Sundae
recipes.description: This is unbelievable... all the naughty elements made from scratch and compiled into one sundae glass.

recipes.title: Ginger Snap Hot Chocolate
recipes.description: Want to take a hot chocolate to another level? Give this a go... infused with ginger and served separately for the drinker to mix themselves it's a seriously indulgent treat.

recipes.title: Microwave Foolproof Chewy Caramels
recipes.description: easy, delicious caramels with a foolproof recipe.. what more could you want? (delicious dipped in chocolate!)

recipes.title: Chocolate Peanutbutter Cheesecake Bars
recipes.description: This fast, no bake, easy dessert is a quick way to cure anybody's sweet tooth!

recipes.title: Mulled Wine Trifle
recipes.description: Trifle is a solid family favourite, but you might not always associate it with Christmas... until now. With mulled wine jelly, Panettone bread and a cherry and chocolate custard this is simple, yet divine.

recipes.title: Pear Cranberry  White Chocolate Crumble
recipes.description: If traditional Christmas pudding isn't your thing then make something more classic and familiar all year round, but just use festive flavours. Pear and cranberry crumble with other flavours of white chocolate, ginger and star anise.

recipes.title: Mince Pie Ice Cream
recipes.description: Whether you make this using up leftover mince pies or specifically for the big day itself you won't be disappointed. It's so simple... but a bowl of this will always go down a treat!

recipes.title: Chicken Pot Pie
recipes.description: This is one hell of a pie. A creamy, winey sauce with colourful veg and succulent chicken under a layer of crispy, herby puff pastry. Comfort food 101. This recipe will also teach you how to make chicken stock and how to make white sauce, both of which will be helpful in tonnes of dishes.

recipes.title: Kung Pao Chicken
recipes.description: Super super simple, but really good classic Chinese take-away dish.
ingredients: 1 lb Boneless Chicken Breast/Thigh (cut into 1" pieces)
ingredients-original: 1 lb Boneless Chicken Breast/Thigh (cut into 1" pieces)

recipes.title: Smores Cookies
recipes.description:
Recipe from bbcgoodfood.com
Modified for a bit for marshmallow and chocolate chunk topping.

recipes.title: Turkey Bhuna Curry
recipes.description: Wondering what to do with those Turkey Leftovers? Want to up your game and side step the turkey sandwich this year? Then we have an awesomely spiced turkey bhuna curry served with fragrant rice and a a fruity mango raita for you. Leftover scraps of turkey have never tasted so good!

recipes.title: Flavoured Salts
recipes.description: Giving away food gifts at Christmas is always a nice touch... something personal that you've taken the time to make. So often they are sweet ideas, but these salts are a perfect savoury option... great for any foodie!

recipes.title: Sweet Cherry Pie
recipes.description: This classic cherry pie has the usual SORTED twist, as suggested by the community, to really make it stand out from the crowd. The only problem? One pie is simply never enough!

recipes.title: Lemon And Poppy Seed Pretzels
recipes.description: We saw a brilliant photo of some pretzels uploaded to the app by Evie Wayne (eviewayne) and thought we'd give some a go ourselves. We went for sweet sticky ones with added poppy seed for flavour!

recipes.title: Vegan Blueberry And Lemon Cheesecake Bars
recipes.description:
bottom layer: caramel 
middle layer: blueberry
top layer: lemon cheesecake

recipes.title: Stufffing Sausage Rolls
recipes.description: A homemade gourmet sausage roll for a Xmas house party. Pork sausage meat with added thyme, cranberry and Wensleydale cheese.
ingredients: 1 pack of ready rolled puff pastry
ingredients-original: 1 pack of ready rolled puff pastry

recipes.title: Get Well Soup  Sweet Potato Chilli  Coconut
recipes.description:
When I'm ill all I seem to want is soup... so why not pack it with immune system boosting, vitamin rich foods? 

Sweet Potato - packed with vitamin C (an antioxidant, and vital in regular body function) and vitamin A (good for eye, skin and bone health).

Coconut - full of 'lauric acid' (a good fat) with antibacterial and antiviral properties! 

Chilli - contains 'capsaicin', an anti-inflammatory that stimulates blood flow and opens up the sinuses. 

Full recipe (and science) on the blog. Link in bio!
ingredients: 600 g sweet potato, peeled and chopped into equal sized pieces

recipes.title: Seasoned London Broil
recipes.description: Let’s talk about the cut referred to as “London Broil” for a little bit. Back in the day, flank steaks (taken from the abdomen of the cow) were prepared using a method called “London Broil” (marinated and broiled). Over time, stores started referring to the cut itself as “London Broil”, and then started to use that label for top sirloin (from the cow’s rear end) and top round (from the cow’s hind legs) cuts as well. Today, you’ll find all of these cuts labeled as “London Broil”, but rest assured that this recipe will work well for any of those three cuts.

It's crusty and crunchy on the outside and cheewy on the inside. Basicly the best thing ever. If you'd like to give this a go, manioc starch can be found in any natural food markets, whole foods or even online! Or, you could try and use all tapioca flour instead. You won't regret it ;)

Believe it or not, the flavors are rather delicate, nothing overpowers anything here. At first, you get the deep chocolate, than the basil hits you little by little, just to leave you with the fruity olive oil and amazing texture from the nuts. This is a keeper, guys.

recipes.title: Hoddeok Korean Sugar Pancakes
recipes.description:
Hoddeok, or hotteok, is a popular Korean street snack that’s made out of balls of 
yeasty dough stuffed with a mixture of brown sugar, nuts and cinnamon. It's cooked in a way so that the outside is brown and crispy while inside the sugar melts and mixes with the cinnamon to flood and coat each pieces of nut - which essentially makes every bite of it incredibly…well, I don’t even have the word for it. You’ll just have to make some and experience it yourself. Just be careful not to burn your lips while eating it.

recipes.title: Pistachio No Churn Ice Cream
recipes.description: Ok, who here doesn't have an ice cream machine? I know, me neither. Buuut, this week's challenge on our blog (link in bio) was #GameofCones and the point was to share a ice cream recipe/photo with an ice cream cone. I didn't have any ice cream cones, though haha But I did have an ice cream recipe to share! The texture is pretty similar to a regular ice cream, maybe a little more buttery and heavy, but just as delicious. And oh-so-much-easier-to-make. I added some ginger and black pepper to this because I am me and I am a sucker for weird flavor combos. You don't really taste them, but you just feel that little heat on the back of your throat, which complements the pistachio flavor beautifully.
ingredients: 100 g Pistachios, shelled and salted (if you're using unsalted, just add about 1/2 tsp of salt to the mixture)

We tried New England style ones, Manhattan Style versions and even a mix of the two. But our favourite was the one served up to us at  Hog Island Oyster Co. It's rich, indulgent and unbelievable. recipes.title: Pumpkin And Macadamia Olive Oil Tart
recipes.description: I'll be honest to you all, that recipe wasn't what I had in mind. But I had to adapt my initial idea to whatever I had on hand, since I wanted a dessert for Mother's Day, last week. It's not the most delicious thing I have ever done in my life, but it's also worth sharing the recipe. The olive oil crust was definately a discovery, it's much easier to make than the butter version, and it's just as flacky. Also, if you don't like/don't have pumpkin, you can totally substitute it for berries or any stone fruit you like, and it might turn out even better than this one ;)
ingredients: 2 tbsp Water/milk (I made with water and it turned out just fine)
635 g Sugar pumpkin (for the brazilians out there, I used Abóbora Menina or Paulista)
2 tsp Ground cinnamon (or 1 big cinnamon stick)
100 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.

recipes.title: Vietnamese Coffee Cake Coffeefreaks
recipes.description: Have you ever tried a Vietnamese style coffee? See, think about heaven. Double that. That's what it is! Basically, it's freshly brewed coffee with condensed milk. I mean, if you never tried it, you are in for a huuuge treat, my friend, especially if you are a crazy coffee lover, like I am. That being said, it was my turn to come up with this week's challenge on our blog (link in bio), so I chose to go for my oh-so-needed coffee, and made this coffee cake with a coffee brigadeiro (hence the condensed milk) on top. I also added a bit of cardamom to the batter, because I'm nosy and I love the cardamom and coffee combo, but you can leave it out if you want (although, I really don't reccomend you to hehe). This cake is moist, full of strong flavours and crazy addictive. Dangerous stuff here, people ;)
ingredients: 1/2 tsp Ground cardamom (or a little less, if you're not used to the flavor)
3 tbsp Instant coffee, grounded into a fine powder
113 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.
3 tbsp Strongly brewed coffee (I used some homemade cold brew)
ingredients-original: 1/2 tsp Ground cardamom (or a little less, if you're not used to the flavor)
3 tbsp Instant coffee, grounded into a fine powder
113 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.
3 tbsp Strongly brewed coffee (I used some homemade cold brew)

recipes.description:
The crawfish boil we experienced in New Orleans at the house of Jordon and her family was easily in the top 5 most social food experiences ever... and that's saying a lot... there have been so many. 

This is my version... taking all the tips that Shaggy (The Crawfish King) shared with us and using the flavours in the broth that he did (minus the sausage to keep it meat-free and fit for pescetarians). If you can get fresh, live crawfish then absolutely do, they are phenomenal... but if they're tricky to get hold where you live (like they are in the UK) then use shrimp.

recipes.title: Coconut Custard W Strawberry And Thyme
recipes.description: So, I posted a picture on instagram a few days ago of this gorgeous little dessert, and I got a few likes, so I thought I would share it here. The recipe itself is basically a simple custard made with coconut milk, and served with a delicious strawberry and thyme jam/sauce (more like a sauce, really). The flavors go really, really well together, and the creamy richness of the coconut gives the perfect contrast to the bright strawberry flavor (which, by the way, you can substitute for any other berry you like. I bet blackberries would be amazing here). This dessert is simple, easy to make, and elegant enough to serve in any last minute dinner. Also, throw the chilled mixture into an ice cream machine, and you'll probably get a bomb coconut ice cream. Just saying ;)
ingredients: 200 ml Whole milk (or just more coconut milk)
3 tbsp Granulated sugar (more or less, depending on how sweet you'd like it to be)
1 tsp Dried thyme (or the leaves of about one sprig of the fresh)
2 tbsp Granulated sugar (more or less, depending on how sweet you'd like it to be)
ingredients-original: 200 ml Whole milk (or just more coconut milk)

recipes.title: Apple Banana And Apricot Crumble
recipes.description: Last week, miss Christin (@itin) was the one who came up with the week's challenge in our blog (link in bio). The hashtag was #fruityparadise, where we could make anything using whatever fruits were in season. It's winter here, but apples and bananas are always on the shelves, so I thought a crumble was appropriate. Dried apricots are boiled to keep a soft texture in the oven, while everything else comes to life with a hint of cinnamon. This dish is healthy enough to serve as a breakfast, with a dollop of yogurt, and yet, indulgent enough to be a dessert, alongside a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

recipes.title: Sesame Seed And Cardamom Oat Cookies
recipes.description: It's been a while since I shared a cookie recipe, so I thought this would be appropriate hehe I've been a bit naughty with my food lately, mostly because I'm always testing new recipes (btw, you should check out my other profile @sweetandspice to see what me and Sam have been up to lately ;D). So I decided to be a bit healthier, this time. This time. These cookies are soft, nutty and they have a lovely hint of spice, coming from the addition of cardamom. They are also easily customizable, could be veganized or even made gluten-free, if you are into that stuff. A perfectly healthy, sweet snack, aside of a cup of tea.
ingredients: 70 g Butter, unsalted and room temp. (you can use coconut oil too)
3 tbsp Honey (or maple syrup, agave, brown sugar, coconut sugar...)
2 to 3 tbsp Whole wheat flour (or buckwheat flour, almond flour, gluten free flour..)
2 heaping tbsp Toasted sesame seeds (if you can't find toasted, just do it yourself on a dry skillet and medium heat, until they are fragrant)
1/2 tsp Ground cardamom (more or less, depending on how strong you'd like the flavor to be)
ingredients-original: 70 g Butter, unsalted and room temp. (you can use coconut oil too)

recipes.title: Dolce Latte No Churn Ice Cream
recipes.description: Laura - Since Sammy told me his favorite ice cream flavor was Dolce Latte, I knew I had to come up with a way of making it. However, I got no ice cream machine -.- Soooo, no churn it is! But first, I need to point out a few things: Sam made this using British clotted cream, and it turned out a bit too creamy for his liking. Sooo, if you are making this and using clotted cream, he suggests using about 1/4 cup of water to the mix, just to add some ice to the texture. I made mine with just cream and it was just fine, so if you are using regular heavy cream, leave the water out. Regardless, this ice cream is freaking delicious, and I am so not eating a bowl of it while writing this.... you can't prove anything ¬¬
ingredients: 397 g Dolce latte (also known as dulce de leche, you can either make your own by cooking a can of condensed milk or use a store bought one)
2 tbsp Tequila, or any other alcoholic drink that you think that could work here
ingredients-original: 397 g Dolce latte (also known as dulce de leche, you can either make your own by cooking a can of condensed milk or use a store bought one)

recipes.title: Brazilian Style Cornbread Bolo De Fub
recipes.description: I know that Cornbread is popular around the world for being more of a neutral cake, sweet from the corn, but also eaten with savory food. And, don't get me wrong, I love that cornbread. But here in Brazil, we do it kinda differently. Sprinkled with  a good dose of cinnamon sugar, this light and fluffy cake brings me back to so many good childhood memories, the slight crumb coming from the corn flour, also called Fubá here, which is a bit less coarse than regular corn flour, gives this cake that unique texture, that only a good Cornbread can provide.
ingredients: 1 cup Corn flour (or Fubá, if you're brazilian)
4 Eggs, separated into yolks and whites
ingredients-original: 1 cup Corn flour (or Fubá, if you're brazilian)

recipes.title: White Chocolate And Passion Fruit Mousse
recipes.description: Laura - Sam and I were debating about this week's dessert, we knew it had to be anything with chocolate in it, but it took us a good while to figure out what. Then we finally settled for a mousse, Sam made a dark chocolate one, and I did this, mostly because he loves passion fruit ;) We did use a different method, though. No eggs and no heavy cream. Just chocolate and... water! "Say what?? Laura, are you mental??" No, I'm not. Yet. It's a very quick dessert, it really does look just like a mousse and it tastes incredible! I topped with strawberries because I liked the color contrast, and it does give a nice tangy taste to it, but you can top it with whatever you like, I bet any berry would be really good. Enjoy ;)
ingredients: 1/4 cup Passion fruit juice (fresh or store bought, up to you)
toppings of choice (berries, more white chocolate, whipped cream, passion fruit..)

recipes.title: Triple Chocolate Mocha Cookies
recipes.description: Laura - Oh-ma-gawhd. Words seriously cannot describe how good these cookies were. Sammy and I made those in an afternoon, like we always do with most of our recipes, talking over messages and guiding each other through it. We both agreed that those cookies were freaking heaven. The slight touch of coffee in the batter elevates these to a whole new level of cookie-greatness (Yes. This is a term in my vocabulary). The addition of 3 types of chocolate makes those even more indulgent and, as you can see, I totally made an ice cream sandwich with them. 'Cause I'm greedy like that (right, Sammy? hehe).
