recipes.title: Orange And Brazil Nut Upside Down Cake
recipes.description: Soooo I've been a little MIA here, because my winter break is over (and so is my happiness T.T) and my time got shorter, however, this is a recipe that I wanted to share anyway. If you follow me, you know a have a recipe for a Dark Chocolate, Basil and Brazil Nut Olive Oil Cake, which is pretty amazing, but I wanted to give it a bit of a twist. An orange caramel is made to serve as a bed for the orange wedges, and a bit of the zest is added to the cake, just to give that extra fruity hint. This cake is simple and delicious, served with a dollop of yogurt on the side.

recipes.title: Strawberry And Cashew Nut Cake
recipes.description: Laura - A few days ago, before Sabby went to work in France, we decided to test this cake recipe. It turned out pretty bad for both of us ;) hahaha So I decided to make a few changes. This is a recipe with no fuss at all. I used honey as the sweetner, but you can totally swap it for regular granulated sugar, or even brown sugar. Don't wanna use strawberries? Use other berries, or use chocolate. Don't have cashews? Use another nut flour! (Brazil nut is pretty good in this, btw). Be creative, and I'm sure it'll come out delicious, anyway. Enjoy!
ingredients: 200 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.
3/4 cup Cashew nut flour (make your own by blending a few cashew nuts on the food processor, or a blender)
1/4 tsp Baking soda (only use this if you decide to use the honey, otherwise, you can leave it out)
6 Fresh strawberries, sliced in half (you might need more or less, depending on the size)
ingredients-original: 200 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.

recipes.title: No Bake Coconut Cake
recipes.description: Cocoa biscuit base, creamy coconut filling, chocolate in the middle, what more do you need? I found the recipe on likechocolate.net, thought it was worth sharing.

recipes.title: Baked Cheesecake
recipes.description: One of the all time classic New York desserts is a baked vanilla cheesecake. It's a struggle to find one as authentic and good as those from across the pond. But if you want to try to recreate it then here's our version.

recipes.title: Beef And Ale Stew
recipes.description: Looking for a real winter warmer? A great traditional British dish that requires minimal effort, other than planning ahead and sticking it in the oven nice and early. Simple, cheap and tasty recipe. What more do you want?

recipes.title: Alexas Cookies
recipes.description: This is the basic cookie dough recipe we shared with Alexa for the video where we went on to make literally millions of varieties!

recipes.title: Chia Seed Breakfast Bowl
recipes.description: In each Mystery Box Challenge, Rennie delivers a slightly obscure ingredient and, with your help, we conjure up an awesome recipe to celebrate the ingredient. This time... an awesome fruit that we combine with a great breakfast idea that you guys have been begging us to make. Perhaps one of the easiest recipes we’ve done… but the addition of our mystery ingredient takes it to another level... An amazing level!!. Have a watch to find out what the surprise twist is and how we get on!

recipes.title: Beef Stew And Spinach Dumplings
recipes.description:
Welcome to another awesome Rennie Mystery Box Challenge!

This video contains a paid for promotion, but that’s not the mystery ingredient!  This recipes warms you right through to your bones… a rich and comforting stew with fluffy, green dumplings. Watch to find out what the mystery ingredient is and how we get on!

recipes.title: The Original Chocolate Cake In A Mug
recipes.description: Baking a chocolate pudding can conjure up images of effort, time and mess... This no-bake recipe can be ready in minutes, creates no mess and is the perfect snack to snuggle up to in front of the TV on cold winter evenings. That's cake in a mug SORTED!

recipes.title: Tropical Pannacotta Cup
recipes.description: In each Mystery Box Challenge, Rennie delivers an unusual ingredient and, with your help on Twitter, we conjure up an awesome recipe to make the most of it! This time… an ingredient that really has the wow factor. If you’ve never seen it before… it’s hard to believe what’s inside of the outer casing. We transform it into something so delicious and striking that you’ll think it’s almost alien! Does it sound like we’re exaggerating? Watch and find out!

recipes.title: Healthy Brownies
recipes.description: Taste like regular brownies, but a little bit healthier.

recipes.title: Pasta Carbonara
recipes.description: Carbonara is the one of the UK's favourite Italian dishes. It's delicious, yet can cost a fortune in a restaurant. When you know how simple it is to make you'll wonder why you don't make it at home more often.

recipes.title: Tempura Prawns With Sweet Chilli
recipes.description: This is the Internet - the home of prawn, so I thought to myself "why not combine it with food" VOILA!!

recipes.title: Durian Chocolate Cheesecake
recipes.description: This recipe was one we were a little scared of. The fruit we found in the box looked prehistoric and is definitely not the kind of thing we’re used to cooking with… and yet the cheesecake we created with your help is more than enough to catch your eye and your tastebuds! Watch to find out what it is and how we get on!

recipes.title: Caribbean Bananas
recipes.description: Enjoying a summer BBQ and want to finish off with an exotic fruity dessert that screams out sunshine?

recipes.title: Ice Cream Sandwich
recipes.description: This refreshing treat has just the right balance of crumbly chocolatey biscuit and sharp creamy lemon curd ice cream. The ice cream will keep for ages if you can stop yourself from eating it!

recipes.title: Lemon Pots
recipes.description: Proper simple and delicious food! Love it!

recipes.title: Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
recipes.description: If you've got a veggie mate coming round for dinner but don't want to have to do two separate things, then this is spot on. A great vegetarian option for everyone to enjoy... you can even chuck on some bacon if you like.

recipes.title: Grilled Mackerel  Fresh Corn Salsa
recipes.description: I picked up some fresh fish (went in for trout, got what I wanted, but couldn't resist the mackerel too) and this is what happened!

recipes.title: Ferrero Rocher Ice Cream
recipes.description: Wow! Everything you love about the awesome chocolate treat... hazelnuts, nutella, wafer, chocolate... plus the one thing the treat is missing... ICE CREAM! That makes our version better right? ;)

recipes.title: Lime And White Chocolate Scones
recipes.description: YAAASS! I finally found time to bake!! hehe My life has been a little crazy, lately, in so many levels, that I simply didn't have the energy, or the mood, to bake anything. These scones brought me back to life (I know, so dramatic...). I was never a huuuuge fan of white chocolate, I've always found it too sweet for my taste, but when paired with something acidic, it just reaches that balance of flavors that I always look for when I eat a dessert. I added rye flour to the dough, because I adore the earthy flavor that it gives, but feel free to use any other flour you have on hand. Or if you don't have a lime, feel free to use lemon or an orange, skip the white chocolate, add fruits, nuts, whatever you like. It's a simple, quick and semi-healthy recipe, definitely worth making again.
ingredients: 1 cup Rye flour (or any other flour you have)
112 g Unsalted butter, very cold and diced
Handful of chopped white chocolate (about 60g or so), feel free to use chocolate chips
Egg wash (1 egg beaten with a tbsp of milk) or heavy cream extra sugar to sprinkle on top
ingredients-original: 1 cup Rye flour (or any other flour you have)
112 g Unsalted butter, very cold and diced
Handful of chopped white chocolate (about 60g or so), feel free to use chocolate chips
Egg wash (1 egg beaten with a tbsp of milk) or heavy cream extra sugar to sprinkle on top

recipes.description: Chicken Kiev, originating from the capital of Ukraine, is a gorgeous dish that as kids we've grown up with... although usually pre-prepared. But here we've deconstructed the classic chicken dish to make it easier without losing all of the best bits.

recipes.title: Chicken Satay
recipes.description: Day to day life is full of shortcuts and the kitchen is no exception. If you want a tasty Malaysian dish that makes use of a few cheeky shortcuts then this chicken satay is for you.

recipes.description: Fed up of the washing up and want good rustic full on flavour without a mountain of dirty dishes?

recipes.description: This is a brilliant dish that can be cooked up in no time at all. It's a hearty and filling meal that doesn't cost the earth. Treat yourself to some good quality sausages though... it'll still be a much cheaper meal than a prime cut of meat.

recipes.title: Chicken Salli
recipes.description: If I go to an Indian restaurant this is what I'm having. No questions!

recipes.title: Maple Pecan Pears
recipes.description: Struggling to get your five a day? Then why not use dessert as an excuse for another portion. This is a quick, simple suggestion that tastes as good as it sounds, all based around the humble pear.

recipes.title: Brown Sugar Brownies
recipes.description: This is one of my grandmother's recipes. She loved brownies, but couldn't eat chocolate, so this is a modified version of the treat using brown sugar. They're super simple to make and everyone always loves them! I could eat a whole pan in one sitting. :)
ingredients: 454 lb dark brown sugar (one box in US)
ingredients-original: 454 lb dark brown sugar (one box in US)

recipes.title: Lazy Satay Style Curry
recipes.description: This is proper comfort food for me... Easy to throw together, uses mainly ingredients from the cupboard or in jars and makes enough for me to freeze batches and have 'curry-in-a-hurry' whenever I want it!
ingredients: 1 400g tin of full fat coconut milk
1 jar of your fav curry paste
ingredients-original: 1 400g tin of full fat coconut milk

recipes.title: Peach Melba Meringue Roulade
recipes.description: Escoffier, a famous French chef, once designed a dish with peaches, raspberries and ice cream for the great Australian opera singer Nelly Melba. We've taken this inspiration and adapted it into a gorgeous summer dessert of meringue roulade. Light, airy, impressive and very sweet!

recipes.title: Tahini Banana Bread
recipes.description: Sorry, Barry, this recipe is not for you hehe Howeveeeer, if you are a banana lover, like me, then you will absolutely adore this! I posted a picture of this loaf a few days ago on my instagram, the recipe was in the caption, but I thought I'd share here anyway. If you never tasted tahini before in your life, then you are missing out, my friend. It's a sesame seed paste, quite bitter on it's own (even though I love it that way), very nutty and rich, which I find that complements this cake so so well. The taste is not overpowering at all, but you can definitely feel it in the background, besides adding a great texture, keeping it soft and moist.
ingredients: 4 Bananas (make sure they are very ripe)
ingredients-original: 4 Bananas (make sure they are very ripe)

recipes.title: Thai Spiced Calamari
recipes.description: I know I'm still in France, but I found this recipe in the notes on my phone so I thought I'd share it with you guys before I get home (it's been a while since I've done a new recipe). If you've ever been to Busaba Eatthai in the UK, this is my take on their calamari with black pepper (with a bit of help from an online recipe!). Hope you guys enjoy, this is seriously the ultimate calamari recipe
ingredients: Roughly 2-3 tbsp Green Peppercorns, pickled in water
ingredients-original: Roughly 2-3 tbsp Green Peppercorns, pickled in water

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Cups
recipes.description: Not only is the rich, smooth peanut butter and chocolate mousse to die for... but it's served in edible chocolate crockery. Yeah, you're going to want to try this!

recipes.title: Moules Marinieres
recipes.description: Want a reminder of the ultimate holiday food, without the expense of the euro? Then make this classic dish... it's top French Fast Food!

recipes.title: Chilli Tuna Linguine
recipes.description: On those desperate nights when you've not had a chance to shop and need a quick meal for one, then this tasty and healthy meal is a life-saver. It uses nothing but cheap store cupboard ingredients that can always be on hand.

recipes.title: Prawn And Pea Penne Pasta

recipes.title: Chinese 5Spice Beef  Cucumber Salad

recipes.description: Recipe from https://www.verybestbaking.com/recipes/18476/original-nestle-toll-house-chocolate-chip-cookies/

recipes.title: Piripiri Chicken Recipe

recipes.title: White Choc And Peanut Butter Sundae
recipes.description: Because I'm a peanut butter loving bozo. White chocolate isn't bad either.

recipes.title: Crab Cakes
recipes.description: So you want to impress that special someone, but don't want it to look like you've tried too hard or to make it all too formal.... then this is the answer. Zesty crab cakes with a homemade sweet chilli sauce makes an amazing meal.

recipes.title: Duck Breast With Smoked Mash
recipes.description: Do you really enjoy those autumnal, rich and impressive dishes on restaurant menus but don't think you can recreate them at home? Well this "Pan-fried Duck Breast" has a couple of cheats to make that possible.

recipes.title: Bomboloni
recipes.description:
Bomboloni are what some would call doughnuts or fried dough, but it sounds so much better to say it Italian way!
 (Bomb-Bow-low-knee!)

recipes.title: Bangers And Sweet Potato Mash
recipes.description: This is totally different to your average bangers and mash. Serving it all up on a board right on the table is a must!

recipes.title: Pull Apart Pizza

recipes.title: Salted Vanilla Bean Cookies
recipes.description: Okay, I gotta say, regular sugar cookies were always too much of a fuss for me to even bother making, if I'm not giving them away, but I do have to admit that I love their clean, honest flavor, that pairs with any drink and any frosting you'd like. This is a much, MUCH easier version, very quick, no rolling and cutting dough out involved, just scooping, flattening and baking. Since, in Brazil, I can't find a good vanilla extract anywhere (and I simply refuse to use the essence), I decided to go the extra mile and use a vanilla bean, but you can always switch it for 1 tbsp of a good quality vanilla extract, or maybe 1/2 tbsp of vanilla paste, it's up to you. The fleur de sal on top is what makes these cookies for me, the salty contrast with the sweet cookie is truly delicious, I made a batch without it and I have to tell you, it wasn't the same. So if you can splurge on the fancy stuff, I highly recommend.
ingredients: 150 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.
Fleur de sal (to sprinkle on top)
ingredients-original: 150 g Butter, unsalted and room temp.
Fleur de sal (to sprinkle on top)

recipes.title: Egg Surprise
recipes.description: If you want to make use of the leftovers knocking about in the bottom of the fridge then this is it... Egg Surprise! The surprise I hear you ask? Whatever odds and ends you can find in the fridge. Eggs are versatile enough to accommodate most things!

recipes.description: Fish and chips is a great tradition in the UK and nothing beats a portion, freshly cooked and served in newspaper by the seafront. Our version uses a crispy beer-batter and twice fried chips to give the perfect results.

recipes.title: Moroccan Tagine

ingredients-original: 1 kg lamb leg or shoulder, boned

recipes.title: Lasagne
recipes.description: Lasagne is never easy or practical to make for one. Best saved for family meals or dinner with friends. Unless of course you make and freeze! This recipe (with an extra shortcut/cheat for the white sauce) means you can make individual portions.

recipes.title: Homemade Pizza
recipes.description:
We have a lot of pizza recipes but this one is our original, bog standard, go-to recipe when we want to quickly cook our takeaway favourite. Trust us when we say there's not much better than a homemade pizza!

We'll show you how to make a base from scratch and leave it to you to choose the toppings. Remember cheese. Lots of cheese.

recipes.title: Hot Mocha Ice Cream Float
recipes.description: Health warning: As much as you want to drink all of this on your own, please share with mates for your own safety!

recipes.title: Pork With Cheesy Polenta

recipes.title: Crustless Quiche

recipes.title: Baked Coconut Cake
recipes.description: This is one of the simplest, yet most satisfying, coconut puddings ever. Inspired by SORTEDfood Brasil! So simple in fact, that Barry insisted he could do it blindfolded! (So please excuse the mess!)

recipes.title: Roast Beef And Yorkshire Pudding
recipes.description: Roast dinner on a Sunday is a true sign of comfort family food. If you need tips on how to get the perfect yorkshire puddings, best crispy roast potatoes or beef that melts in your mouth then look no further.

recipes.title: Brigacake
recipes.description: This was the most watched recipe from SORTEDfood Brasil... a brilliant idea of combining a moist Brazilian carrot cake with the national sweet treat... Brigadeiro! A real crowd pleaser!

recipes.title: Arroz Doce
recipes.description: Sweet rice pudding is delicious... And we've done a few recipes before (an awesome chocolate one for example) but this version by Carol and Duca on SORTEDfood Brasil is beautifully simple and doesn't even require a stove top!

recipes.title: Thai Roast Chicken
recipes.description: This is a brilliant twist on the classic family roast chicken dinner and perfect for a Big Night In in with mates. Mix it up! An aubergine and sweet potato curry and spicy papaya salad are the perfect match for a whole roast chicken.

recipes.title: Rocky Road
recipes.description: Are you tempted by those yummy looking slices in Starbucks but can't justify another couple of quid? Why not make a whole slab of the stuff for about a fiver. Plenty for the whole week.

recipes.title: Roasted Banana Bread
recipes.description:
There are a few reasons as to why this is the best and most indulgent banana bread recipe on the internet. First up is because YOU guys helped us cook it! 

The key here is to roast the bananas and soak the raisins in a hearty helping of rum. Absolutely gorgeous with a cup of coffee for a mid afternoon snack- you just can't beat homemade banana loaf.

recipes.title: Calzone
recipes.description:
The mother of all calzones... This recipe boasts a gorgeous pizza dough encasing any number of fillings... simply pick a favourite! This particular one is vegetarian! We went for spinach, mozzarella, mushrooms, artichokes plenty of parmesan and a nice runny egg. 

It's probably our favourite Big Night In recipe to date because we got to share it with all of London! You guys cooked along with us proving that SORTEDfood truly have the greatest community in the world.

recipes.title: Spanish Tortillas
recipes.description: The Spanish tortilla is one of Spain's tapas staples and is something I pleasantly discovered during my recent travels to the country. Using a recipe recommended by Lauren, the founder of Devour Spain, which run food tours in Madrid, Barcelona and Seville, this is an easy recipe for Spanish tortillas to make at home (Here's the link to the recipe I based this off of - http://spanishsabores.com/2012/06/30/best-spanish-omelet-recipe/). It turned out to be super delicious...just be careful on the flipping! ;)

recipes.title: Salmon En Croute
recipes.description: A great looking fish supper that can be prepared ahead and baked off when required. Perfect for dinner parties, it's simple, tasty and showy. Served with a white wine cream sauce and some beautifully seasonal asparagus.
ingredients: 1 sheets ready to roll puff pastry
ingredients-original: 1 sheets ready to roll puff pastry

recipes.title: Nutella Buttercream Frosting
recipes.description: Creamy, fluffy, sweet nutella buttercream frosting. Pipe it onto cupcakes, slather it onto a cake or -- you know pipe it right into your mouth?

recipes.title: Squid In Brandy Cream
recipes.description: You want to cook something with seafood but are scared that it's tricky or expensive? Then squid with brandy and cream is for you.

recipes.title: Poppy Seed Cake With Chocolate And Rum
recipes.description: For all the poppy seed lovers out there. It's simple, it's juicy, it's delicious.

recipes.title: Steak And Barnaise Sauce
recipes.description: If you had to list 5 classic dishes that you always see on pub and restaurant menus, then steak is almost guaranteed to be on that list. A good quality steak is an age old classic that, if cooked well, never fails to please.
ingredients: 1 handful cherry tomatoes, on the vine if poss
ingredients-original: 1 handful cherry tomatoes, on the vine if poss

recipes.title: Red Pepper Risotto
recipes.description: Does your risotto ever end up naff and stodgey? Then watch the video to see how to knock one out, step by step, making it perfect everytime.

recipes.title: Israelstyle Chocolate Truffles
recipes.description: When you think of a chocolate truffle , you probably think of the big chunk of chocolate and cream ganache. In Israel , kids (and adults) LOVE to eat and make the chocolate truffle but in a different way. We mix in crushed biscuits. The recipe is not long , but it takes time , and this is why the kids are loving to make chocolate balls (as we call them).

recipes.title: Strawberry Shortcake
recipes.description: Wimbledon is here and strawberries are at their very best. So make the most of them with this strawberry and white chocolate shortcake.

recipes.title: Strawberry Champers
recipes.description: Summer has nearly gone already! But we're going to hold onto it for just a little longer with an amazing Berry Bellini. A sophisticated taste of summer - it's refreshing, delicious and makes any occasion special!

recipes.title: Cinnamonbun Wreath
recipes.description: Today we're celebrating cinnamon-bun day here in Sweden, and since that is my absolute favorite 'fika' I baked some wreaths to share with my family. The cinnamon bun was created after the WW1 when the restrictions of butter, sugar and eggs were lifted and has a big part in the Swedish history (and also, it taste like heaven)
ingredients: 150 g g room tempered butter (for filling)
1/2 cup brown sugar or nib sugar (for decoration)
ingredients-original: 150 g g room tempered butter (for filling)
1/2 cup brown sugar or nib sugar (for decoration)

recipes.title: Sweet N Sour Chicken
recipes.description: The nation's favourite Chinese chicken dish couldn't be easier or quicker to reproduce at home. Beat the takeaway, both on price and speed with SORTEDfood's recipe of sweet 'n' sour chicken.

recipes.title: Worlds Best Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: These sugar cookies are the perfect vehicle for royal icing, fun designs, kooky shapes and all around adorable-ness. Oh. And they are DEEEELICIOUS!
ingredients: 1 tbsp Vanilla Bean Paste (or other flavouring!)
ingredients-original: 1 tbsp Vanilla Bean Paste (or other flavouring!)

recipes.title: Sugar Cookie Royal Icing
recipes.description: This is the ultimate icing for my World's Best Sugar Cookies! It sets firm, allows you to make beautiful designs and patters, tastes great and is easy to make. This version of the recipe is way faster than the traditional egg white method!

recipes.title: Student Meals  Salsa Under 2 Per Person
recipes.description: I love this recipe, even when I'm not on a budget. But when I am, it becomes a very good way of staying full, as the tomatoes and onions give you a surprising amount of sustenance. Not only that, but it's also vegan! One lot of this fed me for a whole day for under £5, so you can't really go wrong with this. And if you don't fancy it for every meal, just refrigerate it and have it later!

recipes.title: Chicken Saag And Dal
recipes.description: When having mates over for a Big Night In so often a curry night is the first choice. These two curries are always winners, even if your guests aren't a big fan of spice. This week it's plenty for 6 people, as we'll be joined by our competition winners!

recipes.title: Sweet Potato And Spinach Curry
recipes.description: Curries are a fantastic way to get a good dose of fresh veg onto the dinner plate. Some curries are stewed away for ages but they don't have to be. This recipe turns vibrant and flavoursome ingredients like sweet potato and spinach into an epic feast.

recipes.title: Peppermint Buttercream
recipes.description: This makes a lot of icing! Mine covered a 6 layer cake with a little let over to ice a few cupcakes. The layers were my cupcake addictions chocolate mud cake and white chocolate and a vegan cookies and cream - let me know if you want the recipe :)

recipes.title: Tandoori Salmon
recipes.description: Are you a fan of Indian food but tend to find curries quite greasy? Do you always order the same old thing at an Indian Restaurant? Have you ever considered trying fish in a curry? This dish combats all of these.

recipes.title: Egg In Bread
recipes.description:
This beautifully simple breakfast idea opens up a world of opportunity and a flavour combinations... we create 3 to get you started... 
- Maple, bacon & thyme
- Mushroom, rosemary & truffle oil
- Avocado, sriracha, coriander and black sesame.

recipes.title: Crispy Golden Nuggets
recipes.description: This week we dived into the box and it made the lads a little squeamish. With an ingredient more associated with high-end French dining we took it upon ourselves to turn it on its head and served up an awesome British bar snack with pickled wild mushrooms. These are golden, crispy nuggets of delight… with the mystery ingredients hidden within! Watch to find out what it is and how we get on.

recipes.title: Thai Pot Noodle
recipes.description: Have you ever wondered whether you could re-create a pot noodle, but actually make it taste edible? This version tastes so amazingly fresh and vibrant, plus the bowl of authentic Thai flavours is virtually fat-free too!

recipes.title: Pesto Mussels
recipes.description: I love mussels, they always remind me of holiday food. They are cheap, satisfying and very versatile. I've done them with wine, cider, ale, tomato sauce and even coconut milk before... But this time I thought I'd try pesto! - Have had pesto on the brain all week thanks to rehearsing something very cool with the lads! ;)

recipes.title: Butter Chicken For 12
recipes.description: Served with raita, coriander and whole wheat naan - all in less than 30 mins! Recipe can be easily multiplied to number of people.

recipes.title: Tiramisu
recipes.description: Italy is just so sexy... their accents, cars, women, food, wine and they don't stop at dessert either. Tiramisu is a heavenly dessert combining strong coffee, alcohol and chocolate... a real pick me up!

recipes.title: Tropical Jelly
recipes.description:
Dietary requirements and food intolerances are an important consideration when cooking and this recipe has been put together at the request of a one of our loyal subscribers who is both a coeliac and lacto-intolerant.

A snazzy tropical dessert for a sp

recipes.title: Tupper Salads
recipes.description: Heading on a picnic or maybe a long journey and fancy making your own simple salads rather than resorting to extortionate service station prices? These tupper salads solve your problem.

recipes.title: Lasagna
recipes.description: Whether you spell it lasagna or lasagne, we can all agree it's an Italian classic, a family favourite and a real crowd pleaser. This recipe ticks all the right boxes at every level... the white sauce, the pasta and layers and of course the meat!

recipes.title: Vanilla Panna Cotta
recipes.description: Got someone you really need to impress but don't want to spend all night in the kitchen? This dessert can all be done the day before, but is sure to blow their socks off!

recipes.title: Icelandic Rye Bread
recipes.description: After a trip to Iceland, I discovered Icelandic rye bread, which is called Rúgbrauð, or Geysir bread, and is baked in the ground just below the surface for 24 hours. I attempted to re-create this bread in a low temperature oven at home! It turned out well. It's a sweet bread, but it's nice served warm with a salted butter. A long process, but a fun experiment to try and emulate nature. :)

recipes.title: Homemade Snickers Bar
recipes.description: Recreating confectionary and chocolate bars is good fun, because you know exactly what you're aiming for and are set out to better it on flavour! This one achieves that! A homemade snickers bar.

recipes.title: Lemon Tart
recipes.description: A stunning dessert is one that gets a wow... and this is so clean, so simple, so perfect that it always pleases! The balance of sweetness with tangy lemon filling and the rich crisp buttery base is the reason this dish is a winner!

recipes.title: Asparagus  Beetroot Salad
recipes.description: Salads are the perfect start to a romantic meal, but it's so easy for them to lack inspiration. This warm salad has sex appeal, a sophisticated combo of flavours and is still stupidly easy to cook.

recipes.title: Burrito
recipes.description: Burritos. Now these have become all the craze in the UK recently. Small Mexican Burrito stalls and shops popping up everywhere. It's really moreish and satisfying hand-held food and here is our version... perfect for when you've got a few mates over!

recipes.title: Chocolate Brownie
recipes.description: Chocolate brownie. THE ultimate sweet treat for friends or family. Here's is our original recipe from the early days of SORTEDfood which is perfect for beginners and cooking with kids. Dense, chocolatey and rich. Don't forget the smarties...

recipes.title: Chocolate Truffles
recipes.description: If you want to say 'I Love You' then there is no better way of doing it than with something you've made yourself. These chocolate truffles look amazing, taste incredible and show that you really care... but best of all, they won't cost you the earth.

recipes.title: Florentine Jacket Potato
recipes.description: If you're seeking real comfort food then it's obvious that a jacket potato is going to be hard to beat. But taken to this next level with a spinachy, cheesy and eggy filling it becomes irresistible. A great vegetarian option, healthy and delicious.

recipes.title: Fruit Custard Tart
recipes.description: Baking with pastry can be a little time-consuming.. but the end result is well worth it! It's a skill which is brilliant once you've cracked it! This homemade fruit custard tart (although we cheated with the custard!) brings amazing colour and fresh zingy
ingredients: 1/2 vanilla pod or a drop vanilla extract
ingredients-original: 1/2 vanilla pod or a drop vanilla extract

recipes.title: Ham And Mushroom Pie
recipes.description: Pies are fab... they can be just about anything! Sweet or savoury, bog-standard or dead sophisticated. So long as we steer clear of any Sweeny Todd recipes then you can't go wrong! This classic combination is brilliant... Ham and mushroom with a tradition

recipes.title: Kinder Bueno Cupcakes
recipes.description: Who doesn’t bloody-well-love a kinder bueno?! We certainly do, so we figured making our favourite chocolate bar into a cupcake was a foolproof idea. We took the 3 key components of a bueno (chocolate, the filling and wafer) and translated them into a chocolate cup cake with hazelnut frosting and wafer as decoration (to make them look all fancy).

recipes.title: Pinwheel Cookies
recipes.description: These great looking cookies are deceptively easy to create... vanilla and chocolate cleverly interlaced.

recipes.title: Special Fried Rice
recipes.description: This is always a common and popular choice when ordering from a chinese menu... we thought we'd share our version of this favourite that you can recreate at home.

recipes.title: Best Chocolate Chip Cookies In The World
recipes.description:
My mums homemade chocolate chip cookies have to be the best in the world, atleast in my family's opinion. 

In Sweden we have a thing called 'Ljus sirap' which translates to 'light syrup' which we use in a lot of sweets and treats. Living abroad it's defiantly something I miss. 

For these cookies the Swedish syrup would be ideal but golden syrup works aswell. The dough is just slightly more tacky.

recipes.title: Tuna Nicoise Salad
recipes.description: If it's a salad that you're after, but find they are rarely substantial enough to fill you up then perhaps you haven't tried this one. Without a leaf of lettuce in sight this dish is both fresh and tasty, not to mention impressive looking.

recipes.title: Baby Gingerbread Doughnuts With Cream Cheese Glaze
recipes.description:
Healthy baked doughnuts! Perfect for Christmas which is right around the corner! Makes 15-16 mini ones - or around 7-8 big ones (doughnut pan or maker required)
Recipe can be made vegan by using a flax or chia egg, subbing Greek yoghurt with soy or coconut yoghurt and toffuti vegan cream cheese for glaze

recipes.title: Chili Beef Nachos
recipes.description: Loaded nachos are the perfect food for a big night in. You've got a big pot of bubbling Texan chili con carne ladled over corn chips and scattered with cheese, sour cream, coriander and red onion. This particular chilli con carne is rich, thick, spicy and packed with flavour. It's great to feed a lot of people so invite your mates over for a beer, or two...

recipes.title: Chocolate Polenta Cake
recipes.description: Polenta is more commonly associated with savoury dishes, but sits perfectly within this chocolate treat to overcome the problems of cooking and sticking to dietary requirements.

recipes.title: Krleksmums Swedish Loveyummies
recipes.description: This is probably the unhealthiest thing ever, therefore it’s also probably the best tasting thing ever. We call them kärleksmums which translates to loveyummies, and I decided to bake a batch when I had some people over for fika. It combines a moist, fluffy sponge with a decadent coffee/chocolate frosting making it impossible to just eat one.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash Ravioli
recipes.description: Pasta is great and so readily available both dried and fresh in supermarkets. But have you ever tried making it yourself. It's not as tricky as you might think and can be great fun to get rolling with friends. This butternut squash filling makes for a fan

recipes.title: Spaghetti Marinara Hot Dog
recipes.description: This Italian inspired hotdog has to be my favourite creation yet!

recipes.title: Bnh Mi Hot Dog
recipes.description: A killer hot dog mixed with the flavours of a classic Vietnamese sandwich... Shall I take a bow (wow) now?!

recipes.title: Macarons
recipes.description: A dainty sweet treat that you can make dozens of and share with your friends. Beautiful French patisserie, made easier by using the SORTED method... skip the tricky boiling sugar stage but still bake light Macarons of all sorts of colours.

recipes.title: Pork Chop Recipe
recipes.description:
Pork chops is one of the most searched for recipes on the whole of the internet this year, so we thought, with your help, we'd come up with a brilliant option and flavour combination. 

Superb autumnal flavours and combos.

recipes.title: Bajastyle Fish Tacos
recipes.description: From the moment we all had these in LA from Ricky and his Fish Taco van we knew they had to become a Big Night In. The crispy battered fish, soft tacos, fresh pico de gallo and white sauce make for the perfect balance... and they're fun to construct at the table. DIY food!

recipes.title: Saffron Orange Chicken With Pomegranate
recipes.description: Today I had such cravings for 'lussebullar' which is a special saffron bun eaten around Lucia here in Sweden. But the tradition say that you can't eat them until the 13th of December so I decided to cook up this instead with the key-flavours of lussebullar. Its spicy and sweet and really warms you up an autumn evening like this!
ingredients: 8 inner filets of chicken, or 3 brast cut in half
ingredients-original: 8 inner filets of chicken, or 3 brast cut in half

recipes.title: Spiced Poached Pears
recipes.description: that goes great with deer or boar, but you can also serve it with a creme anglaise

recipes.title: Fig  Prosciutto Pizza
recipes.description: Pizza with figs, toms, prosciutto, mozzarella, rosemary and balsamic.

recipes.title: Jackolantern Pumpkin Hand Pies
recipes.description: Mini pumpkin pies shaped shaped like Jack-o-lanterns!
ingredients: 250 g unsalted butter, chilled and cubed (pastry)
150 g light brown sugar, extra for sprinkling
ingredients-original: 250 g unsalted butter, chilled and cubed (pastry)
150 g light brown sugar, extra for sprinkling

recipes.title: Perfect French Toast
recipes.description: This is what weekends are made for... a brunch like this is bliss! We baked our own brioche, but you can get hold of any decent loaf and go from there.

recipes.title: Swedish Chocolate Brownie
recipes.description: Kladdkaka is another name for this Swedish chocolate brownie. It's divine! A must try for your baking list. A gooey centre and crusty brownie edge all served with sea salt, creme fraiche and macerated berries. It's the ultimate chocco dessert.

recipes.title: Lime Curd And Poppy Seed Ice Cream
recipes.description: Okay, I know it's fall/winter in most parts of the world right now, but here in Brazil is FULL ON SUMMER! And by "full on" I mean "boiling freaking hot and we'll probably all die melted". Anyway, with all these crazy heat waves, I knew an ice cream recipe was coming. You might think that, after my last no churn ice cream recipe, I would've gotten a machine by now..... yeah, no :D And even though this has eggs on the base (and not condensed milk, like the other one), it is still crazy creamy and easy to make, it just takes a while. Also, let's just all stop to celebrate the fact that I'VE FOUND THE POPPY SEEDS!!! I know, I cannot contain myself here. Well, if you want to see more photos and some more crazy talk, go to my website (link in bio) and check it out!
ingredients: 70 g (a little over 1/3 cup) Butter, unsalted, room temp. and diced
1 tbsp Poppy seeds (you can add more, if you’d like)
ingredients-original: 70 g (a little over 1/3 cup) Butter, unsalted, room temp. and diced
1 tbsp Poppy seeds (you can add more, if you’d like)

recipes.title: Banana Bread Granola
recipes.description: Another week, another granola. This one is amazing. I've been doing two batches this week and I am still as obsessed. Healthy, tasty and It makes the whole kitchen smell like banana bread. Works best when the bananas is somewhere between bananas and compost, aka really dark and ripe.

recipes.title: Limoncello Treats
recipes.description: These are the perfect little treats that just taste of sunshine! Ideal as a small sweet dessert to finish off a meal or even just as a light snack during the hot summer months.

recipes.title: Salsa And Guacamole Dips
recipes.description: Such simple and fresh dips to share with friends when served up in front of a good film or with a few drinks. Perfect social party food.

recipes.title: Breakfast Parfait  Vanilla And Rhubarb
recipes.description: Perfect for hot summer mornings here in Australia - I make my stewed rhubarb a day or two before so it can be nice and cold from the fridge. Basically tastes like a rhubarb crumble but so much easier and quicker. Rhubarb is a vegetable right?????? Can be made vegan using vegan granola and yoghurt :)

recipes.title: Hummus
recipes.description: Hummus is absolutely perfect for a party... something that everyone can all dig into and enjoy. We'd given this one a go with two versions, a traditional method using dried chickpeas and a cheat's version using tinned chickpeas. Chose your favourite and give it a go!
ingredients: 400 g tin of chickpeas (if not using dried)
1 bunch of fresh parsley, to serve
ingredients-original: 400 g tin of chickpeas (if not using dried)
1 bunch of fresh parsley, to serve

recipes.title: Chicken Noodle Soup And Matzo Balls
recipes.description: Following a recipe request from Matt Lucas, the SORTED crew cook up a very traditional and healthy bowl of chicken noodle soup. With the addition of matzo balls this becomes a traditional Jewish dish, just like his mum used to make.

recipes.title: Lemon Fizz Smoothie Bowl
recipes.description: So I fell in love with a similar smoothie @ Naked Juice Bar when I was in Malmö two weekends ago. Since then I've worked hard on recreating it on my own, and I think I'm finally there. Smooth banana, tangy lemon and amazing toppings makes a perfect breakfast :)

recipes.title: Lentil And Fish Curry
recipes.description: Inspired by Indian chef Atul Kochhar, the SORTED crew set about cooking a simple yet authentic and tasty fish curry. Healthier than most, the use of lentils provides a filling consistency. It's cheap, tasty and when served with the equally simple pilau rice and fresh toasted cumin salad makes a feast fit for a king.

recipes.title: Churros
recipes.description:
Deep fryer required! Serve with chocolate sauce and voila you're basically in Spain
- no need to proof dough so it's quick and easy :)

recipes.title: Banoffee Cupcakes
recipes.description: Cupcakes are massively popular. Trendy, cute baking that puts a smile on everyone's face. Combine this with an idiot proof recipe and the classic combination of banana and toffee and these cupcakes are a real winner.

recipes.title: Banana Pancakes
recipes.description: Easiest pancake recipe in this entire world

recipes.title: Baby Choc Hazelnut Doughnuts
recipes.description: Makes 20 baby doughnuts - or around 6ish big doughnuts - doughnut pan required

recipes.title: Leek And Butterbean Fish Dish
recipes.description: When it comes to mid-week meals they don't get much simpler or quicker than this recipe... so much so that student money save and student finance advice site studentbeans.com has made it their signature dish!

recipes.title: Fruit Doughnut Sliders
recipes.description:
After encountering a peach 'donut slider' in Atlanta, Georgia on our #LostandHungry tour we had to replicate them. Of course ours are British, so they're 'Doughnut Sliders'! :p

Filled with ricotta and honey, then either... apple, blackberry and cinnamon... pear, orange and thyme... or plum, vanilla and ginger!

recipes.title: Fudgy Popcorn Balls
recipes.description: Everybody knows the tradition of Trick or Treat. Why not make some homemade treats this year for those who come knocking... or just for your friends and family. From the same basic and cheap ingredients this produces 3 different sweet treats!

recipes.title: Oresome Sticky Toffee Brownies
recipes.description: The secret ingredient in these brownies? Oreos! Such an indulgent treat. I love the texture of the chewy brownies with the silky sauce & crunch of the oreos.

recipes.title: Omelette 2 Ways
recipes.description: An omelette is always a saviour recipe. One that is simple, quick and cheap to cook as and when. You can throw whatever you like into it and it's pretty difficult to get it wrong.

recipes.title: New Cake In A Mug
recipes.description: In association with Macmillan Cancer Support we've dug out the recipe for one of our most popular videos to date, our cappuccino cake in a mug, and given it a new twist.
